author: {'steamid': '76561198843673365', 'num_games_owned': 36, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 8223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8223, 'last_played': 1622960954}
review:
I wish I could recommend this game because it was my first "good" dinosaur game, but I can't.
Bad trust and spending issues have led to a lack of updates and broken promises.
The website is still incredibly misleading, showing a host of "playable dinosaurs" that aren't playable in game and likely never will be as the team is now entirely volunteer, monthly updates have stopped, and features "coming soon" never seem to actually arrive.

It's a real shame to watch other dinosaur games that have come so far and to have been excited for this one's different spin (boasting scientific accuracy), only to have it fall so far short when it's had so much longer to develop. 

Littered with bugs and repetitive game play, go find another game to play. There are a lot of options anymore.

Bight side is, the soundtrack is nice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110521345', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 782, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 782, 'last_played': 1698170876}
review:
Le jeu pourrait être vraiment exceptionnel mais j'ai trouvé plus de points négatifs que de positif.
+ Réalisme des dinos, croissance, comportements des animaux.

- Succès bugués (j'ai du refaire 7 parties pour débloquer un succès qui ne voulait pas venir)
- monde vide
- graphismes du monde pas foufou, bugs au niveau de l'éclairage, sol relativement vide
- très très peu d'espèces jouables ou croisables en jeu
- en développement depuis très longtemps donc j'ai peur que le potentiel magnifique du jeu ne soit jamais atteint

author: {'steamid': '76561198062451834', 'num_games_owned': 431, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1671304999}
review:
I don't really recommend this game at all. I've gotten the game when it was on Kickstarter and the progress became incredibly slow. Great concept, great idea but poorly executed and at this point feel like money grabber. Even if they are still developing, this game out in 2017 and it's 2024. So like 7 years, they only gotten the Trike to become playable. 

There also several bug issue with the game. Like unable to eat or drink at times, even there water right in front of my face. You born/hatch/whatever with parents but they don't really do much at all and AI kind of broken in my opinion. I want to give it a chance but it's hard to give something a chance when game been given up. Maybe because of competition from other Dino Based games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122186735', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1707641657}
review:
Пока рано что говорить. Видно, что игра далека от завершения, но разработчики явно стараются. Как палеонтолога, меня подкупает стремление добиться реализма без погони за хайпом и кучей однотипных моделек динозавров. Тут не Парк Юрского Периода с дикой смесью существ из разных эпох. Тут попытка реконструировать конкретную экосистему. Пока кривенько, но играбельно и есть надежда на достойное развитие. Не жалею монеток на поддержку столь благородной цели.

Покупать пока только ради поддержки. Контента для игры ещё очень мало.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106497859', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1704576439}
review:
No.. don't buy Saurian in it's current state.

I've been following this on and off since their first kickstarter, it showed a lot of promise at the time.
Despite the mixed reviews (now [i]mostly negative[/i] as of writing), i tried giving the top positive reviews the benefit of the doubt for how long this has been out. I'm not sure how the people who have positive views on this game got anywhere? In less than an hour that i played, it just throws you into the deep end on an unfinished map ..and things will easily and quickly kill you, be it AI you're meant to hunt or your hunger. heck, even running by and accidentally touching the tail of an unprovoked dinosaur will also make you die unexpectedly. Just a whole lotta nothing going on in it.

Right now the only good thing about the game is looking at the models, that's about it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198271555773', 'num_games_owned': 49, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 946, 'last_played': 1689751481}
review:
El concepto de crear un simulador de dinosaurio realista y enfocado en un jugador es genial ya que la mayoría de juegos de dinosaurios como The Isle están enfocados en el multijugador online, pero es evidente que este juego nunca abandonará el estado de acceso anticipado y muy posiblemente no puedan ni añadir al Rex.

Hoy en día no lo recomiendo a no ser que seas un "friki" de los dinosaurios y te guste jugar con el triceratops y el raptor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108515793', 'num_games_owned': 323, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1005, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1005, 'last_played': 1664849351}
review:
Seven years of early access, way behind in schedule and no more dev logs. Game is being developed solely by a small team of volunteers. 

I backed the kickstarter way back when it was just an idea. I expected it to take time, it was ambitious. 

They received a decent chunk of funding (a good amount of which was ‘lost’ due to some drama), and have practically nothing to show for it. 

The dev logs were never particularly exciting either, showing some scientifically accurate plants or maybe a growth morph if we were lucky. Those are gone now anyways. 

But as of 7 years there’s only 2 playables, an empty map with lifeless AI, nothing to do but walk and hope you don’t die. Hunting is atrociously boring or difficult, no proper tutorials and their “scientific accuracy” defense is getting exhausting considering they have to keep playing catch up with rapid discoveries which slows down their already snail paced development time.  

Don’t waste your time, I really wanted this game to thrive but it’s not worth money.

review: Osobiście uważam że gra fajna. Może i ma mało do zaoferowania, ale sądzę, że warto jej poświęcić uwagę. Warto pooglądać przed kupnem i się zastanowić ponieważ jak już mówiłem gra ma mało rzeczy. Trzeba powiedzieć, że jest to pre-alpha. Twórcy niestety chyba jej nie rozwijają mimo tego można się bawić przy niej dobrze. Teraz rzeczy, które powinny zostać dodane: tyranozaur i pachycefalozaur jako grywalne gatunki, większa mapa (zróżnicowanie biomów oraz jej powiększenie), ogólne poprawienie AI pod wieloma względami, tryb multiplayer oraz poprawienie grafiki.

author: {'steamid': '76561199149326746', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 6, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1711931043}
review:
For a game that claims to be the most accurate dinosaur game ever made, it's terrible with accuracy. For one, dakotaraptor isn't a valid genus anymore. Two, the pachycephalosaurus was an omnivore with binocular vision, and the whole 'pachy growth stage' theory is starting to fall apart after the discovery of a baby pachy dome and the fact that pachy would not have long horns as a baby just for them to vanish, and the head would not be totally flat either. Tyrannosaurus did not have feathers, it was much too large and would have overheated. Also, the graphics are terrible- looks like a mobile game on max. You are 'born' into the game with no tutorial or objective, so you just kinda wander around waiting for something to happen. Joke of a game, play Path of Titans for accurate animals or The Isle for true hardcore realism, as this is not it.

P.S. - 'Saur; does not mean 'saurian', it means lizard. This means name translating would not be 'tyrant saurian', but 'tyrant lizard'. Istg. The people who made this were fools... :/

author: {'steamid': '76561197964247435', 'num_games_owned': 3508, 'num_reviews': 293, 'playtime_forever': 2106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2034, 'last_played': 1709411688}

author: {'steamid': '76561198325795178', 'num_games_owned': 197, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1703182561}
review:
Не рекомендую данную игру к покупке. В ней вы найдёте много жирных минусов и не более ничего интересного. И так начнём.

1) Просто отвратительная и плохо выполненная графика. Да же с игровым пк у вас очень плохо будет выглядеть мир. Текстуры и модели динозавров плохо прорисованы и  не проработаны.
2) Анимации передвижения очень корявые и не плавные.
3) Игра в соло в режиме ботов.
4) На выбор всего 4 вида динозавров, в то время как в игре вы можете встретить на много больше.
5) Боты ведут себя не естественно по отношению к угрозам. На пример просто стоят на месте или плавают по кругу в реке у берега.
6) В игре отсутствует русский язык. А гайды к управлению только для хищников.
7) Пища у травоядных только низко росшие папоротники.
8) Управление оставляет желать лучшего. Чтобы поесть надо несколько раз нажимать ЛКМ. С водой куда проще.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043359030', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 934, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1703981818}
review:
AS a triceratops the game is fun, as a raptor No there's never any food or lizards when I play the raptor and I can't eat my siblings for some reason. as a Tric I have stepped on so many lizards and baby crocs or maybe those are lizards too. Seen so many more creatures as a Tric eaten all the veggies. 

raptor-> starvation game Tric->eating game

author: {'steamid': '76561198106129508', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2146, 'last_played': 1611658247}
review:
This is a very mild endorsement, I must add. I had very high hopes for this game, but I honestly don't believe at this point that it's ever going to be finished. The developers were passionate at the start, but they took on more work than they realistically could complete, and now it seems all enthusiasm for it has died, and it's only being worked on part time, if at all.

That being said, I have enjoyed playing this game. It's visually beautiful, the music and sound design is good, the dinosaurs move and sound believable, although the gameplay is pretty bare bones at the moment. There's not much to do, but I have played as a dakotaraptor from hatchling to adulthood several times at this point, and had fun with it as a sort of casual, relaxing gaming experience when I need to wind down. Currently there's only two playable dinosaurs; the dakotaraptor and the triceratops, and the dakotaraptor is definitely the more fun one, as you need to hunt in order to survive, in addition to avoiding dangers. When you play as a triceratops, you just eat plants and avoid dangers, with the latter becoming pretty much nonexistent after you've reached a certain size, and eating plants isn't very engaging.

The price should definitely be lowered, in my opinion, especially since not a single developer is even working on it full-time at this point, so it's not like this is their livelihood or anything.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079448472', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 890, 'last_played': 1631923018}
review:
I love dinosaurs, and I desperately want a singleplayer "live as a dinosaur" game, but I just can't recommend this one for several reasons.

1) Glacial pace of development. After 6 years of EA, we still only have 2 out of 4 of the promised playable dinos. The last truly major update was the nesting update almost a year-and-a-half ago.

2) Scientific accuracy. Despite being one of Saurian's main selling points, its science gets more outdated by the year. Paleontologists are now almost certain T. rex had scales, not feathers. Yes, I know the devs are "working on" this, so see point 1 above. Also, it's looking more and more like "Dakotaraptor" isn't a valid genus, so having a Dakotaraptor in the game would be like having a Troodon in the game (hardcore dino fans know why this is blasphemy for anything priding itself on scientific accuracy).

3) Fun. This game just isn't fun. It's trying to be a survival game, but it's just a glorified walking simulator with no challenge and little to do aside from take in the (admittedly beautiful) landscapes. And I know a game like this can be fun and challenging since Wolf Quest exists.

author: {'steamid': '76561198802862433', 'num_games_owned': 20, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1699180513}

author: {'steamid': '76561198094742538', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1511219154}
review:
There is no point in buying this game. It will never be finished. Dinosaur games have a curse on them.

I kickstarted it back as an early project, I remember sitting in dev streams etc. Even looking back the stretch goals and start goals promised were no were near realistic given the scope of the team...

Anyway - if you manage to run this poorly optimised mess you'll be treated to a whole lot of nothing to do. Instead of focusing on a few solid dinos, the teams decided to try and push for 6 in total so none have any depth to them. The hyper focus on realism (much of which is now outdated since the game launched) is commendable but the game lacks robust systems to make surviving engaging with a fun feedback loop. 

If you want a science based animal game, try wolfquest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198268053867', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2009, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2009, 'last_played': 1685579964}
review:
I've had this game about six years, short after its release gained traction. In those six years they added another playable and only small quality of life updates with no real progress. The game is very interesting for the first couple of hours, but stagnates quickly with no gameplay variety (a plague of animal simulator games like this, really unfortunate). It's worth only a fraction of the price tag with development slowing even further with fewer and more part time developers. 

I recommend Wolfquest: AE if you're looking for a captivating animal survival simulator. Not dinosaurs, but the best in the genre I've seen.

Triceratops is pretty easy and chill to play as, but still similar to using raptor. Just slower and with a herd mechanic. author: {'steamid': '76561198005923996', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1694675187}
review: Absolute garbage. They tried for realism, but last time I checked, if a carnivore bit it's prey on the tail... the carnivore lived through that. Usually the bite hurt the prey. Definitely didn't kill the carnivore. So there's that. Let's talk about your dino parents... yeah, that about sums it up. Nothing. They're useless. No point in the hatchling stage except to starve you since you can't actually eat anything. Great way to begin your life. Oh and if you play as a dakotaraptor, good luck. Rules and guidelines say to be polite. That's about as polite as I can get about this one. It's garbage and I can see why it hasn't really been touched in a long time. Usually trash gets thrown away never to be seen again, but this seems to linger.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122845435', 'num_games_owned': 27, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1694219723}
review:
This game has unfortunately been disappointing.
I love the idea of a RPG that is not a MMO.

However I haven't played in a few years and this game is still missing a few things to make it fun (to me).
1. Smarter parent AI or starting older to take care of yourself so you don't starve.
2. More small AI to take care of yourself.
3. Lower graphics settings or optimized better to play smoother.

I hope to return in a few more years to a game that is fun to play, but playing The Isle on a solo server would be more rewarding than this.

BTW I only have 4 hours in this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060317104', 'num_games_owned': 489, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1694125855}

author: {'steamid': '76561198031250923', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1657568439}
review:
Saurian is a very mixed bag depending on what bugs you run into and what kind of games you prefer

For example, if you like running around and occasionally finding other dinosaurs while you SLOOOOOWLY grow up then this game is for you.

Why is this a positive review, you may ask? Because I happen to enjoy walking simulators almost as much as I love Dinosaurs. However....

The hunting is basically just running in circles and biting things until you spend around 2-4 hours on the game and become an adult, when you can hunt bigger creatures. If you're being attacked by a T-Rex(Which is pretty much the only naturally hostile creature in the game aside from a venomous lizard) then you can easily run away as it's probably one of the slowest creatures in the game.

The parenthood aspect in the game is pretty good although it does glitch sometimes when you're the Dakota-raptor, making your mate attack you and your baby.

There are currently only two playable dinosaurs, the Dakota-raptor and the Triceratops. Triceratops has a bunch of confusing herd mechanics that I couldn't really understand, and the Dakota-raptor is basically without any parents from the moment it's born.

I do enjoy this game, however. And I believe that in time when it has more playable dinosaurs it'll be way better

author: {'steamid': '76561199225356552', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1467, 'last_played': 1707533945}
review:
Suarian is a dinosaur survival simulation game that tries to accurately portray real dinosaurs based in Hell Creek
Its pretty barebones at the moment, but i have high hopes for it being a great and one of the best dinosaur survival game.
The current features of the game are; 2 playable dinos (One herbivore and one carnivore) that have unique features
You start as a baby and try to grow up to an adult, and depending on your species, you can be a solo Dakota raptor, hunting to survive, while raising your own little raptors and defending your nest, or a triceratops traveling with a herd, grazing bushes and avoiding predators and scaring off other herbivores
The AI is a little lacking, but its only early access, and it has pretty good graphics.
I give this game a 8.9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198037529965', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 630, 'last_played': 1644455876}
review:
Game development within the last many years has slowed to an absurdly slow speed with no hope for much development in the future. With the lead running off, money being taken from one of the higher-up developers, money being lost to R.J. As of now, it's a passion project with developers slowly becoming inactive and outright leaving. The game itself is in a state where its extremely boring and unfulfilling, alongside being poorly optimized. 
It *had* promising concepts early on that would give challenges to survival, though don't expect them to ever (or at least soon) to come.

author: {'steamid': '76561198389640481', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 244, 'playtime_forever': 1231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 841, 'last_played': 1692040816}
review:
Before I start, I precise that I have played just the raptor campaign so far, since I prefer the thrilling life of predators and raptors are amongst my favorite dinos. That said, I think this game is a very solid dinosaur life simulator, that captured me for several details that present a remarkable level of realism and immersion. First, all the creatures are exceptionally well modeled, and scientifically very accurate, in all their smallest details. Second, I feel I clearly experienced what it means to be a growing predator who has to survive and thrive in an unforgiving environment full of potentially deadly animals. You start as a hatchling who can afford just very small and harmless preys, but, if you have petience and manage to understand when exactly you can afford something bigger, you can grow up till the size of a mature adult, who can take down almost any medium-sized creature, and fear nothing but the largest animals like the Triceratops and of course the T-rex. This is not an action game, and does not offer a true goal beyond simple survival, but I had a great time with it, and I certainly recommend it to all dino-lovers who want to experience an entertaining adventure that is also totally up-to-date with respect to the most recent paleontological discoveries.
Cheers guys!

author: {'steamid': '76561198368697488', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1962, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1452, 'last_played': 1693942357}

author: {'steamid': '76561198002232440', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 10149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10136, 'last_played': 1691092360}
review:
Saurian is a very interesting game. You can probably tell from my avatar that I have a bit of a bias for this game, but I'll try to be as fair as I can be. Firstly Saurian is far from finished, it's still in Alpha and that means the game is not quite optimized and weird bugs crop up at times. Despite the lack of optimization the game is visually stunning, each animal and plant is rendered in loving detail with regards to scientific accuracy, aesthetics, and readability in game play. Cretaceous Montana has never before been depicted in such a true to life manner, the only other form of dinosaur media that matches Saurian is Prehistoric Planet. It's refreshing to see dinosaurs depicted as animals rather than monsters.

The game play is relatively simple, you are a dinosaur. As such the objectives of the game are based on simple animal drives; finding food, staying hydrated, avoiding predators, and ultimately finding a mate to pass on your genes. There is no grander narrative or objective to the game. This simplicity combined with the games beautiful visuals lend a zen-like quality to the game and I think this game is best enjoyed in a manner similar to games like Abzu or Journey. This isn't to say that the game isn't violent or terrifying, but those things emerge naturally from the interactions within the ecosystem rather than out of crafted setpieces.

If you're looking to play an episode of Prehistoric Planet then I can't recommend this game enough, but if you're looking for something more like Skull Island then I'd suggest looking elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198241677428', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3818, 'last_played': 1691090901}
review:
타게임인 디ㅁ일이나 패ㅁ타 비ㅁ버 등등에 비하면 많이 부족합니다. 다만 언급한 pvp겜에서 내 실력이 불안한데 혼자서 ai들 상대로 전투 실력을 키우고싶다던가 나의 성향이 평화주의에 가깝고 맵이나 ai동물들을 구경하면서 힐링하는걸 좋아한다하면 어느정도는 추천할 게임. ai들이 매우 단조롭고 패턴이랄게 없어서 뒤잡기도 쉽고 랩터의 달라 붙는 기술또한 어느 타이밍에 뛰어내려야 안전할수 있을지 등등 아주 기본적인 실력을 키우기엔 나쁘지않다고 생각하는 게임 입니다. 개발자의 목적이 자연속에서 정말 동물들처럼 자연스럽게 ai의 틀을 만드는게 목적인 만큼 처절한 생존게임이나 자극적인 플레이 자체가 거의 없다보니 맘 편하게 컨트롤 연습도 하고 힐링도 할수있지만 강력하게 추천하진 않습니다. pvp 성향이 안 맞고 무서운데 이런 공룡 게임은 해보고싶을때 조금 맛만 보자 하는 생각으로 구매해보는게 좋을거 같아요.

+ 솔직히 말하면 재미없고 많이 아쉬운 게임이지만 이젠 정들어서 그러려니 하는중이고요.. 그냥 하지마세요. 더 좋은겜 많아요..

author: {'steamid': '76561199122378687', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 581, 'last_played': 1687561610}
review:
I want to love this game so much, I really do. It has SO much potential, but it also gets boring quite fast, mostly due to a lack of features. I haven't been playing it for a long time but I saw people in the reviews that were complaining that it hasn't gotten many updates since it came out. I get that it's hard to make updates especially when the game isn't too well known, but it just doesn't have enough interesting aspects that make me want to play it. It's sad because it's one of the only dinosaur games that's not awful and unrealistic, but it has its own problems

I also wish Steam had a better rating system, there are parts of this game that are really fun and entertaining so I don't entirely not recommend it, so I'm neutral. It does have an good soundtrack though

author: {'steamid': '76561198323239257', 'num_games_owned': 66, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1678728034}
review: Saurian henüz gelişmekte olan bir dinozor hayatta kalma oyunu. Oyunu sıradışı kılan özelliği, oyundaki dinozorlar ve tarih öncesi canlılardan, Kratesöz dönemine ait bitkilere kadar her şeyin spesifik bir tarihi döneme ve lokasyona ait olması. Hell Creek formasyonunda yer alan oyun henüz sadece Dakotaraptor ve Triceratops oynanışını sunuyor. Eminim ki zamanla Saurian, zaten şahane tasarımının ve sanatının üstüne çok daha etkileyici bir oynanış sunacak. Oyunun modellerindeki spekülatif yaratıcılık çok hoşuma gidiyor. Her ne kadar gerçekçi olsa da hem yaratıcı hem de göz alıcı dinozorlara ve diğer tarih öncesi yaratıklarla dolu bir dünyayı yok oluştan geri getiriyor. Oyun henüz çok büyük olmasa bile, kat edeceği yolculuğa tanıklık etmek bile benim için büyük bir mutluluk.

review: I remember being super exited about how this game would turn out in the future ... in 2017. it has been 6 years and it has barely improved since release. It runs terribly, its ugly, there's only two species of dinosaurs you can play as (even tho the tyrannosaurus has been announced SINCE THE RELEASE and the Pachy since 2018), the world is empty, the controls are janky, and the game is overall super boring. I really hope this game gets better, but i sadly don't think its ever going to be finished.

author: {'steamid': '76561198826426808', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1629902851}

author: {'steamid': '76561198312184775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 979, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 979, 'last_played': 1686464400}
review:
The game is cool but the development is very stagnant, there's an update every once in a blue moon, and most often they make very minor and unnoticeable changes. It still looks and plays the same as it did on its release day back in 2017 outside of a few changes. You can play triceratops, that's new I guess? The controls all the way down to the camera movement are a bit janky and the game has very little replayability. Once you've reached adult, you can nest, but that's essentially it.

This game just isn't fun and it's had very little changed since release 7 years ago. What happened to all those goals we reached all that time ago? It feels like we haven't even hit the first goal yet in terms of development.

author: {'steamid': '76561198836046308', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1165, 'last_played': 1703727533}
review:
let me start by saying i am NEUTRAL on this game. its given me what i've wanted, and also simotaniously ruined a lot.
Before i speak, TAKE ALL OF MY NEGATIVE CRITICISM WITH NOT A GRAIN - BUT A MOLECULE OF SALT. This game is still quite worth the try, and is just in alpha and most of my criticism is just the bugs.
with that, ill start with the good bc it is genuinely quite good for an alpha.
I'll say, this game is awesome in terms of concept and models. I LOVE the dakotaraptor! I mainly bought this game for avian dinosaurs (at least, originally so. i have a habit of buying things on impulse from my hyperfixations and therio/kintypes lol) but i was pleasantly content with what i had bought!
I think this game has a bright future, and its quite a cool concept!
on the negative side, there are a lot of bugs, such as the raptor prey restraint.
It works ADEPTLY well! i love it a lot, makes me feel like i have a good advantage!
However, there is a bug where after falling off/killing a creature from RPR, your dinosaur goes at walking speed when running afterwards.
now, i cant remember what creature i attacked, but it lives in a herd and its attacks are pretty.. rough. two hits and you're out. which is why i planned on running. but, even with a good stamina, my run was stuck at walking speed, which, killed me.
now, of course this is very minor which is why i don't care that much about it and i know it'll probably be patched very soon. but what is almost unforgivable is that this game crashed my entire computer. I saved my game in an already made file while in RPR, then after a few seconds of circling and trying to get the thing's herd away, it crashed. I gave it a second, then decided to close it on steam. Didn't work. I later attempted to open task manager. didn't. work. Then, after a bit of pale screen, my computer attempted to shut down, which i obviously allowed.
this is probably my fault for being in RPR while saving, but then again, i shouldnt have to open task manager, or even shut down my pc just to fix a crash. 
again, though, i had very few problems. terrain could do some polishing, but (again) i am aware this is a very early build and it will obviously be fixed.
lighting had a weird bug where it flashed like minor strobe lights but it didnt affect gameplay.

Other than this, there have been basically no problems.
tldr: good concept, buggy, but bearable for an early build. had a computer crash issue, but i understand and forgive.

THE NIGHT SKY IS BEAUTIFUL BTW! i love the constellations!  :))))
- sincerely a utahraptorkin who enjoys astronomy

author: {'steamid': '76561198382657973', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 515, 'last_played': 1668821361}
review:
[h1][i]Complicado e ambicioso, Saurian é um jogo problemático.[/i][/h1]
Com a proposta de recriar o ecossistema americano Hell Creek, formação geológica essa com alguns dos dinossauros mais icônicos do período cretáceo (tal como o Ankylosaurus, Triceratops e o Tyrannosaurus rex), da forma mais cientificamente precisa o possível, Saurian é um jogo que teve uma história de desenvolvimento bastante complicada desde o seu lançamento inicial em 2017. Apesar de ter modelos lindos, uma ambientação extremamente rica em detalhes e trilhas sonoras bastante agradáveis aos ouvidos, o jogo sofre com constantes crashes e falhas de otimização, podendo se tornar uma experiência bastante estressante. No geral, Saurian tem bastante potencial para se tornar algo bastante grandioso, no entanto, sofre com diversos problemas de desempenho e um desenvolvimento extremamente lento, sendo um produto que demorará muitos anos para estar de fato concluído.

author: {'steamid': '76561199119377596', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 570, 'last_played': 1710372077}
review:
If you're a dinosaur lover and want to play something realistic, this is the game for you. A project developed with the help of paleontologists, this game is insanely detailed, and a masterpiece that shows scientific research in life!
I highly recommend, but be warned; this game is not 'easy'. It is difficult, and you'll need persistence and the endurance of a Tyrannosaurus in order to succeed as a dinosaur in "the world's most accurate dinosaur simulator." 
As a budding paleontologist and paleo-artist, out of all the dinosaur games I have seen and played; this is the most realistic, lovingly-created and satisfying by far. 

I recommend a device on the stronger end of the scale for a more detailed experience. I play this game on lower settings on a good computer, and it runs fine. Glitches are, to be emphasized, PART OF LIFE. Not to mention this game is not yet fully released. If you want perfection, I suggest the best gaming computer that money can buy. 

Return for purchase? Worth every penny. 

IMPORTANT: This game was made to be a realistic dinosaur simulator, a game where the player gets a chance to be a dinosaur. In reality, animals live not to have fun, but to survive, and to grow, reproduce, and fulfill their purpose. Nevertheless, this game is fun for me, and I agree with some commenters that there were areas where I just wanted a Tyrannosaurus to come out of nowhere to spice things up. But such is reality; further increasing realism of this game. This game honestly gives the best sense of fun that I have EVER come across in a video game. And I have played many video games. It is enjoyable, satisfying, and makes you whoop for joy for every growth stage you reach. Honestly? This game is perfect (albeit the improvements planned to be added) the way it is. I love how you feel alive in this game, in the best (and most adrenaline-powered) sense. 
I look forward for the addition of the Tyrant Saurian King, and the surely interesting addition for the often under-appreciated Packy. Rock on, Urvogel Games!

author: {'steamid': '76561198129441765', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1681669293}
review:
Definitely in it's pre-alpha stages, which it admits to. I'm extremely lenient of early access games, I get tons of them! This has a lot of potential. A lot of work still needs to be done, but if it continues to improve, this game will rival its competitors if not out pace them.
Not having taken the time to check the development logs, I can't leave a proper review with any substantial suggestions yet. The only thing would be to advance into a co-op and/or multiplayer option as well. The AI is decent, and the single player is a nice change of pace to some of the wild stuff I experience in other dinosaur survival/sims. Keep at it devs! Please don't abandon this project. What you've got already is lovely, just needs more TLC.

review:
Idée très intéressante et surtout réaliste car basé sur des éléments paléontologiques. Je me suis ruée dessus en 2017 dès son accès anticipé car je recherchais un jeu de ce type. 6 ans plus tard : "Tiens, qu'y a-t-il de nouveau depuis sa sortie ?" Euh, mis à part les 4 pauvres dinosaures et le système de mating, rien d'autres ?! C'est prendre des gens pour des billes, non ?
Et voulant tout de même essayer le Tricératops, un bug à l'âge juvénile puisque j'ai beau manger, la barre de se recharge pas.
Franchement, très décevant car les promesses étaient merveilleuses !

author: {'steamid': '76561199099935119', 'num_games_owned': 44, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1682665231}
review: The game has insane amounts of potential but the issues in game are well, major too say the least. First of all the game has horrible performance so much so that i had to set my game to "very low" graphics to stay at 20 fps and even then it still spiked around. Second of all is that the game has been in development for 9 years and nearly no progress to show for it but I will cut the devs a bit of slack cause they don't really have much time to work on it. For perspective the "new" Saurian T-Rex design and model released 5 years ago... It is not in game yet. Another example for this is that there is only 2 playable dinosaurs out of 4 that are well and truly meant to be out by now yet they are not. Another issue (sort of) is the game runs on Unity which causes most of the performance issues because UE4 would have been the better bet, but I cant blame them for this because learning a whole new game engine is difficult, its just an inconvenience. But I can not get over how much potential this game has it could be THE dinosaur game if it was just given some more attention but the decisions they have made has made it nearly impossible to get to where the devs want the game to be. Sadly I don't think Saurian is going anywhere anytime soon.

author: {'steamid': '76561199218904551', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3333, 'last_played': 1704379264}
review:
El juego es un 6/10 de momento, y al contrario de lo que muchos creen, el juego todavía tiene actualizaciones.

Para empezar, yo siempre he tenido fe en este proyecto, porque aunque los desarrolladores no han cumplido todas sus promesas, no han dejado de comunicar sus avances y es el único juego de dinosaurios que se ha tomado en serio aspectos como la naturalidad en la manera en la que caminan, corren o aceleran los animales, así como otros detalles como sus anatomías. Aunque su punto fuerte también es su punto débil, pues se pone tanta dedicación a detalles que casi nadie nota, que se olvidan de la jugabilidad.

En casi seis años el juego no ha cambiado mucho, tiene bugs, y además los NPC son tan estúpidos que en ocasiones son incapaces de sobrevivir por sí mismos. Otro problema es que necesitas una buena computadora para jugar bien. Para tirar más sal a la herida, la última actualización de tener crías deja mucho que desear, pues como ya dije los NPC son tan inútiles que tu pareja nunca sobrevive por mucho tiempo (y en consecuencia, si las crías siguen a la pareja, mueren también).

He jugado por 55 horas, y esa es la cantidad de tiempo que me tomó cansarme del juego, pero eso es sólo porque tengo una inclinación por juegos de simulación casi vacíos que muchos consideran aburridos...

EN CONCLUSIÓN: si buscas un juego (a veces relajante y a veces medio difícil) que simule la vida de un dinosaurio, esta es la mejor opción. Pero recomiendo esperar cuatro o cinco años (si tenemos suerte) para ver resultados sólidos que hagan que el juego sea entretenido por tiempo ilimitado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198447458902', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1678397825}

author: {'steamid': '76561198009588465', 'num_games_owned': 82, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 642, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 642, 'last_played': 1662152884}
review: I backed this game on Kickstarter, and this game rivals and probably surpasses The Isle in the "Slowest Developing Game Ever" category. I'm not sure if it's a complete scam as the "game" (more like a tech demo) is playable, but as you can see from my hours played, it isn't fun. Basically a watch my dino grow sim. I also don't find exploring or wandering fun at all, as the environment looks like a terrible, empty wasteland with an awful draw distance and lighting. I don't think I would have backed this game knowing how little progress they were going to make in the literal years of development. My advice, don't buy this game until there's a full release (which I'm not convinced will ever happen).

review: It's a BEAUTIFUL game, it has engaging mechanics, it can get adrenaline pumping or it can be calm and peaceful, it's not for the feint of heart, it can be stressful and intense and that's what i personally love about it, it has beautiful prehistoric accuracy and i can't wait until there's more playable dinosaurs to experience playing as

author: {'steamid': '76561198126042685', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 956, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 956, 'last_played': 1661236201}
review:
If your someone who enjoys dinosaurs, learning about prehistoric environments or just want that full on dino sim this is the game for you! Not gonna lie the Saurian project has had it's rough patches especially with development being as slow as it and I can understand the frustration in that regard. However, it be unfair to judge the game by that merit alone as the devs have constantly been updating the game for the past 5 years and show no sign of stopping. 

As for the gameplay it's pretty good, both the Dakotaraptor and Trike feel very fleshed out and trying to survive from a hatching to adult hood can be a good challenge, plus now with the mating and nesting mechanic you can come full circle and make a family of your own. The world feels very alive with good ambiance and music in the background that just wants to make you sit around for a while and listen to it. 

Overall Saurian is a promising game with good mechanics and gameplay and I can't wait to see it finished

author: {'steamid': '76561198314833128', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1229, 'last_played': 1688087549}
review: I do like this game. My only real issue is there isn't any point other than to just survive. I mean I know...that's what dinosaurs and all animals really do. Just try to live and not get eaten. I do enjoy the game overall. I just wish there were more to do, and something to work at. That's all. I do hope they keep adding in things though. I won't go on much more. I would like to give a quick rundown of how it works. You start out as a baby dino. No matter which species you pick. The goal is to survive into adulthood, and then what? I don't know. As a baby it's kind of fun because you're always having to keep an eye out for other critters wanting to eat you. Anyway, I hope this kind of helps a little to anyone who may be interested in this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154759752', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 5752, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1873, 'last_played': 1701349804}
review: First, let's get the negative out of the way. The game can be a little laggy, especially with higher concentrations of dinosaurs in a single area. But that's sort of to be expected from a game with graphics as good as this, I think. The positives outweigh the negatives by a long shot to me. The graphics are really cool, the natural disasters make for interesting gameplay and I love the nesting/mating system. I do wish that we were getting more than just four playable dinosaurs but I really can't complain about that too much when the developers are pretty clear about their goals and post regularly about their progress on the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038519867', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1654735614}
review: A complete joke of a product. An amazing idea with a great concept and tech demo behind it, but this is not a game and it never will be. You'll be better off donating the money you spent (were going to spend) on this game to Scientology research. They will both have the same results.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123622857', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3382, 'last_played': 1695607884}
review:
I have completely retyped this review. Well...because unfortunately I have a lot more negative things to say about it now. I am torn about whether I should change my recommended or not opinion because I do still kind of like the game if nothing else for its honest attempt to recreate an actual habitat that once existed. You know...instead of all those other dino games that just kind of throw things together with no research at all and forget plants evolve too.
A FEW justify it with a revived dino universe which works fine but now I'm side tracked.

The main thing I must acknowledge is...the graphics are worse. I don't know if something broke in the lighting or the textures or what but they don't look as good as they did when the game first came out.
The modles of the plants were given more varried natural looking imperfections but it feels like it was at the cost of a lot of other issues.

I know in the past the game struggled a bit on many devices but if you had a device that could handle full settings the game did use to look very similar to those epic early trailers. I can't find a setting to get it back to that look and it bothers me.

It COULD just be my terrible at tekness but other screenshots of the past vs. now contradict that.

The water. I once made a thread about it in the steam forum and I'm still convinced the current version of the water is simply not as good as the original version. I don't know anything about codeing and maybe the code was a cobbled together thing or whatever as the devlogs discribed it...but it looked BETTER then what they have now. The water is too blue for a swampland, the ripples on the surface are literally just a little effect on the surface when the old version actually appeared to react slightly to your creature moving through it. You use to be able to dip your camera in and when you came back up there were splashes on the camera. Feature literally removed.

I hope this game can eventually pull itself out of development hell because I do believe it started as a passion project that got screwed over and then they kind of started giving up on it.

Why is it still recommended from me? Well...I still think it's kind of cool. I still think it's not as boring as folks claim it is. It's not an action game, it's a sim.
Could it use some more stuff? Yeah. And I wish my nests didn't glitch if my mate dies. I wish said mate would actually DO something to protect the nest as well.
It has problums. It has a lot of problums.
Buut the shadow of that early game is still there and I'm still attatched to it. I wish they'd release a legacy version that was pretty much what it was before that foliage and water update stuff if they are going to drop the game as I miss what it looked like before.
That or maybe they could open modding to people if they have given up on it.
It's just so hard to tell if this game will get more updates or not.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148280162', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 432, 'last_played': 1692125663}
review: Not a terrible game and i feel bad for the extremely small dev team, but i can't recommend it because the price tag is just way too steep for the amount of content in the game or lack-there-of.  This game has been in early access for a very very long time and they've literally added nothing but a couple of worthless stars. Not for nothing either but for years the game has had only 2 dinos, the trike and the raptor, which gets boring extremely quickly. I feel like if they could just pour their time into the rex and pachy at least then the game would have more variety for us while they then work on bugs or the non gameplay affecting features like the afore mentioned stars. Lots of potential but very disappointing in the end.

author: {'steamid': '76561198284221076', 'num_games_owned': 96, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 625, 'last_played': 1660043966}
review:
Saurian is a dinosaur sim survival game. The game is realistic, has good graphics, and is based on science.

Unfortunately, the game has 2 fatal flaws that ruin it. First, the development is insanely slow. Saurian has the slowest development I’ve ever seen of any game. It took them almost 4 years to finally release a second playable dinosaur.

The other fatal flaw is the lack of dinosaurs. This is a dinosaur game. And yet, you can run around the map & hardly ever see any large dinosaurs. I’ve played the game for almost 1.5 years & have only seen one T-Rex. I’ve seen him several times, but seriously? There’s only one T-Rex on this large map? And only one time have I seen the T-Rex hunt. Every other time, he was walking back & forth like a brainless robot.

So it’s very frustrating & disappointing to play a dinosaur game & rarely see any dinosaurs. The map is pretty but it sucks to wonder around a lonely, mostly empty map. Therefore, I do NOT recommend Saurian in its current state. And with development so slow, it won’t improve any time soon. Maybe Saurian will be a good, worthwhile game in 1,000 years from now. But it’s just not worth the wait & I’ll be long dead before then.

author: {'steamid': '76561198172994238', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1575790443}
review: I can play intensive VR games on my PC at max graphics and rendering quality without problems but for some reason this game runs like a potato every time I turn it on, it seems to lack optimization or it has some really bad memory leaks, who knows. I bought the game back in 2017 after seeing a lets play from a popular youtuber, at the time the game looked like it had potential, however, little has changed for the better in the time since. The controls are clunky and the overall game play is boring. The dev team strives for realism but at what cost? This is a game after all, shouldn't it be enjoyable? It's been in Early Access for YEARS and has made little headway. I wish I could get my money back.

author: {'steamid': '76561199245701409', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1666115146}

author: {'steamid': '76561199003428992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3209, 'last_played': 1679623876}
review:
I love the potential the game have. It has it's flaws, as it's in early alpha for years and it's maintained by small team. But detail put in every aspect of ecosystem, environment and great paleontological accuracy makes this passion project worthy to wait. If you want to see animals in their full majesty in their natural environment, then this game is for you. If you rather prefer seeing fighting monsters, then there's many other games that can deliver you this type of experience.
Pros:
-detailed simulation of how Hell Creek could look like long time ago
-lively, detailed environment
-pretty immersive elements of gameplay and interface - minimalistic HUD and tutorials restricted to bare minimum. You learn a lot of things by yourself
-paleontologically accurate depiction of various Hell Creek animals - from dinos to birds and gators
-gameplay varies of species you choose - you can either choose now solitary Dakotaraptor or Triceratops, which lives in social groups at each stage of it's life. Next playables will have other playstyles too.
-beautiful music made by XZICD, really fits and makes the mood of the game
Cons:
-a lot of elements lack polish, and not all planned animals are present, but it's expected from a game that's in alpha state
-little problems with performance (but it is also worked on)
-AI behavior can be sometimes really out of place (and again I am returning to what I said earlier)
-aiming mode is a pretty cool idea, but hard to learn. Personally I don't use it very much, since spamming attack can usually make the job

Generally, I recommend you this game, it's worth playing and waiting for next updates, but you should be patient. If you love paleontology, observing animals and you always wanted to experience how Mesozoic animals lived, then this game is definitely for you. It has some nitpicks and issues, but nonetheless it gives me a lot of fun and hype for each next update or devlog.

author: {'steamid': '76561198305321839', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 10453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8933, 'last_played': 1692571984}
review: Love this game so far! I've spent too many hours to not write a review. As an early access game, it's absolutely stunning. Yes, there are bugs and many of the dinosaurs have glitches to their NPC behaviors. However, this doesn't deter me too much during game play. I've spent a lot of time playing Triceratops and I can note that herd behavior can be a bit random at times; some of the NPCs get stuck in loops and some refuse to follow the herd entirely. I would love to see the NPCs in the herd also putting down nests and raising their offspring as well. Perhaps this is an idea down the line, but I cannot wait for more playable dinosaurs. All in all, this game at this moment is very much playable and I enjoy the overall aesthetics. The developers take a while to post updates, however, they are doing this massive game project in their free time. It's impressive what they've put out so far. Can't wait for more!

author: {'steamid': '76561199341215345', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1208, 'last_played': 1685403179}
review: Yes this game still has a long way to go, Yes it’s a wee bit broken at the edges at this stage but beyond that this is a very solid game. Unlike other major titles in the genre this game is going for a hardcore realistic experience which for the most part is has achieved quiet nicely. The AI is dynamic and interesting, the combat mechanics are diverse and you have to tackle every animal in a different way. The environment itself is gorgeous and diverse to look at. So I’d highly recommend Saurian because it’s honestly really interesting and has a lot of promise to it. #SupportSaurian

review: As other comments are saying, it's not worth it in the current state. It's made progress since 2017 but it still hasn't gotten to the point where it's enjoyable to play. review:
Amazing game, but behavior of some of the dinos are a bit weird
First off, the edmontosaur things sometimes kill each other. I don't know if that's how they acted in real life, but that really seems weird.
Next, most, if not all, of the herbivores will come and attack me if I'm a dakotaraptor, which is really annoying because if I'm eating something, a pachy just comes up to me and attacks me. They seem VERY territorial.
Other than that, the game is amazing. Can't wait for the pachy and rex to be playable! Keep it up!

author: {'steamid': '76561198128941018', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1602808502}
review: When you buy this you're not actually buying a game you can play when your download is done. You're giving funding to the extremely dedicated developers so that they can make the dinosaur sim game that people have wanted since it was possible. I don't care how long it takes to get out of pre-alpha or any of the successive stages. But if you do want the game finished as quickly as possible, buy it, let it sit in your library and wait for that dev blog to say the game is done. The more people buy it, the faster it's done.

author: {'steamid': '76561199124287023', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1659863063}
review:
$15 of aggravation. Read previous reviews but gave it a chance anyway. Try again later. 

Controls are abysmal. Realistic animations but turning is way too slow to catch anything small or not immediately die when fighting larger prey. Sneak doesn't seem to have any effect whatsoever. World doesn't need to be so big; in fact it does more harm than good when you explore too far and nothing spawns so you starve on the way back to where you're "supposed to be" for your life stage. The artistic direction and overall concept are lovely so it's a shame it runs so poorly.

I'll just go back to Monster Hunter for my dino fix, I guess.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088320302', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1657607316}
review: Normally I'd just write something random to express my opinion, but Saurian is different. For the moment, I do not rec it. Maybe it's just me having a sh*t graphics card but the game does not run well at all and I had to turn down graphics to get it to run remotely well, not to mention it lagging. I used to love this game and it ran perfectly fine, now it suddenly hardly functions at least for me. It ran so so much better for me in previous builds but maybe that's just me. No new updates have come out for a long time either which is a bit of a letdown. I still like Saurian, but the game is not executed well. I wouldn't say; 'Don't support the developer,' but as of now, I cannot give this game much praise 'til/if the movement issues are fixed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198211746965', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1673027554}
review:
I would recommend this game if your into hardcore realism. There are many things that need to be worked on though, such as better AI and more instructions to how to play the game. If your looking to buy this game and are wondering what it is about then a short description of it would be: 1. Whether you play as a raptor or trike, you start out as a baby and take around 3 hours to grow to a full adult. 2. Once you grow you have to leave your parents. 3. If your a trike you have to stick with a herd of others the same age as you, and if your a raptor you have to be alone while hunting for things like lizards, rodents, and turtles. 4. Once you become an adult you have to find a mate and nest in adorable babies. 5. You have to raise your babies to juveniles before they can leave to find their way. Now for some pros and cons.
Pros:
-Realistic dinosaurs
-Beautiful scenery and tons of plants
-An amazing flooding system
-Predators who only go after one prey and do not kill the whole herd
-Kind of good herding behavior
-Long gameplay
-Nesting

Cons:
-You need a beefy computer or it is either really hard to play or impossible (I haven't had much of this issue)
-There isn't enough instructions, even in the help menu so the game can be confusing
-Can get boring if your not watching videos while playing (Sometimes)
-Doesn't update too often
-AI walk in circles and sometimes don't follow you if your herd leader

Overall rating 7/10

I can play for a while and have a ton of fun, but there are a few things that could be improved to make the game an even better experience!

author: {'steamid': '76561198269270957', 'num_games_owned': 766, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1658284671}
review:
I bought Saurian a few days ago, a bit hesitantly after seeing all the mixed reviews, but I'm very glad I bought it.

Having played over four hours on one of the currently two playable dinosaurs (Dakotaraptor), I can say that yeah, this game is definitely still deservedly in the Early Access stage, but also it's already a lot of fun to play and explore, even with the bugs and other obvious cases of being a work in progress.

Rather than judge the devs on the time it's taking them to finish the game (which I see is the main point of a lot of the negative reviews), I'd rather focus on what the game actually has and if it's providing a fun experience for me, and it absolutely does. There's a bunch of different dinosaurs in the game, the Dakotaraptor controls feel good, the gameplay loop feels fair and strikes a good balance, being neither too trivial nor too punishing. The environments are fine for a low budget game and at some points actually very pretty, the dinosaurs look great.

The gameplay loop is, at least before you're an adult, prerty simple: eat, drink, survive. As an adult you can also form a pack/herd but I haven't tried that gameplay personally yet. There's a couple of reviews saying that once you're an adult, there's nothing more to do; but the most recent patch (at time of writing) added courting/mating and making nests for adult creatures, so the life cycle feels pretty complete now with the exception that you can't die of old age yet.

Yes, the game is still pretty unpolished in parts, but it would be dishonest to not put it into perspective: this is a reasonably priced early access title from a small dev team. I am hopeful for improvements in the future but the fact is that I feel like I'm already getting my money's worth from the game like it is now. You just need to see it for what it is; a passion project that is still in progress, made by a *very* small team, and not a polished big budget title with hundreds of programmers.

DECK: I played on the Steam Deck and it works nicely there. Haven't tinkered at all. I'm noticing some occasional slowdown while in busy areas but that's it.

TL;DR - very cool ecosystem simulation game about dinosaurs which look like how scientists currently think they did. Very obviously still in development phase and should be approached as such, but already fun to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198303000075', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1681760223}
review: this game gave me a surprise, i know the problems of the past they had (very very slow updates, seems dead) but i thout to give it a try after watching lets plays of it. and omg it did deliver and more, i was very surpised of the AI, there seems to be alot going on in the background for the AI, it was a very pleasnt surprise. best exmple is trying to join another herd and the male came to me first, at first alot of threat calling, then walks to me, bit by bit, threat calling, seeming to test the waters and when i still held my ground, it started to charge at me, going to attack, when i made some distance, they were now very weary of me, kinda started to pace back and forth and some threat calls, kinda acting like a wall between their herd and me. once that clamed down, i try soical with one of the females, she was defently more bite then bark lmao, gave a few threat calls, walked a lil to me, then just went for me, which was really intresting. and there is more then just this, and let alone the music and theme of the enviroment just work so well and such amazing music and i love the "scary" music at night xD to kinda keep you on your toes. tbh the only issuse i have with this game, is the ai can sometimes be a lil goofy with destination deciding, which is not a problem for me, due to this game being alpha. i do really hope this game pulls through, its so diffrent to other dino sims and just a new fresh air for this couminty and such a fun, creative one at that. (sorry for missspellings, deslixa is fun qwq)

author: {'steamid': '76561198271849497', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1656203742}
review:
Знаю об этом проекте несколько лет, долго ходила вокруг да около, натыкалась на обзоры, думала. Минусы и плюсы мне и раньше известны были, но всё-таки запустила посмотреть своими глазами.
В игре на данный момент всего два играбельных динозавра, дакотараптор и трицератопс, у разработчиков в планах то ли 4, то ли уже 6 (тут немного запутался, но вроде уже таки 6). Динозавров-неписей больше. На старте вас запузыривают выживать и расти в мир-лес, плюс игра старается быть в какой-то мере образовательной реконструкцией. Пернатого рекса только не заменили пока на новую правильную модельку (тут с достоверностью промахнулись), но он в процессе. Без оглядки на правдоподобность: пернатый рекс в любом случае очень клёво выглядит. :D

Разработчики понемногу шевелятся, что-то делают и апдейтят. Медленно, но на данный момент проект жив и не заброшен.

Я побегала, посмотрела. Подумала, пока что игру сдала, поскольку пока не могу просто по фану поддерживать кого-то и оставляю только то, во что реально буду играть. Сориан мне понравилась, но пока что всё, что она может мне дать, мне дают The Isle и Beasts of Bermuda.
Отдельно понравились ИИ-боты, которые наполняют мир. Ведут себя местами странно всё еще, что не отменяет того, что сделаны они очень красиво. 

Оставляю рекомендацию. Кому нравятся такие проекты, не вызывают кринжа долгострои и кто может/хочет — его есть смысл поддержать, у него есть потенциал, пусть и с развитием в темпе черепашки. Когда у меня будет возможность, скорее всего тоже выкуплю её обратно и уже не буду рефандить. Это одна из чуть ли не единственных СОЛО-игр по динозаврам, которая пытается в геймплей и пока не опустила лапки. Дорогого стоит.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068443270', 'num_games_owned': 16, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1674862425}

author: {'steamid': '76561199059855865', 'num_games_owned': 23, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 898, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 635, 'last_played': 1686610756}
review: This game is a hot mess, unfortunately. The game has NOTHING to do, a similar issue with The Isle, once you're grown there's nothing to do after that, especially the case with Saurian. The main issue this game is the lack of content. Almost 8 years of development and the game has about as much progress done as a game that's been in development for a few months. 4 dinosaurs total and only 2 being playable after the 8 years, triceratops finally got released sometime last year after only have dakotaraptor for 8 years. Second issue, the game runs like dogshit, I can barely keep 30 fps, I stay at around 25 fps constantly. I have a great PC, changing the graphics doesn't change the performance either. I can run ARK at 60 fps no problem, so if I can run that MASSIVE game I should also be able to run this game. In short, Saurian isn't optimized in the slightest. Third and last big problem, the game is BROKEN! Constant bugs (not just lag), but issues with hitboxes, pouncing a dino and going straight through them and sometimes dying because of it, getting 1 shot by the little gators as a full grown trike, my bites and attacks not registering at all causing me to die, and the brain-dead AI, the AI is poorly programmed, the dinosaurs run around aimless, mindlessly chasing other dinosaurs getting themselves killed, t-rex won't stand its ground and scare you off as it should, instead it runs right at you and plows through you like nothing. Saurian is a broken shitstorm, which sucks because I saw so much potential in this game as millions of others did, that's just not being fulfilled. Saurian is a lost cause, I don't have any hope in this game. The only pro this game has in my opinion is the dinosaurs themselves look nice. Buy this game 30 years from now when it MIGHT be worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167626718', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1658587991}

author: {'steamid': '76561198354085821', 'num_games_owned': 36, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 665, 'last_played': 1688408607}
review: I have followed this game for a long time, and I truly really wanted to like this game. I had defended it in the past, and I understand development had... extreme setbacks, but it really hasn't come to anything. I'll give it that it's pretty, the music is amazing, and I admire the attempt at realism (though certain choices are arguable), but gameplay is bland, simply walking, eating, running from things, rinse and repeat. There's nothing to do, no events, not a lot to explore, and even with the attempted realism, it's not necessarily a full representation of life in general, and it certainly isn't a game. Perhaps purchase the soundtrack or something, but I cannot suggest the game itself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123559463', 'num_games_owned': 71, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1339, 'last_played': 1660716123}
review: I came in to check on this game, as I do annually, and it still doesn't have all of the main four (T-Rex, Pachy, Trike, & Raptor) dinosaurs they were advertising. This game literally has the same problems since its release in 2017 as an early access build. The graphics (how the game looks) are the same, all the dinosaur models are the same (aka no visual improvements such as locomotion), the poor AI behavior is the same, I don't know whether they actually changed the map, but the map feels the same, it still has poor frame rates (I had a 1070 Super when I first played this game and it was a bit laggy, since then I've tried playing it on a 2070 Super and it still lags). Honestly I don't even understand why you need to pay to play this game. It had the funding in 2017 (probably only lasted for 1~2 years) and this game should've been AT LEAST in BETA in 2019~2020, yet here we are. 5 years into development and I've lost all of my patience for this game. I hope this project gets cancelled and heavily criticized by everyone.

review: This game was good when I first got it- it showed a lot of promise, but there hasn't been a single update where they actually added something to the game since 2018. It still looks, plays, and sounds the same as when I last left it. It's disappointing. You would think this game had been abandoned if there weren't "patches" and "hotfixes" still being released. What I don't understand is how after 3 years, the creators of this game have done absolutely nothing to improve it besides fixing bugs that shouldn't even exist anymore, because all they ever do is fix bugs. Eventually, you have to run out of bugs to fix.

review: this is a fun game i love it, however i can't recommend it, it's been in development since 2017 and has very little to show for it, AI gets stuck on corpses still or they walk aimlessly away from you. The environment seems very dead and frankly the graphics could use a lot of improvement. i remember supporting this game on kick-starter and it is so sad to watch the money it raised seem to go nowhere. i hope this game goes somewhere i just hope it doesn't take another five years to do so.

author: {'steamid': '76561198840608049', 'num_games_owned': 44, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2350, 'last_played': 1706418797}
review:
Good game, the gameplay loop is pretty neat but also subtle, the animal bhvr is very believeable even if there is a lack of extra stuff, the only REAL issue I have with the game is the graphics, if the game looked good I would have no issue thinking this was a real time period, but as it stands the fact that shadows disappear RIGHT infront of you takes a bit of effort to ignore, the very next update is going to overhaul the graphics so that's cool.

Devs are very active in the discord server and are chill people, can 100% they aren't developing the game slow on purpose.

It's weird to me but this game feels the MOST like a actual game out of any dinosaur simulator out there.

review:
I think this game is lovely. 
So far, it's chill, and as a dinosaur you're able to accurately play as either a Triceratops or Dakoraptor. 
 There are moments of high tension aswell, like when you're hunting or [i] being [/i] the one hunted. And the soundtrack paired with it is stunning.
Development wise, new patches and features have been getting added to the game a lot more frequently now, and every month or so there's a new thing to look forward too, I'm really excited to see where this game goes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022002489', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 442, 'last_played': 1565068462}
review:
I originally backed this on Kickstarter in June of 2016, and I should of seen the warning signs to begin with as they were only asking for $55k to make the game, with lowballed estimates on the stretch goals and an estimated delivery date of January 2017. Genetic variant skins, character customisation, spectator mode, dynamic environment events, post impact survival, new playable dinosaurs to take it from 4 dinosaurs to 6, multiplayer and VR support were all reached stretch goals when it hit $220k, which in hindsight is absolute insanity to believe especially in terms of multiplayer and VR.
With a 14 person team working remotely in multiple countries.

It was a campaign intended to get the game to early access with the hope that it'd go big from there, that all the funding would pour in but it was never going to, it was destined to only be an extremely niche title, so full funding never appeared and it got turned into a hobby project as staff had to take on other jobs which came first to keep paying the bills.
While its a great idea to go for full and accurate scientific information on everything, its a project that never drew a line in the sand, with a company that vastly overestimated what they were capable of actually producing, its a case of overestimating capability and underestimating finances. If this was given to a larger studio with more staff in one or two locations for much better project management with funding that was measured in at least the low millions mark then we'd have a project that would be deliverable but as it is, its a project that will never be complete.
As it stands now, it could be another five years before development is finished, if not longer, and thats if the staff stick around, if they dont move on to better things.

TLDR: Buyer beware, this is well intentioned vapourware.

review:
''잋혀진 공룡 게임''
 자금 도난 사건도 있었고, 현재 게임 개발이 영 순탄하게 돌아가지 않는 모양이다. 티라노도 모델링이 나오긴 했지만 아직 함흥차사다. 킥스타터 보상인 안주는 현재로썬 눈씻고 찾아볼 수 도 없다. 만약 당신이 정말 진심으로 공룡을 좋아하거나 6600만년전의 생태를 조금이라도 맛보고 싶으면 추천한다. 개발진들의 말대로 아름다운 시뮬레이션이니깐. 다만 서바이벌 ''게임''보단 체험을 하는 ''시뮬레이션''에 더 가까운 것 같다.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996367323', 'num_games_owned': 114, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1649766804}
review:
This game is so far from being playable, 

first of all Models are not bad but animations are just non existent, the walking animation is only 1 for all, slow walk is just slow motion moving of joins in the same arc. 

AI just stares in front of it and walks, not looking left or right even when turning , they just wonder around like the scouts you would send to explore in age of empires 2, and thats a 1999 game! (dakota raptor gameplay) i started with 2 parents they just went off in different directions, after 5 mins walking behind one, another hatching showed up, parent walks into a group of patchys not looking when they attack it just runs off a few feet and patchys focus on the other clueless hatching getting obliterated, barely 10 meters away the parent AI just resumes walking aimlessley not caring whats happening behind it.

on store page it shows t rex and its not playable.

controls are too clunky.

i wouldn't suggest this game if it was free.

this game was released as early access on steam in 2017, will check back in 2032 to see if they made any progress.

review:

One of the reasons I got it was because I heard their models were nice and I saw a T-Rex. 
Can't even play as a T-Rex.

It would be better if it were multiplayer in my opinion. I have literally nothing to do. I just follow my herd around as they swim across the lake back and forth for no reason. I regret buying it overall. Hearing that it's been in early access for 5 years doesn't make anything better. I just feel like I've wasted my money and time with the game. I hope it changes but until then.

author: {'steamid': '76561198204346568', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1649174153}
review:
Saurian is not a game at this point in time, it is a boring activity.

CONS:
• Boring
• No real gameplay
• Nothing to do
• Ugly areas
• no goal other than 'not die'
• No tutorial

PROS:
• Pretty dinosaurs.

I've tried playing this game twice, and both times I ejected before I could hit one hour.

In short, there is no guidance (tutorial - you have GUESS what the hell to do), no interactions between the dinosaurs (playing, or fighting, or reading body language, ANYTHING that makes it feel like I'm a dinosaur other than the damned model) and nothing to do other than eat, drink and die. That's it. Fighting is stupid, the dynamics between herds are non existent. You can't play with your pack mates, you can't call to them to warn them about a damned T-Rex standing ten feet away from them. The AI is as erratic as I've ever seen (they keep running into water and then running back out for no reason, and if I don't stick close to their sides I'm kicked out of the herd - you have NO control), and apart from eating, drinking and dying you can, well, wander, I guess?

The draw distance is terrible, and this game has been in development for around FIVE YEARS with little to not change in gameplay.

I don't want to crap on a dinosaurs game, I love dinosaur games, but steer clear and buy something else. It's a waste of time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198410700899', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1047, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 620, 'last_played': 1703288281}

review:
This is my favorite game in the whole world!
The game is gorgeous, works great most of the time, and if you love dinosaurs you won't find anything that is more scientifically accurate than this. Development is a little slow, but as the game is already it's a very surreal experience. I can't recommend it enough!

review: O jogo tem o desenvolvimento bem lento, mas não está abandonado. A equipe, apesar da demora, está de parabéns pelo cuidado que tem com o cientificamente correto no que diz respeito aos dinossauros, não só na aparência, mas também em seu comportamento! Além disso, a ambientação é linda. Tenha apenas em mente que o jogo ainda está em desenvolvimento. Recomendo!
