author: {'steamid': '76561198138857301', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 895, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 394, 'last_played': 1696373970}
review:
Saurian definitivamente é o que eu ando procurando em um jogo, um bom simulador de vida animal. O potencial de Saurian é inacreditável e ele abre uma porta para um mundo de estilo de jogos altamente interessante, imagine só, um jogo cientificamente apurado tentando recriar um ambiente baseado em algum acervo fossilífero, o resultado é Saurian.

O que mais me entristece nesse jogo magnifico é o tempo para que novas atualizações cheguem, quero mais de Saurian, e quando finalmente o jogo estiver pronto e finalmente lançado outros Saurians de outros acervos fossilíferos, talvez voltarmos para o Cambriano, Devoniano? Ordoviciano? 

Sabendo que está em desenvolvimento, e se você tiver interesse em um jogo que tenta recriar um ambiente a muito extinto, então eu recomendo que você o compre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198858323443', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 13482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6823, 'last_played': 1706879545}
review:
This game is amazing for my likings.

First of all its showing dinosaurs as animals, realistic balanced ecosystem. The updates are rare and i can agree but the development is very well active, every month we see more and more progress for this game and gets me more and more excited even if i know that the new stuff late to be released i am ok with that because i have patience and i understand how hard it is to make a game as realistic as possible...i mean they even remake whole stuff and even the environment itself rare updates are expected. Only two playables for the moment and Tyrannosaurus is in development along with the nesting system that will come out soon this year the animals are only two but are so unique in their own way, in every other game you ask everyone which is the best dinosaur, stats, abilities...here this is not the case, dakotaraptor is unique because of the raptor prey restraint and the climbing and gliding of the baby so even as weakling you find an interesting gameplay, triceratops has this amazing herd system and all these changes as it grows its so satisfying. Other than that, this game is something you can play for just half hour a day or 2 hours or 6 no matter how much free time you have and this is amazing as in other games like the isle i need to have HOURS of free time which is rare, not because of growth time but because the way the game feels like.
People say AI is bad but i disagree, its way better than any other dinosaur game, they show so much life other than just walking randomly and running away from you, they are social with each other they have the same needs with a player and they dont hunt if they are not hungry, they sure need more work but they are nowhere near as bad as the other dinosaur game AI.

However keep in mind those:
You need really good pc and graphics card and all that kind of stuff. My PC is really good and i can play on max graphics with 80 plant loading distance but if i put it at 100 the game crashes so before purchasing mind this stuff first, espeically if you dont want to have low graphics which do not look good at all. Second you need to be absolutely sure you want very much realism...there are people who complain about triceratops controls and the movement is slow yet its a 9 tons animal how do you expect it to be fast and turn quickly like a dog?

This is all i have to say...i have 114 hours in total and i really do not regret buying this game at all especially now that the development is faster than 4-5 years ago or so and im really excited about the upcoming Tyrannosaurus playable and nesting mechanics. I enjoy this game more than even the isle and path of titans because its as realistic as it gets without being multiplayer with rules, instead the game itself forces you to be in a realistic world.

10/10 by me

author: {'steamid': '76561198015008216', 'num_games_owned': 213, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1695768311}
review:
Saurian is a Dinosaur based game which wants to recreate North America as it was 65 Million Years Ago, however is this game what it seems?

Saurian is a high graphics dinosaur game which focuses on your survival in a harsh world from 65 MYA. The game looks great, has good mechanics and pretty nice Dinosaur/Creature designs. 

However, there is little to be in Saurian. As of now, the only playable creatures are Dakotaraptor and Triceratops. Now would be a good time to mention that this game is progressing at a snails pace and will not get into too many places at the current rate.

However, what it lacks in playability, it makes up for in challenge. Saurian is admittedly a reasonably hard game compared to others. Growing can take a while and there is a lot which wants to kill you. Finding food as a carnivore is also a problem, and not looking out for large Carnivores can get you in a rough position.

The AI in this game is also decent. Dakotaraptor will attack you as soon as you become a juvenile. The Socialism mechanic is also interesting, as you can now scare off or attract other creatures. Creatures know when to run, fight or follow which is also cool.

The Dinosaur models and designs in this game are, without a doubt, very good. The Dakotaraptor especially stands out.
However, the Tyrannosaur model is by far the worst. Thankfully, there is another model which is currently in development and will be added soon. You can see this if you look around, and it looks like a vast improvement.

Overall, Saurian may not have much to do but it is fun if you enjoy yourself a good challenge. The graphics are great, AI is great, Models are good, Mechanics are amazing, and is Pretty accurate as far as current paleontology goes. The game is however updating slowly, but im confident the game will get there eventually.

A light 8/10. An incredibly challenging game with an incredible amount of potential.

review:
My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, 'If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately.'. Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me- 'Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through." I agreed. At 28, I have never touched a cigarette. I must say, I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it, because your game gave me cancer anyway.

10/10 if you want cancer if not dont buy it

author: {'steamid': '76561198809246932', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 515, 'last_played': 1659899115}
review: So first of all, I think it is important to stress that this game IS a work in progress, and as such includes a lot of incomplete features, unfinished mechanics and models, and bugs. So. Many. Bugs. That being said, this game is amazing. And not just for a work in progress. I would buy this even if this were the finished game and no more was to be added. It's that good. The AI, while not perfect, is pretty impressive. And the bugs I've encountered so far are minor and certainly not game-breaking, some even made me chuckle. And the best part? Feathered dinosaurs. Feathered dinosaurs are the reason I bought this in the first place, and this game does not disappoint. The developers aren't screaming feather deniers who make their models incorrect just to satisfy some unexplainable desire for their dinosaurs to reflect the now-debunked images they were once presented, and instead seem to be aiming to put together an unbiased recreation of the cretaceous Hell's Creek formation using the most accurate information available, something I really admire. Anyways, all-in-all this game, though unfinished, is utterly breathtaking to me, and I definitely recommend it to any paleontology-nerds like me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003657301', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1629403967}
review: I really want to like this game but i can't. As a raptor its nearly impossible to fill up your hunger as even the smallest of prey can kill you within one or two hits and the sluggish controls do not help. As the trike its a little easier as you can just stay with the herd until you reach the first growth stage and then you're booted out of the herd to fend for yourself or follow around the other young AI that will lead you to random locations and swim around aimlessly. Trying to fight off attackers is extremely difficult as one simple attack from anything even the smallest creature will destroy your health bar. Not worth $20 maybe $5-10 at best along with slow development as only one extra dinosaur has been made playable out of the four since launch while there is a wide variety of creature AI in the game that would make it a little more interesting, but at this rate i struggle to want to play this more than 20 minutes as it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980804400', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1607449322}
review:
I really like where this game is going:  a singleplayer dinosaur survival sim, but it's got a very, very long way to go before it's worth playing.  Since they're already charging money for it, I have to rate it based on what's currently available (because who knows how far it will get before the devs stop working on it - we've seen tons of games abandoned in EA), and that's why I'm giving it a thumbs down.  

My suggestion to the devs if they want to improve this game is to take inspiration from a game called Wolf Quest:  Anniversary Edition.  Yes, that game is set in modern times and models real wolf behavior, not dinosaurs, but it's effectively the same core game (an animal survival sim), and in particular, WQ's smell system is way better than Saurian's (seriously guys, steal their smell system and put it in Saurian).

Other changes I would suggest:  
1. GREATLY reduce the rate of hunger decay - we should not be starving to the point of losing health in one in-game day, and what's more, hunger should not be decaying more quickly than thirst.
2. GREATLY reduce the rate of thirst decay - same reason as 1
3. Improve friendly AI and/or implement a "follow me" social command to prevent AI herdmates from doing suicidal things, like going for a swim right next to a crocodile.
4. Is 3-6 the realistic herd size for Triceratops?  I feel like that's way too low (especially since in my case, all three were male).  If it is, then okay, but just three juvenile trikes setting out on their own seems like an easy meal for any number of predators.
5. Dakotaraptors are way too fragile compared to similarly sized NPC critters.  Why is it that, as a juvenile Dakotaraptor, it takes me 25 bites to kill the similarly sized, two-legged herbivore critter (I have no idea what it was called), but it only has to hit me once to kill me (from full health, no less)?  I mean, if I went up against a T-rex or an adult Triceratops and that happened, I'd be perfectly fine with it (in fact, I'd probably be pissed if it didn't).  But this little ostrich-like critter had no obvious defenses and was clearly no bigger than my juvie raptor.  It shouldn't be able to kill me any more easily than I can kill it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052591812', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 699, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 699, 'last_played': 1515868036}
review:
I was a kickstarter backer and had really high hopes for the game. So it really pains me to make this negative review. But this game really feels like it is dead walking. Its development goes at a snails pace. Its gameplay after 3 years of development is shallow. Three years ago the devs said it would take a two years to get out of early access with the four base animals. Now here we are three years later and they've implemented only one new animal (for a total of 2) and its neither polished nor interesting.

But that's not even all. There are stretch goals us kickstarter backers hit by funding this game 4x more than its goal (They wanted 55,000 and got 220,709). A few of these goals were adding 2 extra dinosaurs, Multiplayer and Vr support. But they took money we gave them and they must have mismanaged the hell out of that. Or maybe they didnt plan it well at all to begin with. Maybe a combination of the two. I lay awake at night wondering just how far this game would have gotten if we hadnt funded it OVER 4x its goal and instead gave it the minimum amount. 

I'm not saying this game cant be good. I'm not saying it wont ever be finished  But I'd be lying if i said if I said I honestly thought this game would be completed in a reasonable time frame.. if at all.  Im also not telling you not to buy this game. But if you do, youd better be sure you are in it for the long haul and wont feel bad about throwing your money to the wind and hoping for the best. 

Now go... Go and make your informed decision. God knows I wish I had the chance you have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065641294', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1324, 'last_played': 1605562669}
review:
So... it has been 3 years now and we got trikes a while ago!... but it's still the same thing as before, eat, walk around, drink, wait, press C, eat again, die to some random dino walking past you, reload the game, rinse and repeat. Honestly, in 3 years several companies got way past alpha and 2 available choices, we were "promised" a lot lot more than this, random quetz attacks, more playable options, multiplayer, social interaction, etc.

I know you want to make it realistic but there is something here missing that's not making it either fast nor efficient. I can name you a few other games with the same or better quality that have been popping out in the time Saurian existed: The Isle, Beasts of Bermuda and Path of Titans. One has 2 more years than saurian but is more of a jurassic park battle royale with lots of updates, the other two appeared in the last 2 years and already got 10 times more things than saurian, including paleontological accuracy, even though they are also in "alpha". There have been little to no updates, it feels like devs dont really care about the quality of their simulator and there are no prospects of this getting any better. I dont regret spending money on a group of people willing to develop a simulator game based on actual real information, but this one failed to deliver.

This game is dead.

EDIT: 3 years after this review. Game still is dead, only has 2 playable dinos but it still is literally the same thing. The development speed is so slow it almost feels like there is only one lazy developer working on it, for about 1 or 2 hours every 2 mondays. Go play Path of Titans, it might not be ideal but at least it is playable, heck i'd recommend the isle even with all its bugs, at least that one is being actively worked on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072182424', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1288, 'last_played': 1620613869}
review:
I feel like it's finally time to write a review.

I was one of the people to help this game come alive on Kickstarter, and that was before the game released here on 2017. Playing as a dinosaur? Who wouldn't want that! Watching the game development logs and such got me really excited for when it would be released on steam since I hadn't pledged enough for test builds to play.

And then it was released! Of course it was buggy, but such is life. I was bummed that my old laptop couldn't handle it, but my new one could. The graphics were amazing then, and the gameplay felt good. AI was...interesting, but it didn't break the game, I think. You could still play the game at it's core, but that the game wasn't finished was very obvious.

Now with that in mind, the last time I'd play the game, before the RECENT Triceratops update was December 2018. *2018* The new dino update came out in October 2020. That's almost two years without a major update. There were bug fixes and such, I'm sure but to add more gameplay? It's been a long, long dry spell.

Playing it after the long break, the graphics are still amazing to look at. It does require a pretty good computer to run it, so be warned of that. The AI/NPC intelligence is still very much lacking. Playing the raptor, your parents will still wander off and die and playing as the Trike, your herd will walk around in circles (my family herd would NOT get water because they wouldn't "leave the herd" so they kept walking back and forth til I grew up old enough to leave them by which they despawned.). It's a mess, but it's still in development, so what can you do.

Do I recommend this game? No, not at this time. But that's coming from me, someone who has had the game for a while. It may be new and exciting for people who haven't played it and haven't been waiting for as long as I have. But for me? I cannot recommend it right now. I'll edit this, or write a new review as more time passes.

TL;DR Game is wonderful to look at! Laptop must be able to handle the graphics. Do not recommend until more work is done on the game, unless you are willing to wait as the updates come.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014696075', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2310, 'last_played': 1602408866}
review:
If you're looking for a relatively accurate survival simulator where you play as a dinosaur that's immersive and not bogged down in complexity and menus, this game is for you. Please trust these devs- Yes, progress is slow going, but all this time the developers have been putting out consistent updates (before covid-19 and the bug-testing phase so they could get this newest update out ASAP, but now that it's out devlogs will continue) to show that they've constantly been at work on this game. This is why I trust that this game will not be abandoned like previous infamous dinosaur-themed crowdfunded projects. Slow and steady wins the race.

You will see older reviews complain about the performance and/or the devlogs' focus on the plants, but these two things are related-- the new plants are intended to improve performance as well as accuracy and diversity, and they have! After downloading today's update I noticed the performance improvement immediately. I've been having a lot of fun with the triceratops herd mechanics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110032348', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 961, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 793, 'last_played': 1617330629}
review:
When I first saw this game online, I was beyond hyped. I counted down the days until release, and when it finally arrived on Steam, I bought that b*tch so fast, I was super pumped to have a realistic dino sim to play. 

The game had some optimization issues from the start, even the lowest graphics could barely run on my decent PC (where as games like the Isle or Skyrim could run at medium graphics with no stuttering at all). The movement was weird, AI behaved weirdly, and a lot of mechanics didn't work, but hey, it just released! I was sure it would get a lot of updates!

Well, now its September of 2020, I have a much higher-end computer, plenty of updates have come and gone, and I still am barely able to run the game at the absolute lowest settings. Still buggy, but again, it's an early access game, so I'm giving them some slack. They put a lot of effort, research, and heart into this game, so I'm not going to say that I regret purchasing the game because I don't, honestly. I don't really play the game anymore, but I don't regret getting it. 

I would not recommend this game for anyone with a less than stellar computer due to it's optimization issues, but if you got a fancy setup, then give it a whirl. It's single-player, a bit boring at times, but the thrill of danger and all the exploring you get to do is a lot of fun. Figuring out good ways to hunt, messing with rexes, and admiring the pretty game is good fun, but like I said, it can get boring. It's not Guild Wars or nothin, it's a simulation, and real life can be pretty lame and frustrating, and that is meant to captivate on that a bit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059123824', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1837, 'last_played': 1680477596}

author: {'steamid': '76561198013276136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 483, 'last_played': 1670804714}
review:
Brilliant Dinosaur simulation, absurdly boring gameplay, I had much more fun reading the encyclopedia and looking at the Dinosaur models than I did actually playing the game. Honestly, I think they should just make it so you fly around the map and spectate the Dinosaurs and have the encyclopedia displaying information about the Dinosaur your spectating and explaining what they're doing whilst being able to change certain aspects of the world and spawn in dinosaurs to watch them fight each other.

I genuinely think I would have more fun watching that than having it so you just walk about aimlessly for hours with nothing to do like it currently is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198319695948', 'num_games_owned': 97, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3066, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1898, 'last_played': 1700501824}
review:
Out of all "simulator" games I've ever played, this is by far the most interesting one. It does have a few glithes, low content and slow development, but that is not at all, the objective of Saurian. Extremely realistic creatures are what the game is all about. Every dev log that came just shows that they are always trying to focus on quality over quantity, like most other titles. This is not a game for your casual player looking for a fun dino game.

I've always wanted a game just like this, where you can just chill and play with ai without being harrased by other players. It is truly any paleontology enthusiast's best dream.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005407474', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1602916939}
review:
The game itself is not bad.  I enjoy it, but it feels like updates are slow in coming.  I grew a Dakata to adult, even killed my first large prey.  But... not enough to keep my attention until there is more variety.

I didn't find it any more or any less difficult than other survival games.  Maybe less if anything.  But that is fine too.  Some survival games are a pain in the butt, this was comfortably challenging.

I think it will be pretty good if they can roll out more content.  But until it is fleshed out more I wouldn't recommend it just yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007566022', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2282, 'last_played': 1707777418}
review:
As far as I know this is the only truly accurate dinosaur sim to be in existence or development. The developers are going out of their way to use the latest academic research to ensure that this simulator is as accurate in representing the ecosystem of North Dakota 66 million years ago as our present day palaeontological knowledge. They walk a thin line between true to life realism and enjoyable gameplay, while staying faithful to scientific accuracy, and in my opinion are doing a remarkable job.
I have to warn any potential future players here: the game is a work in progress, development is slow, and updates sometimes take a long time to come around, as the team is small and uncompromising in their gargantuan task. However the team is fully dedicated to completing the game and making it live up to their original vision, they are communicative and transparent with the community, and the community itself is very dedicated and tight knit, and always welcoming of new members on the Saurian Discord server. 
This game is a must buy for any true Dinosaur Lover. Whether you buy it now or wait for the full release, is up to you :)

author: {'steamid': '76561199042241883', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1027, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1645418175}
review: love it!I think it will be great once more dinosaurs are added!

author: {'steamid': '76561198409529829', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1353, 'last_played': 1599197295}
review: Walking in the prehistoric shoes of Hell Creek's dinosaurs is an experience that I never would have thought possible, but thanks to the dedication and scrutinous detailing of Saurian's production team, I'm now able to do so with outstanding scientific accuracy. I don't think I'd ever be able to properly articulate how incredible and admirable their mission is, along with the amount of hope I have for their success. The immersive sounds and stunning visuals aid in the rendering of a world from some 65-odd billion years ago. The game is definitely something to partake in.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087195444', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 905, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 710, 'last_played': 1605571719}
review:
This game is essentially dead. The devs have all but taken the enormous sum of Kickstarter money and run.

It's been in early access for about 3 years now, and still has only a single playable dinosaur species. There is nothing to do in this game. You can run around for a while eating stuff and waiting to grow up, but that will get old very quickly. The devs stall by adding an update every few months doing something tiny and insignificant like re-texturing some plants, but that's about it. They did finally listen to their customers and start adding a new dinosaur, A YEAR AGO, and it's still not in a playable state. 

By the way, unless you have a £2k+ dedicated gaming PC, the screenshots you can see on the store page are absolutely nothing like what your game will look like when running at a playable frame rate. If you have a PC that is more than a few years old or is lower end, you will not be able to run this game in a way that will be playable, even at the lowest graphics settings. The developers haven't even heard of optimisation.

It's a shame, since what we were promised for this game was incredible, but the developers obviously have no intention of providing what they promised. Don't waste your money, this will never be a completed or even worthwhile game.

You also can't discuss any negative opinions or complain about the state of the game on the steam forum or any of the game's social media, because you will instantly be banned or blocked. If that doesn't tell you that this game is going nowhere, I don't know what will.

Update october 2022: 5 Years in now, and they finally added another of the core features that they promised from the very start. You can now have a bugged out mate and create barely functional offspring. They also changed the sky a bit. That's it for development this year

author: {'steamid': '76561198799181788', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1525, 'last_played': 1689274968}
review: Saurian is a very fun and challenging game for people who love dinosaurs! The animations of the animals are very fluent and smooth. Over all the game is very well made and I can't wait to see what comes in the future!

author: {'steamid': '76561198053847579', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 950, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 863, 'last_played': 1612131183}
review:
This is a simulation, with very slow but perfectionist development. They are ensuring to stay up to date but it's very very slow. 
Would I recommend?
Yes and no --
Yes, if you want to support the development and overall idea of a simulation but aren't too focused on a final product.
No, If you are looking for polished gameplay and a product that has a completion end in sight.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079411926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1627541327}
review:
I first heard of this game over a year ago and downloaded it today. I gotta say, I expected a little more progress from where it currently is, given that it was popular enough last year to be mentioned by multiple sources. I really hope they finish it because it has a lot of potential. For one, the dinos have feathers! Its about time someone did that :) At this point (end of August 2020) there is still a fair bit of lag, graphics are decent but certainly not mind-blowing, you can only play one dinosaur, sniffing for food only works some of the time, vegetation and dinos are slow to load, and you die just about every time you get within a foot of a larger dinosaur unless you're pouncing (very large hit box?) I also can't get the pouncing to work right, not sure if its user error or glitches. You can also clip straight through some trees and some of the animations look a little weird, like when I eat the food will float next to my mouth instead of hanging out of it. 

Like I said, its got loads of potential and I can see this being an awesome game once they sharpen the mechanics, add more dinosaurs, and work out the glitches. You get what you get when you buy early access. I really hope they don't lose momentum, otherwise it will be a waste of $20.

review: If you've been on the hunt for a scientifically accurate dinosaur game, this one's about as accurate as it gets. The devs have been consistently working on this since day one, and I'm always excited to see new updates. I can't wait for the rex to be playable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198172734365', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 14854, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9423, 'last_played': 1707517278}

author: {'steamid': '76561199077410326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1703021874}
review:
I finally got this game a few days ago after wanting it for around a year or two, and its just as good as I expected. Being very into dinosaurs, and especially accuracy in games and other things, this game is right up my alley. 
If you're a fan of accurate dinosaur games, I highly recommend you get this game and support the creators.
If you're weary because of the lack of updates, then join the Discord, which you can find on their website or by just searching 'Saurian Discord', as I did. If you ask about it there, I'm sure someone will respond.

I myself was weary too, after seeing the bad reviews recently, and already getting a refund for one game I ended up not liking, but I can say that, despite only having one dinosaur to play currently, this game is well worth it, especially if you manage to get it on sale, which I didn't, but I don't mind.


Now, onto some features of the game, too;
The Encylopedia is a very nice feature, with everything in it unlocked the second you open the game, before even making a save.
The models for this game are beautiful, and amazingly realistic and seemingly as accurate as we can get. The sound design is also great, with the music (while I don't have it on myself), adding to the ambience even more.


It really is a great game, and, in my opinion, it doesn't deserve any of the negative reviews it's getting. The game hasn't had any updates, sure, but the devs are working on it, and, remember this is their first game too, and its beautifully done, to the point where I though it had to have been a third or fourth game.

While it is taking a while, it's better for them to work slowly, and patch out any bugs they can find.
As an impatient person, I wasn't sure if I could support this game, but I promise you, this game is more than worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561199021539852', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1598358131}

author: {'steamid': '76561198321836676', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1690279611}
review:
Ein wirklich schönes Spiel mit sehr schönen Ideen, aber zu viel von ungenutzten Potenzial und dem Fakt, dass es nur viel zu langsam mit den Updates voran geht. Es könnte so viel mehr sein, wenn das Spiel endlich die versprochenen Features bekommen würde, in einen Zeitraum den die Spieler auch bereit sind zu warten und leider nicht wie hier gezeigt wird Jahre mit kaum nennenswerten Fortschritt.

Ich persönlich unterstütze auch gern mal kleinere Indie-Entwickler und finde dieses Spiel ist kein schlechtes Spiel, aber der kaum ansehenswerte Fortschritt macht es zu einer Qual zu sehen wie dieses Spiel vor sich hin vegetiert. 

Dem jetzigen Stand nach zu Urteilen, wird dass Spiel wahrscheinlich erst in den kommenden 20 Jahren irgendwann vollständig und dass bieten zu können was es versprochen hat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019002074', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1528, 'last_played': 1621099569}
review: Game feels just about abandoned at this point. Buggy, devs seemingly unable to actually put the *game* into the video *game*. I understand a strong desire for intense scientific accuracy, and it's valuable to know the right thing, but paleontology changes every minute and they cannot get hung up circlejerking for literal months on the tiniest level of pixel detailing to be atomically accurate in a *plant* without even mentioning other progress on mechanics and the like. Aside even all this, the game is deeply unfun to play at the moment, too grindy and mechanic-less to provide much but frustration. I backed the Kickstarter hopeful for a game changer and have been left with bitter disappointment and a hole in my wallet literal years later.

author: {'steamid': '76561198278726857', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1449, 'last_played': 1689050790}

author: {'steamid': '76561198966168821', 'num_games_owned': 92, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 642, 'last_played': 1695396928}

author: {'steamid': '76561198066688119', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 2330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1975, 'last_played': 1656542509}
review:
If you want an in-development dinosaur game that has a visible and consistent pace with progress, this is definitely not your game. It's been in the works for years and struggles to keep up with its competition like The Isle and Beasts of Bermuda in regards to playability and improvement. I understand that what this game is trying to accomplish is a difficult balance of gameplay and realism to what Hell Creek was like during the days of the dinosaurs, but I do not believe this would be such an obstacle that it would justify updates taking so long. The team working on the game seems experienced enough that I feel like I'm not being unjust in saying the amount of time it takes for work to be completed and released to the public is glacial at best.. I've gone for months without playing the game at several points during its development, only to come back to no changes apart from minor tweaks and bugfixes.. As other examples of dinosaur games on Steam show, small teams and the overall massive difficulty of game making as a whole does not mean that things have to grind at such a slow pace that even a generally patient person such as myself has gotten tired of waiting.
It is a decent game in its current state, but very clearly missing a whole lot of important gameplay features that I feel should've been focused on and added a long time ago.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040344029', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1688672240}
review: Just to start, the gameplay and graphics, attention to detail and overall feel of the game is AMAZING!  However, the issue lies within development for this one.  The game released on steam August, 2nd 2017 and as of writing this review it is the 17th of the same month, three years later.  I played for a good bit at launch on steam and was pleased and excited to really get into this game.  I took some time away to give the devs time to bring us more content, and that became a habit, reading a devlog, waiting, reading a devlog, waiting...  The problem with the game as it is at the moment is that after 3 years of development the game is still in pre-release, what i would consider alpha, has no real new content aside from a few non-playable dinos and some plants, and you are still locked to playing one dinosaur out of the four they have listed.  I am glad i didn't pay full price or donate to their kickstarter which raised nearly 400% of the ammount they needed to get going.  I do hope i can one day change this review and actually give it a rating it deserves and recommend it to other players, however after 3 years i am not hopeful, especially with current events.

author: {'steamid': '76561198418158844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1163, 'last_played': 1694320559}
review:
I've owned this game for a few(?) years now. It's realistic as far as dinosaur games go, and I do enjoy playing it now that I have a PC that can keep up. 
Some of the AI need work (Raptors, venomous lizards, and those fluffy bipeds that travel in huge packs will just spin in circles attacking you, and will almost never land a hit) 
It takes a long time for updates to come out, but a lot is planned for the future as far as I can tell so hopefully worth the wait.
Gameplay can be repetitive and coupled with the slow development-- you might get bored after a while, especially since as of writing this you can only play as Dakota Raptor. 
A lot of the mechanics are fun, and seeing a t-rex always comes with a strange adrenaline rush. I find myself coming back to play this again after a few updates come out, and it's usually a refreshing experience.
A lot of work and research went into this game, so while I definitely don't think it's a 10/10, it's enjoyable for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198373088332', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1685987859}
review: I may have played this game for only about 6 hours, but it was a fun almost 6 hours. Sure the game needs better optimization but I'm sure that's being worked on. I was only able to stay in one area due to the lag and just about awful optimization, but remember this game is a work in progress! The detail's are amazing, the immersion is amazing, and though we can play as only one animal (as far as I know I haven't played the game in a long while) for right now more are coming. This is just about the most realistic dinosaur game I have experienced. Challenging, real feeling, and looking good! Keep up the good work, and I hope at some point this game is better optimized so I can play more of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085040649', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1654438566}
review: Its a passion project and the devs have made it abundantly clear they are detail oriented and focuses on accuracy and have had steady updates since the game was added to steam. Good things take time and I'm happy that people still make stuff like this. Not for everyone but if you like dinosaurs then you'll probably find this game interesting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163999881', 'num_games_owned': 132, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 672, 'last_played': 1702164032}

author: {'steamid': '76561198024993869', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1684645173}
review:
I only discovered this game a few days ago while watching a paleontology video. I've been on digs in Hell Creek, and have a storage unit full of dinosaur and turtle fossils from eastern MT, so I was cautiously excited.

I read several of the comments, and took note of the ratings, but still went in with an open mind. I'm both a software developer, and someone that has worked in Unity, so I understand the delays that can occur in development. The most important thing I noticed is that the developers still regularly communicate with the community, and are still posting updates.

Going into this game with the mindset that it's still under development, I can forgive the optimisation problems and lack of features. What matters to me is the core mechanics and atmosphere. After playing for over three hours now, I have to say I've really enjoyed it.

Saurian makes you feel like you've stepped back 66 million years. The atmosphere is fantastic (especially the music). I still remember the excitement of getting my first kill as a hatching (it was just a fish, but any food will do when you're hungry!) One of my favorite moments in the game so far was after I went on a long trek into the bluffs. I discovered an ankylosaur (but avoided it, because I was just a juvenile Dakotaraptor). After failing to find any food, I slowly began to starve to death. Just as I resigned myself to my fate, a random Acheroraptor ran right past me. I lept onto it, and pinned it down. It kept me fed for a while.

The game is filled with lots of fun moments like that. If you've ever wanted to be a dinosaur, if just for a few hours, give this game a shot.

I'm patiently awaiting more updates. Great work so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198219996251', 'num_games_owned': 90, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1708809990}
review: Игра мертвая. За 3 года НИЧЕГО не добавили. Интерес заканчивается максимум после 2-х часов игры. Если прям охота поиграть, то лучше приобретать данный товар на всяких юторрентах.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055627017', 'num_games_owned': 297, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 7216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 909, 'last_played': 1683854307}
review: Don't let all the negative reviews let you get the wrong idea about this game. the devs are still very hard at work on the game. It is very fun to trot around in the recreated Hell Creek Formation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057532843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1595659749}
review:
I've been waiting and waiting to pick this game up, and I have to say, I was very let down.

As others have said, It's bare bones, and has hardly ANY of the promised features. Like this would be the Be all game for me if I could do, ya know, dinosaur things. Only 2 dinos are in, and the other 4 are nowhere to be seen. There is only trickle updates from what I've seen, and they do nothing to really effect the gameplay.

I just want a good singleplayer experience where I play as a dinosaur. Is that too much to ask? apparently yes, because this game fails to deliver, and ARK scrapped there plans to do it as well. It's almost becoming a joke at this point.

Only having Dakotaraptor playable you won the game then if you want to start again you start with the same dino. Would be more fun if the others dinos on the dino select part would be playable already cause its only 3 dinos un-playable (T-Rex, Pachy and Trike).
In 3 Years you guys could at least put those dinos playable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198452387691', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1702686666}
review: It's a great little game for any dinosaur fan to pass the time with great visuals.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024221019', 'num_games_owned': 520, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1135, 'last_played': 1602529437}
review: Достоверный мир во всех его проявлениях: в траве, в деревьях, в животных, в населяющих местность животных, в грунте - во всём, только вот одной "энциклопедии" недостаточно, потому что в первую очередь это - игра, а без технической части здесь делать нечего. Пока плохо, очень плохо, хотя могло быть просто прекрасно, но, судя по дискорду разработчиков, их сейчас больше беспокоит политика, нежели качество и наполнение игры.

author: {'steamid': '76561198160917849', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 779, 'last_played': 1594598879}
review: I understand this is supposed to be a simulation rather than a game with a real end goal, but its been 3 years, and the devs got hundreds of thousands of dollars to produce thus far an extremely laggy product with not a lot of usable content for the player to utilize... I'm reading reviews that even people with high end gaming PCs can't run this without lag so I'm not alone with this issue. I have an average PC that can still run pretty much any game I feel like, even a heavily modded out the wazoo Skyrim with hundreds of add-ons, but since recent updates to Saurian I can't even get past the Raptor naming/gender selection screen without it freezing completely, game is completely unplayable for me at this point. last year when I was able to run it there was so much lag it was difficult to move the raptor even on lowest quality settings and so I decided to put it down for a couple months in hopes the devs would improve upon product. No such luck. I think the art is amazing but am a bit disappointed, I feel now that I have wasted $20 on a now currently unusable product for myself. In the game's current state I cannot reccommend to anyone else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198839928777', 'num_games_owned': 900, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1630512801}
review:
Вижу много ученых палеонтологов в отзывах, но да ладно.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003892996', 'num_games_owned': 308, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 389, 'last_played': 1643491127}
review:
-Deep breath-
here I go,

SE~NO-

Saurian has a unique playstyle for dino games - most of them are online games and this one puts a nice play on it having it be singleplayer. The AI are a bit dumb, but hey, it's a work in progress. As much as I enjoy the Isle and Beasts of Bermuda, there are certainly times in those two games that I just get mindlessly slaughtered when all I wanted was a drink of water by people who are guarding said water. It doesn't happen on Saurian. 

Right now there is only one dino to play, and that is the Dakota raptor. Being a Juvi is rather fun, and I was surprised by the mechanics and small little critters available to eat, and if you want the real "isle" experience or as close as you want it to be, their is a realistic mode on which where you can only save on sleeping/growth or on quit, and your save is deleted on death. I've been playing it that way and it's been quite a run of trial and error that I have enjoyed. Climbing trees as a juvi Dakotaraptor and just chilling on tree branches to avoid threats was really fun, jumping from tree to tree and gliding around.

Becoming an sub adult took that away, and replaced it with a fun pounce mechanic that isn't like Evirmas "pounce and you're off within 1 second" mechanic, having you actually press LMB and RMB to maintain your raptor's balance in order to keep up the latch you have on them. It can enable you to take down what you'd think is more than you can chew, such as trikes if you're careful enough. 

However I could argue the game is currently lacking a "hook" for you to keep playing, having only one dino available. I would like to play a trex, or perhaps a pachy(which i'm glad are as fearless and sassy as they are in the game). I crave more content, and I can see this game has some major things going for it. 

in conclusion (tldr version):
- The game is good, mechanics are fun
- However, it is currently lacking for its pricetag of $19.99.
- It is visually pleasing;  the music is rather nice, making it a little scary at night in the beginning.
- There are many critters to kill or challenge, from small lizards to the mighty t-rex. 
- Part of me wishes that their were more calls, but it is nice that the intimidation call (F) actually works and scares things away.

I'd recommend this this game when you see a sale hit it, or when more content comes - but if you are an avid fan of dino games like me, it's worth a pick up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065153548', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1674741008}
review:
This could be a good game. This could be the best dinosaur game ever made. But to do so, development desperately needs to speed up.

At its current state, the game lags to unplayability at some points, even on the lowest settings. Without promised nesting/mate mechanics the game lacks a meaningful objective. And, most importantly, if updates continue to be trickled out as slowly as they are, Kickstarter reach goals won't be added for decades.

When the devs have regrouped, reorganized, and reexamined their priorities, then I could recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561199070015286', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 638, 'last_played': 1630182713}
review:
This game is truly unique as it creates a realistic simulation of a dinosaur experience. In this game you get to 'think' and 'feel' what a dinosaur would have actually felt. This means this is not like 99% of all other games where you are always looking for something to do or how to have a laugh with your mates - the negative reviews for this game likely come from that kind of expectation.

Instead this game is more like a solo meditative experience where you get to exercise your most primal instinct and focus on basic things like hunting, finding fresh water, defending your territory, learning how to kill larger prey, and admiring nature perhaps a bit like in No Man Sky.

While playing you should not worry about doing silly things like attacking large dinosaurs for fun but should worry about things actual animals do. When playing the game I find myself looking for large prey that will keep my stomach full for a while, improving my raptor running agility skills and exploring the map looking for better hunting stops like an actual raptor would. Sometimes after catching a good prey I sit next to it (to protect it from scavengers) and look at the moon and stars for a long time listening to the rain - see, this is the kind of thing this game offers, it's not your typical flashy gaming experience.

Admittedly this game still needs more development and it can become repetitive after reaching the adult stage. But as openly stated it is in pre-alpha stage. I'd love to see more 'nature documentary' details added and especially around the other species AI, overall depth and size of the map. For instance, it would be great to learn from other species, seeing their hunting strategies. It would be great to have even more focus on replicating the realistic "animal experience" and create more immersion around the feeling of wilderness and particularly around the role of scent and how that is affected by thing like rain and water.

If you're a true dinosaur fan, then you should absolutely get yourself lost in this game and appreciate the lengths which the creators went through to create a factual and realistic representation of both fauna and flora in the Cretaceous period. If possible support this lovely game in whichever way you can so it can be further developed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014783495', 'num_games_owned': 424, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1501891543}
review:
I backed this on kickstarter pretty much day 1 and forgot I even had it until a while ago. Hours on here don't match my real playtime.

I'd honestly say The Isle or Beasts of Bermuda have done a better job as far as optimization and gameplay go. It's a shame this game didn't really live up to expectations. I think at the time of backing, my friend and I really wanted a dinosaur game like this. Now there are just other games that do it better. You'd think 200k+ donations and years of development would see this game in a higher state but it's literally unchanged it seems from launch.

But, hey, this is the only product I have ever given my money to and probably will be the last time as well.

This really was the first strand-type game

author: {'steamid': '76561198314403047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 637, 'last_played': 1685285843}
review: This is a Dinosaur fan's dream. The game is even more immersive than the almighty Skyrim, and it's the most historically accurate Dinosaur game ever made. Everything is accurately detailed, from the Broken teeth on the T-rex, to the ridges on the leaves. Paleontologists worked on this game to make it the most accurate game you can get. At the moment, you can only play as a Dakotaraptor, but this year you will be able to play as the Triceratops and the T-Rex, which will be so fun. Along with the base game, there is an encyclopedia, similar to the codex in Battlefield 1, but everything is unlocked. If these reasons aren't enough, there are 30 Different animals to encounter in the game, with more being added later along the line. In short, if you like Dinosaurs, give it a go. It's the best £15 I ever spent

author: {'steamid': '76561198042334367', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1589846269}
review:
I second Valkyrie's review - it provides great advice for the devs that I think I would suggest as well. So far, the game is really just walking around, eating and seeing how long you can survive. I haven't gotten very far yet, since I have had trouble figuring out what the goal is. Do I stick with my initial family, or leave? How do I find other members of my species? Do I just keep finding small animals to eat, drink water, and repeat until I grow?

Some additional guidance from the game on objectives/what I should do would be helpful. If anything, if there was an option to have extra hints or not would be good to have.

Overall, I think it would help if they did release other dinosaurs to play as, so we can provide more feedback and also help the devs find more bugs in a faster time period. I can see how releasing one dinosaur for so long and trying to perfect it will delay the game.

I fully support this game, mostly out of interest in paleo, but also since my professor was referred to for facts used in the game! I am excited for this game to make progress, and I believe in the devs that they can produce a game that they envision.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169914894', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 933, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 401, 'last_played': 1673534459}
review:
El juego esta entretenido, sin embargo hay algunas cosas a tener en cuenta como que solo se puede jugar con un solo dino (dakotaraptor) aunque los otros tres dinos jugables estan por salir (trike, rex y pachy) pero llevan 3 años sin sacar a ningun dino jugable y voy a comentar los pros y los contras de este juego                                                                                                   
PROS:
Este juego intenta recrear la vida del cretacico en Estados unidos, si te gustan los dinosaurios y experimentar como vivian es un buen juego
Los dinos se ven muy bien, estan muy bien modelados.
Es un juego con gran trabajo porque se nota que los desarrolladores han echo este juego con amor y pasion, mucha variedad de plantas, de criaturas para poder cazar e incluso el rex esta increible.
CONTRAS:
El juego esta mal optimizado, debido a que si le bajas los graficos no va a haber un cambio de FPS significativo
La IA habeces haces cosas extrañas como que se quedan atascados en un arbol y no pueden salir
Pocos dinos jugables, solo hay uno para jugar.
En mi opinion el juego esta muy bien si te gustan los dinosaurios, los desarrolladores estan trabajando para sacar el trike para poder jugarlo y dicen que estan muy cerca asi que no hay que desesperarse, yo lo compraria para este verano (que es la fecha en la cual creo que el trike se podra jugar, no estoy seguro) yo lo e comprado antes para dar un apollo a los desarrolladores ya que es un juego con potencial.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060867916', 'num_games_owned': 87, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1504204166}
review:
Bloß weg bleiben von diesem Spiel. Als es auf Kickstarter war, kam mehr als die 4fache Summe zusammen, die für das Spiel benötigt wurde, es wurden viele der Zusatzziele (Multiplayer und so ) erreicht. Jetzt, nach mehreren Jahren auf Steam, haben wir.....
*TROMMELWIRBEL*
absolut NICHTS davon. Wir haben einen einzigen spielbaren Dino - und auch der ist nicht mal ansatzweise komplett. Der 2. spielbare Dino wurde eigentlich letztes Jahr versprochen, dann Funkstille. Die einzigen "Updates", die die Spieler bekommen, sind die Devlogs, in denen sie sich drüber aufgeilen, was für eine tolle neue Textur sie für Blätter und Baumrinde oder ähnlichen Schrott hinbekommen haben. Die Devs haben das Geld von Kickstarter (und natürlich auch den Verkäufen selbst) genommen und das Spiel jetzt mehr oder weniger verlassen, es ist maximal ein Nebenprojekt, wenn überhaupt. Definitiv keine 20€ wert. Ganz davon abgesehen, dass es ein Lotteriespiel ist, wie gut das Spiel auf dem Gerät läuft.
Zum Vergleich: Isle kostet auch 20€, bietet mehrere spielbare Dinos, Multiplayer und wird wohl eher aktiv bearbeitet. Lustigerweise trotz eines kleineren Dev Teams
Ein absoluter Fehlkauf meinerseits, ich hatte große Hoffnungen und wurde bitter enttäuscht

author: {'steamid': '76561198345892029', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 761, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1693820469}
review:
Came back to review after multiple updates and over a year of not playing. Unfortunately I still cannot recommend it, the updates don't seem to have made many differences beyond some performance issues. The game is still very dry and bland, and even with the new mechanics of mating and nesting it's basically a nothing sandwich. I find my mate which takes nothing, do a boring two second courtship dance, incubate for a day and a half and then my eggs hatch with damn near a .5 second cutscene and then the hatchlings are never seen. I'm not asking for anything gross or cringe with cutscenes I just want to feel some sort of accomplishment especially after eggs hatch. It was really disappointing when no babies appeared. This could be a bug, but at this point in development (literal years) it's becoming tiring defending this as being in pre-alpha.

 It doesn't help that the AI in this game is some of the actual worst I've ever worked with. Everything in this game might as well be brain dead. I feel bad being so critical and harsh but it has been YEARS since I bought this game at full price so you can understand my frustration. HOWEVER, I still give the developers props for continuing on unlike other's that just give up and never touch the game again...

It's just disappointing because I can really see the potential in this game, the models are really nice especially the Dakotaraptor and Tyrannosaurus. However, you're not given much to do except run around, eat, drink, and that's it. I understand as a dinosaur simulation game that's what they did but you have to make a unique fun experience out of it and in the end it just feels like work.

Definitely regret buying this one in the state it's in.

author: {'steamid': '76561198289581564', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 804, 'last_played': 1620934026}
review: I've purchased Saurian in early 2017. Personally, I really liked it at first. I understood that the lack of features in the game were due to an early release. So, at the time, I moved on and waited for the game to progress. I expected that within a year this game would easily overtake The Isle and other popular dinosaur games due to it's charm and realism. After all, I always wanted a realistic open world dinosaur survival game, specifically set in the Hell Creek formation, hence why I followed this game since the early months of 2015. I was wrong. 3 years later, the game is the exact same. No game-changing updates have been issued  since I first opened this game. This game is total garbage compared to the swiftly advancing dinosaur games around today. There is nothing to do, you just grow up as a dinosaur that you've already grown multiple times, and the game play isn't even interesting. It's glitch-ridden and repetitive, and derivative. I accepted it at first because I though it'd advance, but as I mentioned previously, it just didn't. If you're considering buying this, please just fucking don't. Get The Isle, Path of Titans, heck, even Beasts of Bermuda. Or just play a Miniclip game. That'd be more entertaining than this at the moment. Such wasted potential. I give this a 2/10. At least it's scientifically accurate lol

author: {'steamid': '76561198239458256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2838, 'last_played': 1656226724}
review:
makes the isles update look like grease lightning.
bought this game years ago when i started trying dinosaur survival games.

is NOT worth the 20$ price tag.
theres plenty of other dinosaur survival games out there that offer realistic dinosaurs and realism that already have multiplayer and more dinosaur options.

this is the one dinosaur game i honestly feel depressed in once i have become an adult after hours and hours of wait.
with no multiplayer, waiting for hours seems rather useless so why even have such a long growth timer?
it took me only a day to play both species and get bored of the game with BARELY anything to offer other then never ending roaming of a map that has nothing but trees, trees and more trees with the occasional river leading into the ocean ..

after playing the game all the way through, i found that i regretted not refunding my money sooner as i  honestly never play it... the update speed is slower than frozen molasses.
i got this game back around 2017 and the only thing to come out of it since has been a few puny ai classes and some tweaks to the animations and recently a new playable class that honestly feels the same as playing the other class but a tiny bit easier.

ai RARELY feel threatening as they often do really out of character things or constantly just pace back and forth until they find something to kill before moving on to something else to kill.
easy to outsmart and often give up easily making this game feel so dull... if you can call it that...

anymore i literally just watch videos of the games  updates rather than bothering to reinstall it as the space and time this game takes up are not worth it.....
please consider watching a lets play of this game before spending your money on it first as it gets super boring fast even in a lets play

author: {'steamid': '76561198019158651', 'num_games_owned': 375, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1706590444}
review:
At current, Saurian, while it was initially promising at the start is not in a state that is actively engaging to players. I've owned this game for a very long time, and very little has been done to keep players actually 'hooked' with the game. Triceratops, which is meant to be the next playable animal, has been teased for years now without much else to go for it.

I do still believe this game has a lot of potential, but some things will need to change in the company and its design team and overall plan with the game. Notably:

-Replacing the Project Manager
-Pushing out routine snapshot updates of playable animals like the Triceratops
-Creating a tighter schedule for development of features
-Getting greater community involvement to reignite player trust

Saurian, as a game, is suffering from 'perfection-syndrome'. While its understandable that devs want their content to be as functionally pleasing as possible, it results in long development times, and creates a greater potential cliff for both player burnout and bad reception. 

This is especially a problem when people have already sunken money into a game that, while early access, is still very unfinished and probably shouldn't been released as an EAT to begin with. Furthermore, whoever is running the overall project has done quite poorly at maintaining a more rigid development timetable for the rest of the staff. 

After years of development, while there's been plenty of bugfixing and a few graphical and gameplay changes, there's been no real 'meat' for the players. Instead, Saurian in its current state is a walking simulator with a few interesting gimmicks and nothing else. With only a single animal to play, and limited options in content, the game is too bland and the wondrous effect of the scenery and time-period wears off rather quickly after a few hours. 

This is, indeed, a harsh criticism but I do not want to discourage the dev team, but provide feedback that they can learn from. This product has great potential, but things need to be done better and a higher standard enforced. Even if the triceratops or other playable animals aren't scrubbed yet of their quirkiness and bugs, they need to be released in snapshots to players. 

This achieves two things: It allows greater play-testing by providing loads of feedback about these animals and greatly increases the pool for bug-searching - thus reducing development pressure. Secondly, it engages players by making them feel they have some input into the development of the game and keeps them invested. 

As it stands right now, the developers are left to test things themselves and are too busy trying to perfect every facet before releasing them. Thus, we've had to wait a long time for very little. Now, normally, I would be pressing hard for a refund.

I don't mind supporting indie developers but when I feel they are squandering away on useless details and the money has not gone to good use, especially when it could have been invested into something more worthwhile, I become rather jaded as would anyone. Because not only has my money been wasted but also my time. 

I will say though that this is not an instance where I will press for a refund. I do believe wholeheartedly in fact that the developers for this game are very passionate about this project. I see it during the blog updates and the time they put into the bug-testing and development. Unfortunately, the business decisions made here were based on very poor judgement and need to be rectified if the project has any hope of being successful or even continuing. 

Now, me supporting an early access title (EAT) is a risky investment, especially if I plan to invest more money later. This has not been lost on me, but sometimes the pay-off is well deserved. Would I recommend this game to other players? Yes and no. 

I would recommend it if/when the developers heed my advice and take better care to keep the community engaged. The potential is there to make a great, unique title. However, I would not recommend buying it right now. It is too unfinished, and better to be put on the back burner and checked on every once in awhile to see how it is doing. 

I would offer my services even if I thought it'd be useful in regards to better management. However, what I can offer to the dev team is the above criticisms and this final note: 

I wish you luck in the development of the project, but I do hope that some changes are made to avoid burnout with the community. Otherwise, the title will never rebound and not succeed at all. It is time for some good reflection on the project and on business practices that are currently hurting it. You are very passionate, and that's a rarity for many EATs - and one of the reasons I think there's room to grow.

review:
I spent my money on this game just due to the concept,but eventhough the development is super slow,you have to realise that these guys are working really hard to make this as real as possible and honestly,this is one of the only games I know of that has feathered dinosaurs and they have not pulled out yet and im sure that if they do they will have a valid reason,this game is NOT trying to be another succesor to JPOG,it is probably just a bunch of nerds that love exactly what we all love.
This game does have amazing potential and if they do pull out im sure another studio will take lots of notice to this game due to the concept,honestly im mixed on this game at the time of writing,but I dont want to base my opinons on just what is happening now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198272879692', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1615490076}
review: This is a realistic dinosaur simulator in which the developers have clearly done some serious research into the most up-to-date information on the flora fauna, and the environment. It is a lot of fun to begin with, but can get slightly more boring over time with the same things like eating, fighting and drinking becoming tedious. The controls are easy, but I think the game could benefit from adding slightly more information in their tutorial hints! :) As it currently stands it is a great game, and I look forward to see the developers hard work paying off in the future! Looking forward to playing trike when it releases!

author: {'steamid': '76561198355508043', 'num_games_owned': 47, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 820, 'last_played': 1649079079}
review: The game is alright I have played around 13 hours of it and during those hours i see potential. Sadly however this game has had very little updates to add or change things for one I can remember when they said there will be 4 playable species and right now and since launch...only one about 3 years ago now. Now im no game dev yet and i can tell you from other games that this is has taken way to long for others and they keep posting about the upcoming trike....well that has been somewhat of a year now. What im saying is this is a good game its somewhat accurate but the devs have taken way to long to update for me until updates come regularly and more playable dino's im going to have to put saurian to rest until that day comes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198240712332', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1602300546}
review: I was so hyped for this game. The idea of a survival game with accurate dinosaurs was a dream come true for the younger me who was just getting into the study of prehistoric life. Yet this game hasn't changed at all in the last three or so years. I want to love this game but due to slow progress by the developers, and the lack of certain dinosaurs from this time and location, I cannot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198209784336', 'num_games_owned': 14, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1555507256}
review:
Есть тревожные мысли что это финальный вид игры, фпс и графон останутся такими же даже до выхода 3 халвы. Думал что это будет хорошая однопользовательская игра, которая соблюдает все правила природы, не то что какой-нибудь The Isle с пьяной компанией диплодоков и тирексов гуляющих по лужайке и базарящих у кого дино лучше прокачен. 
Абсолютно унылый ИИ, мир мертв, даже осенняя природа подмосковья по-экзотичней выглядит чем этот Хелл Крик
Динозавры тут больше напоминают полигоны покрытые мхом, в том же Spore можно сделать круче с модами
Атмосфера отсутствует полностью, больше макет парка напоминает. 
Но всё, обругал я тут все знатно, доволен и спокоен
Теперь осталось такому тупому школьнику, как я, допереть что это инди игра, которую делают 5-6 человек, без особой поддержки, и что надо было понять на что я подписываюсь...

review:
Though it has been in Early access for the past 2 and a half years. I understand the struggles of the Development and wait patiently. But even then with just Dakotaraptor as the only playable, this game is still a fun way to pass some time. This game is and will be a Must have for any person interested in Dinosaurs especially when the game is fully out including the 2 extra playables.

Post Triceratops Patch: Amazing, I love it. Still a really fun game to pass the time especially when you have nothing else to play. It's really fun as a Triceratops trying to waddle away from a Tyrannosaurus Rex with lunch on it's mind. Can't wait for the AI and future playables to get more fleshed out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140619745', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1688804212}
review:
I've been following this game's progress since the initial development stage back in 2015-16. For years now we have been promised new features, new species and new ways to play the game. It's now 2020 and there haven't been any major updates to the game in over a year now. I had high hopes for this game as it's one of the first of its kind to come out. It's incredibly disappointing to see that it has taken this long and in the Devblogs, all we get is updates on the plant life and the cosmetic stuff. I have worked in game development and i am aware that the developers have jobs and lives outside this game.. but you owe it to the community that has supported you for so long to get the job done. I don't recommend buying this game until the developers pony up and do what their backers have paid them to do.

Edit: It's now 2023 and more details have come out, apparently one of the people on the dev team took off with money that was meant for developing this game. I sympathise with the other devs, but i believe now that this game is dead. They have decided to discontinue the dev logs. Unless they prove me wrong and actually release the rex, this game is dead.

review:
Honestly,the game is not fun.

Yes the game is still in heavy development,but the game has been out for a long time and i feel like there should be so much more stuff. Honestly,dont get this game.Its not fun and it gets boring SUPER quick. Just play the isle instead,its much better in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198190591243', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 953, 'last_played': 1635612634}
review:
I don't know what to do now, the game is horrendous.
I loved this game to bits, and it used to run decently well. Even if the frame rate tanked to 10 seconds per frame when I did The Raptor restrain attack, I still can eat lizard with well-timed click. Now when I come back, the raptor mini game now works smoothly.

But the hit detection/bite box is horrendous. I've chased big target like Archaeopteryx and the venomous large lizard and keep biting air. I know it possible to bite them without aim mode because I survived to age 2 without aim. Speaking about aim, the transition from 3rd person to 1st person is terribly disorienting with barely noticeable cross-hair that might turn into the same colour as the grass and occasionally have your dinosaur model blocking your vision.

The sensitivity is out of control. I set the sensitivity to the lowest just to accidentally turn my view 120 degree just tilting left or right, but in aim mode, it becomes impossible to look any way but right ahead. It's seems that sensitivity setting only effect aim mode somehow?

One time the venom lizard just stop moving and I stand right on top of it, repeatedly biting and nothing happen. I go in aim mode to bite and nothing happens. I move closer and bite, the lizard start trashing, but else, nothing happens. 

I've die so many time to starvation with small and large lizard right under me. All my successful hunts own to the lizard just stop running for some reason and give me the opportunity to reposition myself for 5 times.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024850227', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 985, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 954, 'last_played': 1619188709}
review:
I don’t think you should buy it just from how long the game has been in development and what progress has been made.  I would wait until the developers have released a more substantial patch, then give them your money.  At the moment, the game is incredibly boring due to the lack of content.  It’s a survival game, (it is still EA) but at this time, it’s more like a hiking simulator.   There isn’t enough content (for me at least) to justify a purchase, and that if you do, you might be waiting another seven just to have a finished product.
	
	I highly suggest that before you buy you read the Saurian’s General Discussions forum.  You’ll get some reasons from others on why they feel fed up about progress.
