author: {'steamid': '76561198882258687', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 928, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1619232315}
review: The game is fun the first time you play, but gets incredibly same-y, it feels like a glorified walking simulator at times and is buggy and poorly optimized. The game is in pre-alpha, sure, but it has been for years now, the development of this game is going at a snail's pace, and yes, I know the dev team is small, but similar small development teams like for prehistoric kingdom, a much harder game to design as well, has been going through development much faster, and actually has a release goal very soon. This game however, has a foggy future, the priorities of the developers are messed up, instead of getting the basic playables done for a pre-alpha, they care more about scientifically accurate tree bark. I don't see this game coming out very soon, maybe it won't be finished at all. I just hope they will fulfill the promise they made to those thousands of kickstarters, and maybe use some of that money to hire more experienced developers who will help them set a better, brighter path. I really want this game to be amazing, but for now my hope's just about run dry.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081083022', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 585, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1676331499}
review:
I held off on writing this review for a long time. I waited to see where the game would be by the new year, but as it is, I cannot recommend this game to anyone unless you have money to burn and want to roam around a map as a single species of dinosaur. I helped Kickstart this when that was still going and while the concept was great at the time, an accurate dinosaur simulator down to the animals and plants, the time it's been in development to what we currently have in game is not worth it. As of this moment, I would recommend the Isle over this.

The game seems to be in limbo as of this moment, the prior devlogs only talking about textures on plants and whatnot, not really what anyone wants to hear when, after 2-3 years now, we still only have one playable when others were promised. Multiplayer was mentioned, when that was planned to be one of the later goals of the game. I've had frame rate and bug issues running rampant that never seem to actually be fixed, one being such I couldn't eat/drink and eventually ended up starving to death. Took me 3 tries to finally get a raptor that could eat properly. There seems to be a massive lack of communication between devs and players, as the forums show what people are concerned about with the game, though it seems the complaints fall on deaf ears. 

If this game actually ever does pick up again and we get good, solid updates that actually add to the game, I may change my review in time. But as of now, I cannot recommend this to anyone. Super slow development, only one playable, buggy AI, just not worth it after 2-3 years of being in EA.

author: {'steamid': '76561198813824538', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1617493196}
review:
TL;DR - Horrible FPS no matter the settings, constant crashing and my system is a very good system that does not have issues with any other game. I have faith in the game however and I will not give up hope, but because I can't play it, I can't reccommend. Maybe if you have a crazy insane gaming set up I can suggest it, but you might be surprised of it's inability to run on capable systems, like me.



I adore survival games. I adore survival games where you have to play as something other than a human. I adore dinosaurs.
I want to adore Saurian. I really do.

The models look amazing and the overall feel of the game look great! I play (and love) The Isle and I was hoping for another splendid dino survival game like it, but single player. I picked the game up as soon as I could.

However, no matter what I make my settings and no matter what I have running on my computer, I cannot get this game to run smoothly. It takes ages to load in (if I can at all, before crashing) and when I can finally get in the game it can only get to around 10 FPS. If I try to save it crashes. No matter how low I make my graphics this game just cannot be played. 

I do not have a crappy computer either! It runs massive games like Monster Hunter and The Isle on good graphics just fine! I can play Minecraft with 40+ mods loaded in and it's just fine! It's just Saurian that runs this poorly and I cannot understand why and I'm very dissappointed. I'm hoping as more features are added and the game is updated this issue will be resolved. I'm aware it might just be an issue with my system but that doesn't make sense considering what I can do with my computer without any of these problems. 

I will not give up on Saurian. I just cannot reccomend it for now even if you think your system can run it. You might be surprised how bad it runs. Maybe there's some crazy miracle setting I can add to better the FPS so I will allow comments and suggestions!

author: {'steamid': '76561198123200436', 'num_games_owned': 163, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1598405453}
review:
Fantastic little game, though I can't help but think it's been released far too early. I've been wanting this for a while and finally grabbed it when it was on sale. The biggest sell-point for me is the scientifically accurate dinosaurs (as far as we know) and it's a DREAM to play as an accurate raptor - feathers, no broken wrists, not over-powered. I finally made it to adult and I felt it was pretty involved and fun to keep my little raptor alive! 

I especially appreciate the flora and fauna here, I believe they made it as accurate as they know for Hell's Creek. It's a great little adventure into a time long ago that actually existed on Earth. 

I really hope the devs can release more dinos soon, I'll be keeping an eye on this one for sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198273462426', 'num_games_owned': 55, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 727, 'last_played': 1511474249}
review:
By far the most disappointing game to release on Dinosaurs. 

This game set up high expectations to the community in 2016-2017, saying this would be a hyper-realistic dinosaur game with a variety of dinosaurs and flawless historical accuracy. This game tried to sell itself as one of the best, and ended up being one of the worst. What they don't tell you, is after 3 years of development they still have only one playable dinosaur, hardly triple a graphics, and nothing promising about the game. You spawn as the only creature you can play as and you try to live against the few other threats in the game. Even after these magnificent trailers showcasing people moving in herds of trikes and hunting together, all you get is this... thing. 

The game promised three-four years ago that after around a year or two of development multiplayer would be a thing. Four years later, we stand with not even another playable creature since release or any other considerable update.

It's funny, they were given hundreds of thousands of dollars and 4x the amount they asked for and still we get nothing out of the game seven years later. What a scam.

author: {'steamid': '76561199013588587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1577424223}
review: The only reason I would not recommend this to all people is, you need a decent PC or laptop. The moment I open the game everything goes fine and runs smoothly. But when I sit through the 5 minutes of loading screen, the frames drop to make it basically unplayable. It's the only game on my computer that has this problem. There may be updates in the future, but for now, my Windows laptop just doesn't want to run this game.

review: The game itself has been in a stagnate sad state for far too long. This feels like a complete and utter cash grab and I feel like my efforts to get any sort of refund would be in vain. The game crashes and is overall an ugly game. I also hope you enjoy playing only in a windowed 480p resolution. The game is terrible. I can't even begin to comprehend why someone would want to make this purchace. Please, I beg of you do not buy this game. It isn't even worth the download if it become free to play. You get nothing. My advice is get a FREE roblox account and play the dinosaur simulators there. They have arguably better graphics and you'll at least get some enjoyment from the experience at hand.

review: Saurian is one of the most boring games I have ever had the misfortune to play. No multiplayer, only one species, and nothing else to do besides wandering around a bland, uninteresting map. On top of this, all the developers care about is scientific accuracy and not making the game play experience any more engaging. All they want to do is tout the game as a 20 dollar paleoart piece while forgetting that it's a video game. This is without a doubt the worst 20 dollars I have ever spent in my 24 years on this Earth

i would like to give it 4/10 but still recommend

i give this score because of the numerous glitches and bugs i have encounter and not only that the lack of tutorial makes it even more difficult (it took me 3 days to find out i could glide, climb trees and group up which i was unable to do so) and not only that the dev team have been working on this game since 2013 and i have notice they are focusing more on "how pretty it looks" instead of "this should work properly".

author: {'steamid': '76561198052663622', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1577216479}
review:
3/10

Saurian fails at every single aspect of what it's trying to be, whether you look at it as a whole or look at individual aspects in a vacuum. Come back in maybe, eight years? It might be ready by then, probably won't be, probably never will be. 

I'm one of the suckers who backed the Kickstarter and I've been waiting for this game to be... well a game, since give or take 2013 when it was announced. It's not coming anytime soon.


Saurian "as a Game":

If you are interested in Saurian as a fun dinosaur simulator you will be sorely disappointed. It's pretty much unplayable because of poor performance and ample bugs, and what little content is included gets over-polished (sometimes multiple times) ensuring nothing new will ever be added at anything resembling a normal development pace. You will be waiting months or years (yes, years) between updates that don't even add all that much.

The last update as of writing (Dec 2019) was in March of 2019, and the last before that in December of 2018. It seems unlikely there is any real risk of the game being abandoned given how much "new" (see; not in the game, potentially ever) content is shown off so frequently, but that doesn't justify this beyond sloppy execution. A large part of releasing an early access title is committing to the promise that you will not only finish your game, but will actively upkeep it and provide the players with maintenance. The team seems actively opposed to bug fixes or patches, instead side-lining what few fixes they do add to later include them in larger content patches that invariably introduce new bugs themselves.

If you want to have fun running around as a dinosaur you should buy ARK Survival Evolved and install some mods that let you do just that. It's far from an ideal experience but even that will do more for you than this game does right now. 


Saurian "as a Promise":

Saurian has existed in some form for almost a decade, surfacing as little more than professional concept art in the early 2010's. That is, concept art and a promise; "Saurian will be the dinosaur simulator game that is as realistic and scientifically accurate as possible, delivering both an immersive and true to nature experience." paraphrased mind you.

That is to say that this game has, since its public inception, marketed itself as a scientifically rigorous product. I have nothing against fantasy dinosaurs, after all the dinosaur names we know are as much beasts of myth that live in public perception as they are titles for the real animals that once lived. But false advertising is false advertising.

Saurian's team is not trying to create a scientifically accurate dinosaur simulator. They do not care about being scientifically accurate. Scientific accuracy is to them, a tool, not a reason, not even a set of guidelines to work within.

As a concrete example of the team ignoring scientific accuracy, maniraptoran* hands show evidence of the fingers being covered in feathers, of a propatagium on the front edge of the arm/wing, and the second and third finger of many species show evidence of being connected suggesting this was a common trait of the group. The Dakotaraptor in-game displays none of these features, despite all of them sans the feathers being something generally well regarded as fact since the 1980's, and the feathered fingers are something anyone doing modern reconstructions of this group is most likely aware of, especially if they purportedly work with experts.

OK, you made a mistake, oh well. Here's the kicker though, they acknowledged this and then proceeded to make the same errors again with Anzu and Stenonychosaurus. They simply don't care about getting details like these right, and yet continue to advertise the game as "rigorously detailed and scientifically accurate".

* For the benefit of the uninitiated, maniraptorans is the group containing Velociraptor, Oviraptor, birds, and the immediate relatives of each. It also contains Alvarezsauria, Therizinosaurs, and Scansoriopterygians (the "dragon winged" dinosaurs) but they all have highly specialized hands and so are not relevant here.

Then we have the T. rex., and I get it, there's a new super popular paper out there that's gotten a lot of press stirred up about how "Jurassic Park was actually right all along and feathers are wrong and lame a-f bro", and being the fakes you are you want to immediately ditch for a scaly rex the moment it becomes even vaguely defendable. 

I think it's a poor decision scientifically based on frankly minimal evidence based on a paper that makes really damned bold assumptions about variably interpreted tissue samples (some people say skin, some say scales) that are CENTIMETERS across... But whatever. If you want to have a scaly Tyrannosaurus, go for it.

But don't brag about how changing it needlessly is some huge great thing that makes your game more accurate, when you can't be bothered to get off your hind ends and fix things that are objectively incorrect about your designs. 

300 something hours spent redesigning the Tyrannosaurus to get what I would have come up with in ten minutes if you said "make it technically accurate, but no feathers", and they bragged about how long they spent on this thing. They BRAGGED about how many resources they flagrantly wasted.

Saurian is not worth your time, and it sure as heck wasn't worth mine. The level of incompetence on display on simply every front is astounding and disheartening.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035380978', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1674680820}
review:
Still serious gameplay issues, but--and a can't stress this enough--you can walk around as a *dinosaur*.

on the technical side: 
I wasn't able to control my mouse sensitivity, which I think would have helped compensate for the lag. 

The game does run slow, especially if you've got a lot of animals in frame. There aren't a lot of options to tweak to compensate as of yet. 

gameplay: 
If you can tap into your old-school gamer and get over the lag, the gameplay is actually fantastic. I found myself really enjoying the hunting mechanic once I'd had some practice. Other animals in the world are actually dangerous and you have to keep your wits about you. The stakes of survival feel high enough that just exploring the world is an engrossing experience. 

All in all, more excited about what's to come than mad at an unfinished game for being unfinished.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030263174', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 563, 'last_played': 1660246791}
review:
You know. This game has great potential. I bought it, when it was first advertised on steam. I'm  a dino lover, and I am indeed looking forward to yet see, a dino simulator which does the job. 

I will keep it short. This game has been standing still for years, and I chose to support the devs by spending my money on this game. We've for many years seen no other playable dino than the first. The only playable dino plays exactly like it did in the start. (no change there), and the game is simply laggy as hell and nearly unenjoyable because of overpowered AI, AI stupidity and being able to run halfway through trees. Devs keep showing us their work in progress and log. Latest update being refining the bark on a fucking tree. How about doing some hardcore refining on the game mechanics, AI and adding content that makes the game enjoyable.

I remember when the Isle was dumb and bare boned. The way the Isle kept making the game interesting, was by refining and adding enjoyable elements to the game, such as new maps, scent,  and other playables. 

I suggest the devs to make the player enable a map, so we get an idea of where we are going and so that you atleast could find your way through the map. If ya get lost, the fast draining og your food and water level will get you killed. This makes it impossible to explore. I'm getting all worked up about how this game is standing still with no interesting features, simply because it all feels like one big scam. Updates are also coming out so slow, that by the time the game will be enjoyable, no one would play it, because it will be outdated before it even came into existence.

FFS.  DONT BUY.

The devs recieved MANY THOUSANDS of dollars on kickstarter, and all they've done is take the money and fucked us all on it. I demand an explenation, a transparrent in depth telling on what is going on. Untill now, this game has been nothing by a bloody scam. Shame on you devs. Are you even listening to the reviews on steam? How dare you cunts, gather hundreds of thousands of dollars and then spend 80% time jacking off into your 100 dollar bills, the other ten making devlogs and the last 10 laughing about the money you've gathered. 

SHAMEFUL

I'm sorry, but this is what I feel about the game. I hope they very soon own up to the task and put in some serious work. If you are having trouble, employ some more devs with all the money you've recieved from used to be hoping fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120187539', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1574864293}
review:
これをゲームとして売るのはやめたほうがいいですね。
作者は多分恐竜は好きなんでしょうけどゲームになってませんし、3年でこの出来では今後も期待できません。

2017年のレビュー見て「こんなんとっくに修正されとるやろ…」って思ってやってみたら
まじで食い物がトカゲくらいしかないですし、草食恐竜のしっぽに当たっただけで即死します。エフェクトも何もなし。
3年でここまで進歩無いのは逆にすごい。これ程までにやる気ないならSteamから消したほうがいいのでは？

正直この作品は惜しい所まで行ってる。
右クリ時のエイムカメラは恐竜の真横に付く感じで迫力あったし、常にこの状態で遊べるように調整したらかなり臨場感ある。
しかし現状エイム中のカメラ感度が変えられず、ものすごいゆっくり動く状態なので実質エイムは役に立たない。

普通のゲームならあって当たり前のダメージエフェクトがあるだけでもいいのに、それが無いから「これ当たってんの？」という不安が常にやる気を削いでくる。

一段階くらい成長すると飛び掛かりアクションが解禁されるが、別に威力が高いわけでもなくすぐに振り払われるため、10数回飛び掛かっても倒せない。振り払われないためにFlapコマンドがあるが、スタミナ消費がアホみたいにでかいので途中で降りて再度飛び掛かるのと変わらない。
さらに自分よりでかい相手限定なので、常に即死の危険が伴う中張り付かないといけない。
何のために新技覚えさせたの？

一発即死じゃなくせめて数発耐えてくれるだけ、自機のダメージも多少マシにしてくれるだけ…
それだけでこの作品がゲームになるはずなのに、どうしてこの状態で数年経過するのか理解できない。
設定されてる数値が滅茶苦茶。センス無いってレベルじゃない。

ちなみにこれは一番低い難易度Casualの話です。
Casualはセーブするタイミングがいつでも、Normalは寝た時、その上の難易度では死ぬとセーブデータが消えます。
難易度ってセーブデータが残るタイミングの話じゃないよね普通？
Casualは少し攻撃・防御が高いみたいですけど結局ほとんどの攻撃で即死ですからもはや関係ないです。

セールだから買ってみましたけどこれは無い。これで定価$20は失笑物。
TheIsleもひどかったけどこっちのがひどい。定価$3くらいが妥当。
$1のDinosaurHuntの方がまだゲームの体を成している分遥かにマシ。

author: {'steamid': '76561198871954168', 'num_games_owned': 71, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 976, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 734, 'last_played': 1677444414}
review:
Da ich dieses Spiel sehr mag und sehr lange darauf gewartet habe und überlegt habe, ob ich es mir kaufen soll, möchte ich hier jetzt auch mal etwas positives hinterlassen. 
Das Spiel hat seine Fehler und Macken und man braucht Geduld wegen der Ladezeiten und manchmal spielt man mit <20 FPS, ABER deswegen heißt es ja auch Early Access. 
Ich persönlich finde, dass das Spiel bereits absolut spielbar ist, auch auf einem eher mittelmäßigem Laptop. Natürlich sind weitere spielbare Dinosaurier und mehr Features wünschenswert und sind ja auch geplant, aber wie andere schon geschrieben haben wird es von einem kleinen Team entwickelt, so weit ich weis sogar nur auf Hobbybasis (?) und meinen Respekt hat das Team auf jeden Fall. 

Am Negativstem ist mir aufgefallen, und ich will dazu sagen, dass das für manche Spieler wahrscheinlich kaum Priorität hat, dass manche Errungenschaften, Bone Butte, King of the Hill, und die beiden Versteckten nicht funktionieren, eines davon kann aber glaube ich noch gar nicht funktionieren. 
Eine Anregung wäre auf jeden Fall auch ein Nesting-System und die Möglichkeit, mit Artgenossen Kontakt aufzunehmen, zum Beispiel um freundliche Absichten zu zeigen.

Zusammengefasst kann ich das Spiel absolut für Spieler empfehlen, die Geduld mitbringen und diese Art von Spiel mögen. Andere sollten sich vielleicht eher überlegen, für was sie ihr Geld ausgeben. Und das  Team verdient in meinen Augen für das, was sie bereits geleistet haben und auch für die sehr unterhaltsamen Devlogs vollstes Lob. Auch wenn es lange dauert, lieber am Schluss einen Hit, weiter so!

author: {'steamid': '76561198180230769', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 243, 'playtime_forever': 1752, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 764, 'last_played': 1706024991}
review:
[i]Поскольку игра вышла два года назад, но все еще находится в раннем доступе, буду говорить только о том, что есть.[/i]

Итак, дамы и господа, добро пожаловать в поздний меловой период! Вас ждут голодные дакотарапторы, флегматичные тираннозавры, архиагрессивные пахицефалозавры и раздражающе кусачие крокодилы!
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1914905440
Начинаем выживание!
[code]Творческая и креативная страница Куратора [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/31787316/]YroMIR ReviewS[/url] ждет вас. Подпишитесь! Поддержите качество на просторах Steam. Приятного ознакомления![/code]
[b][h1]ПЛЮСЫ[/h1][/b]
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1914904931
[list]
[*][b]Симулятор динозавра.[/b] Не охоты на динозавра. Не парка с динозаврами. Не выживания с динозаврами. Просто. Динозавра. К сожалению, пока что доступен только один вид — недавно обнаруженный дакотараптор — но разработчики стараются, да-с. И — никаких людей. Никакой техники. Никаких инопланетян. Динозавры, крокодилы, птицы, млекопитающие, ящерицы. И немного хористодер на закуску.
[*][b]Научная достоверность.[/b] Не все решения разработчиков абсолютно верны — скажем, оперение взрослого тираннозавра является лишь предположением, ведь на всех отпечатках шкуры этого вида обнаружена чешуя, а последние перья носил еще далекий предок тирекса — но разработчики действительно постарались воссоздать кусочек природы Северной Америки 65 миллионов лет назад. Все, от цвета почв до вида растений и самих динозавров — лепота, абсолютная палеонтологическая лепота...
[*][b]Неплохой ИИ.[/b] Конечно, идеальным его не назвать, но крокодилы стараются при опасности уйти в воду, сравнительно мелкие травоядные — убегают, отчаянно маневрируя, а анатозавры — не реагируют, пока не подойдешь вплотную. Вдобавок, млекопитающие в лице дидельфодона стараются выбираться наружу только ночью, а птицы улетают, стоит хоть чуть-чуть к ним приблизиться.
[*][b]Полная свобода действий.[/b] Конечно, в пределах возможностей динозавра, но мы можем творить все, что душа желает: бегать, прыгать, утолять жажду в реке, ловить крокодилов на отмелях и нападать на взрослого здорового тираннозавра просто потому, что хочется (реальный дакотараптор, полагаю, до такой ереси никогда бы не дошел...). По сути, симулятор жизни динозавра именно этим и является... ну, исключая тот факт, что года жизни тут протекают всего за пару дней, а секса нет. И не ищите.
[/list]
[b][h1]МИНУСЫ[/h1][/b]
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1914905067
[list]
[*][b]Графика не фонтан.[/b] Я не скажу, что она ужасна, но порой-таки задевает, когда, к примеру, текстурки проваливаются под землю, или ночной вид реки — ужас и мрак. Модельки динозавров выглядят хорошо, но идеально — лишь в статике: в динамике, увы, тут же начинаются дикие перекосы, подергивания и заносы.
[*][b]Наполнение все еще скудновато.[/b] К сожалению, мир «Saurian» пока что выглядит полупустым: ни поваленных деревьев, ни старых трупов (или костей), ни каких-нибудь насекомых, на худой конец. Ясное дело, разработчики старались вводить в игру только то, что найдено, но, ей-богу, напоминает мем со штанами Арагорна.
[*][b]Баги, вылеты.[/b] Поскольку это предрелизная версия, надеюсь, что в будущем разработчики смогут это исправить. А то, ей-богу, надоело мне застревать в реке...
[/list]

[b][h1]ИТОГО[/h1][/b]
У игры огромный потенциал: в конце концов, ничего столь же амбициозно-достоверного еще никто не делал, а учитывая обещания разработчиков ввести кастомизацию, новые виды ящеров и даже постапокалиптическое выживание после падения знаменитого Чиксулубского метеорита — это будет знатное приключение! Остается надеяться, что денег и желания хватит, а обещания не останутся обещаниями... уж постарайтесь, «Urvogel Games»!

[b][h1]Общая оценка: ХОРОШО[/h1][/b]

[i]ОБНОВЛЕНИЕ: появилась возможность игры за трицератопса. Честно говоря, несмотря на заявленные фишечки типа стадного поведения и охраны гнезда, сам геймплей выглядит более скучным, чем в случае дакотараптора: передвигается новая туша медленно, прыгать не умеет, по врагам рогатой мордой попадает не всегда. В общем, на любителя...[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198123482160', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1542868703}
review:
There isn't anything I can say about this game without parroting every other person's negative review of this game. It's poorly optimized, empty, and endlessly boring. The game was fully funded years ago and has seen little progress at all since then. Every DevLog talking about future content all ramble on about what new flora they've been working on, or the triceratops AI that still has yet to be fully realized. The developers have made a game that's scientifically accurate first, and fun second, and I've long since given up hope that the game will ever be finished. Don't bother buying it. They got well over what they needed for it and still came up short.

At least the artbook is good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054073047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2353, 'last_played': 1654916526}

author: {'steamid': '76561198053129453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1942, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1361, 'last_played': 1685272472}
review:
在拟真方面 Saurian 已经超越了目前所有已知的涉及恐龙的游戏，游戏中大到霸王龙、三角龙、鸭嘴龙等大型恐龙，小到一草一木，水中的鱼和灌木丛中的蜥蜴，都是基于六千六百万年前北美达科他地区真实存在过的动植物化石和最新的古生物学研究还原的。如果你对恐龙和它们生存的世界感兴趣，Saurian 可以让你看到一个几近真实的史前世界。
    这个推荐只适用于上面这种情况。
    除了拟真，Saurian 在其他方面就没有什么值得一提的了，它甚至不是特别有趣，虽然游戏计划推出6种可用的恐龙，但目前你所扮演的只有达科他盗龙，每天的任务就是吃、喝、狩猎比你小的动物，躲避比你大的动物。如果你不是古生物的狂热爱好者，Saurian 能让你体会到的只有野生动物的生活有多么无聊。而以开发组目前的人力和更新速度，玩到最初承诺剩余5种恐龙仍然是遥遥无期的事情。

author: {'steamid': '76561198293999459', 'num_games_owned': 106, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 5506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2691, 'last_played': 1681797508}
review:
This game definitely has a lot of potential. The models, the animations, the environment, and the amount of research done for this game make it very accurate to how we know dinosaurs today, and I really like that about this game. The only issue is that it's WAY too early in its development. Only one dinosaur is playable, the dakotaraptor, there is no aim in the game (other than eat, drink, sleep, repeat) and there are a fair amount of immersion-breaking bugs that you're guaranteed to run into every single time you play. I don't hate this game, but I think it was released way too early, and the updates aren't frequent enough or significant enough to justify that. I'd only recommend buying this at its current state if you're really, really curious about it. Otherwise, wait a couple years until more progress has been made on it.
EDIT: A couple more things I forgot to mention; while updates on the progress the devs are making is very frequent, the actual updates made to the game are NOT. This game has barely changed, gameplay wise, in over three years of early access. The game is also somewhat poorly optimized, to the point where my gaming PC can't run it any higher than around 20 FPS.

author: {'steamid': '76561198185528765', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 969, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1656901467}
review:
__Februrary 12, 2021__

TLDR: This is not a game, it is a scientific realism Cretaceous era basic needs survival/walking simulator. Which is perfectly fine for what it is, but it is not a continual playability source of entertainment.



This game still isn't abandoned, but phew is progress slow. I get small 2-3 person team with other life obligations, but by the time the game is in a solid state people who cared about the game are 5 years older with different lives themselves.

The game is crazy scientifically accurate and it does offer some hours of entertainment, but boy is it boring after those few hours. There's just.. nothing to really do. Perhaps this is what it is like to be a family pet. Eat, sleep, do circles in the back yard. Maybe have fun catching a bird now and then. At least the family pet has some different toys.

It's fine for what it is, but this isn't a 'game'. Not as an insult to the title, but in a very realistic assessment: this is a scientific dinosaur era walking and basic needs simulator. Support the science if you are into that, get a couple hours of checking it out. But don't buy it in its current state for gameplay like ark or isle.

__November 5, 2019__

It isn't abandoned, people are just being dramatic.

The devs have weekly / bi-weekly dev logs where they show the community images and video clips of development with explanations on exactly what they are working on. YES it is slow development. And yes it is understandable why people are upset on the pace when they invested in a product and are yet to see much return.

Personally, it isn't really a big deal. I'm just sitting on it, waiting for fruitation. The devs are obviously showing exactly what they are working on and there is progress. As long as that's there it will eventually come together. If the dev log didn't exist I'd probably have a different feeling on it.

As far as the game itself, it is a POINT of the game to reach scientific accuracy, as much as they can for a game. Down to the types of plants, what they looked like, and what each herbivore actually ate in life. They are reading actual published papers on relevant content for the game. There isn't a whole lot to do past a day or two of gameplay. You survive to adult, run around, eat, sleep, drink, explore. It's as much as you would expect living and surviving as a creature 70 million years ago, obviously simplified without current deeper social behaviors.

If a couple hours of running around just dinking about isn't good enough for you, then hold off. If you want to support the devs trying to create something accurate, to a point of going to actual paleontology conferences, then get a couple hours of gameplay, and sit on it till it hopefully hatches.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018960465', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1572796070}
review:
Go on. Nothing to see here.

Ok - so you are still here? Then take a seat, get a cookie and a tea and listen.

I've bought the game when it released it's first early access version. Since then, there are many blog entries and updates, but nothing has changed. Literally nothing. Those minor variable adjustments, don't even consider to read the changelog until you got free time of your life you seriously want to waste.

I've followed the development a long time and there was not even such a thing like a milestone. That said, an early access game which isn't even able to deliever more than 1 out of 5 playable dinosaurs is a dead project. Imagine, maybe in another 9 years we would have 3/5 playable dinosaurs. Lel.

The devs hide in excuses and promises. A macOS version was promised and hold back and back and even after this long time it never happened.

I tried this game on 3 different setups and was never really able to see an enjoyable time since the game lags as would it compute bitcoins in the background. Even on the lowest settings it's unplayable while I can play any other indie game maxed out.

Give up your hopes.

Rest In Peace, Saurian.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105321198', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1688889631}
review:
2019, gtx 1660, still not playable even on low settings.
another disappointed kickstarter founder. 

edit:
i decided to try saurian again in 2021. though now i can play the game with high settings on the same pc i tried to and failed in 2019 with lowest settings, i can also see why. landscape is raw, depressing, poor, something went really wrong with lighting, clouds and trees.

• it worked, which is a good start
• all content in game is more or less science accurate
• encyclopedia is a nice touch
• dino models are great

• animations are stubborn and not smooth at all
• AI are horrible
• environment graphics
• lack of interactions with surroundings 

as a dinosaur freak i will finish growing both species available in gameplay to adulthood. and i will, probably, never return to this game in future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002207580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 452, 'last_played': 1654425823}
review:
Ok. Since the last reviews are very negative I am going to give some positive points.

The game is in Early Access and in development, it will get better.

Development is slow but it is constant, the devs have NEVER missed one of their bi-weekly devblogs. You can hit their discord and you will get to interact with the devs within minutes, all your questions answered. Not a lot of development teams do that.

Right now there is only one playable dinosaur so gameplay gets repetitive fast, but there are still 5 more playable dinos to come, wich much much more interesting gameplays (for example, Triceratops is going to have lots of social interactions so you can go from lone wolf to leader of the pack). That's when the game will hit its full potential.

I would understand the negative reviews if development stopped, but this is not the case. Most of the reviews here are just complaining about the slow pace of development.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106332512', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1130, 'last_played': 1603122392}
review: While not a bad game in itself and can even be quite fun, Saurian is mired by a unusually slow development process and a lack of content that quickly makes it boring after a few hours, even compared to other early-access games. It's tagline of " The Worlds Most Accurate Dinosaur Simulator" is also misleading, as Saurian has several features that are scientifically debatable or even completely inaccurate, such as calling Edmontosaurus annectens by it's outdated classification of "Anatosaurus" (and making a passive aggressive blog post with a poorly done argument when this was pointed out). At it's current stage of development and pricing, i would not recommend this unless its on sale for dirt cheap.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045179153', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 851, 'last_played': 1601087499}

author: {'steamid': '76561198138843445', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2047, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1047, 'last_played': 1686487369}
review: 첫공룡이다코다렉터인데레벨업하다14에서더이상레벨업이안되고,공룡4개중에2개는잡을수있는데나머지2개는아직못잡는게완전병맛게임임.업데이트가언제쯤될런지.완전업데이트되면재미있겠지만.아직은......

author: {'steamid': '76561198128903146', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2503, 'last_played': 1698013111}
review: There is no conceivable way that I can any longer defend this game, let alone recommend it to someone else. Three years of development have gone bye and.....what EXACTLY has changed? Sure, there are a few new AI creatures wandering around, sure the T-rex has been completely remodeled (again). But, at the end of the day, what has fundamentally shifted gameplay in any new direction with Saurian? Are there dynamic weather systems and environmental threats? Are there new creatures to play as and explore a hostile world? Can you join your friends in multiplayer and flee from predators or hunt prey together? Nope. Nothing. Development on Saurian has stagnated severely. Each patch note for this game talks more about remodels and fucking fish animations than changes in gameplay or the PAINFULLY needed optimization. The poor frame-quality and awful lag is enough to turn people off from the game alone. The devs for this game are BURNING their money. They are so concerned with being "realistic" that they cannot hit a point in development where they can actually appeal to more people and progress. WHY didn't they just work out the kinks in "realism" AFTER they released a product that was at least PLAYABLE by a majority of people? I don't understand their reasoning. I'm aware this is suppose to be a "simulation" but come on, why does it take three years to fail to deliver on aspects of the game promised on the kickstarter? No dynamic weather systems (Apart from that stupid, lazy optical effect they call "rain")? No new playable creatures? No multiplayer? No optimization or better texturing? No rework of the down-right awful combat system? No smarter AI? It's just a mess. I'm done following this game. Most people have already abandoned ship. The dev team has succeeded in remaining "realistic" for their project, but unfortunately most people value gameplay in a GAME over how accurate the contents of said game are to their source. I would have loved a realistic Dinosaur simulation, but unfortunately the devs are so engrossed with their champion of Saurian as "unlike anything else" and "completely realistic" that they have failed to make a product that most consumers would actually enjoy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038488367', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1570811308}
review:
I have played a couple of hours of Saurian, here are my thoughts:

- Of all the dinosaur games, this one being a single player simulation of scientifically accurate dinosaurs interests me the most.
- The feathered dinosaurs are a thought provoking alternative to the more traditional reptilian beasts.
- Day / night cycle is nice, with a seemingly accurate night sky.
- Some of the dinosaur / animal behaviour is quite lifelike, but at times the AI is hopelessly dumb.
- The vegetation and animals have a slightly plastic appearance, a problem with the Unity engine I think.
- Attack system is lacklustre.

All in all, I'd like to spend more time with it...but my two hour window was up and I decided to refund. I'll keep an eye on it and see whether there is significant improvement. Would I recommend it? No...not yet.

This game is in its alpha stages. Its goal is uniquely admirable among other games of its kind: to show the most scientifically accurate simulation of the Hell Creek Formation in the Late Cretaceous period. I admit, that I would like to have seen them make much more progress as of now, but the developers are clearly doing everything to the best of their ability and works of this nature and feat cannot and should not be rushed. 
Personal score: 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198086876593', 'num_games_owned': 305, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1615583755}
review:
EDIT: see below for additions which I’ll continue to make.

All right, it's taken me a long time to compile my thoughts and feelings, and I may edit this in the future. But here we go.
I began tracking Saurian early, when development was first announced. I pre-ordered the game, funded the original kickstarter, all of that. Needless to say I was extremely excited for this when it was announced and first came out. I love simulation games, I especially love realistic animal simulation games. I love dinosaurs, so this was practically made for me. 

When it first released, it was troubling, but of course it was new, it wouldn't be perfect, the lag even on my girlfriend's three thousand dollar gaming rig could simply be chalked up to the game being new and having kinks to iron out but even after all this time, very little has changed. The devs refuse to acknowledge the fact that something about their game causes massive memory leakage and/or other forms of lag that leave the game unpleasantly jittery or slow even on extremely high end gaming rigs, even at low settings. 

The controls are a little bit uncomfortable and the in-game tutorials leave a lot to be desired. You're liable to be killed in a single hit even by miniscule creatures while your own damage will likely simply whiff off of things without breaking their stride, I'm not saying it should be easy, it's supposed to be realistic, but there's very little realism in being completely unable to land a hit on another raptor while brushing past it leaves you dead, or falling dead instantly when you jump over what should be a small enemy. This leaves hunting an unfun and buggy mess as you're much more likely to end up dead on the ground when you brush against another creature rather than having any sort of success. Eating small lizards and birds is the only truly viable option for survival even as an adult Dakotaraptor, which is unfortunate as catching even these small prey items is incredibly tedious and unfun, I love hunting in games, but this one leaves a lot to be desired, you'll miss more often than not even when your prey is bonking into your head or claws.

This might be fixed if the above lag issue weren't present, but I can't be sure either way.

Work on this game is slow, meaningful updates are few and far between as the devs seem more intent on making this game into a vanity project to fuel their own superiority regarding having The Most Realistic Dinosaur Game, they've spent more time re-making the T-rex model from scratch, for instance, than they have addressing player gameplay concerns, and so despite being out for over two years now, the game is still as much a lagging, memory hogging, unfun mess as it was upon initial release. They continue to pour time and effort into non-player creatures, while all these years later, Dakotaraptor remains the only playable creature, likely due to a lack of dev focus and the fact that they swiftly scrap all previous work the moment any part of it seems to be 'realistic', this is an issue because science continuously moves forward far faster than progress can be made on the game, which means that they run on a treadmill of incompletion in regards to Saurian.

In short, Saurian had a lot of potential, but this potential is wasted by the fact that the Dev team refuses to acknowledge issues with playability, focuses too hard on things outside the scope of gameplay, allow their need to be the best and most realistic to constantly set back their progress on game completion, and a general seeming lack of care that their playerbase is slowly becoming more and more let down and annoyed by all of this and more.

Proceed at your own risk, I cannot currently recommend buying or otherwise supporting this game until the dev team proves they can be trusted to actually make an enjoyable, playable experience, even if it comes, yes, at the cost of some of their realism. Which thus far, they have not.

Please note that my low playtime is deceptive, I usually play using my girlfriend's copy, since her steam is the one currently on the gaming desktop.

EDIT:  So here we are in 2021. I’m coming back to edit my review because I think that’s fair. The short version is that the game is still not worth the price tag, but I’ll go into more detail below.

Despite what some replies to my initial review may say or imply, the game is still at its core, boring. I won’t dance around that, once you’ve reached adulthood there is simply nothing else to motivate you to continue in many ways aside from exploration, which is fair, the game looks nice enough, not groundbreaking, but nice enough.

There are still issues with running the game, I got myself a PC built specifically to more than run Monster Hunter World at full everything at absolute maximum frames which it does beautifully. Saurian still has moments of jitter or lag and I can’t turn the render distance of the foliage past half without it starting to have...Issues. Again, my PC is newly built specifically to run demanding games at good performance and Saurian’s poor optimization still presents problems at times.

Hunting as a baby dakotaraptor is still a pain, the lizard hitboxes are less than great and you’ll find sometimes that small prey simply despawns without warning.

AI leaves a lot to be desired, I’ve watched whole flocks of Ornithomimus die because they stood in the water screaming aimlessly at a small gator, which admittedly was extremely funny but also clearly not as realistic as the devs likely intend. 

Young triceratops can randomly become hostile to roaming herds of anatosaurus, it may also happen with adult trikes from what I’ve heard but my experience was with other juveniles. This resulted in one herdmate dying and the other glitching in such a way that she forever held her head at the charging angle and refused to drink.

To date I have played both playable dinosaurs to adulthood because I want to give the game a fair shake, and I did pay for it, so I may as well keep my review up to date.

Triceratops gameplay is boring, the only predator that will ever pose a threat to you are T rex and you’ll see them long before it becomes an issue. Playing as a male allows you to control the direction of your herd, but for some reason the devs seem to have coded it so there’s no way to tell your heard to simply stop and stay in an area—and leader or not they will simply keep walking into the wilds until it disconnects you from the herd. This means that doing things like drinking and grazing will require you to either run ahead and do so as they walk, or constantly be changing their direction as you do so to make them walk in circles near you, it’s annoying.

also quite frankly it’s unnecessary and a strange way to code the herding behavior, tethering your herd to you—assuming you are the lead male—would make the herd behavior feel more authentic and would require less player neurosis.

At this point in the game you may as well not play as a female trike, while males at least can take and defend herds, female trike gameplay currently consists of following your herd while their AI does its best to exist. Courtship and nesting isn’t implemented as of this edit so that’s not applicable. 

I will say that battling another male as a male trike is somewhat fun, it feels heavy and realistic, I definitely enjoyed it for the moment it lasted. 

Raptor hunting as a non hatchling is better now, the prey restraint has been updated and feels less like you’re controlling your raptor with hands full of butter but unfortunately the raptor movement—especially the turns—feel like attempting to swerve the titanic around an iceberg, the raptor is not fast enough to justify the bad turns being accounted for by sheer need to slow down, even from a walk, the raptor turn is wider by leagues than the bulky triceratops, and that feels bad.

I’ve run out of room so see more of my review in the comments!

author: {'steamid': '76561198277493119', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1701381938}
review: I would overall recommend trying this game, it's beautiful, there's a nice variety of dinosaurs to look at and the landscape is wonderful to discover. I have 2 main issues however, there are performance issues, namely lag, even at low settings, and my pc should run this game no problem.  My 2nd issue is with the lack of content, I find the 19 $ pricetag to be too high for the content the game has right now. I wouldn't have put this in early acces at this stage. There is only 1 playable dinosaur at the time of writing this review, and the game has been on early acces since 2017. I didn't ask for a refund only becasue i hope that my money will serve to complete this game, wich would be wonderful as the concept is great and the current  playable sections are good fun. My only problem is that I want more of this game, wich I hope does come across as positive. I hope the game will imrove in the future as I think there is huge potential in it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066476391', 'num_games_owned': 262, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2129, 'last_played': 1566663060}
review:
[h1]EA Review 09.09.19[/h1]

Right now the game let you play as a Dakotaraptor (T-Rex, Pachycephalosaurus, Anzu, Ankylosaurus and Triceratops will be ingame [u]in distant future[/u]).
You start as a little chick and have to survive on your own because Dakotaraptor-Parents are really bad parents. Also: Their intelligence wasn't high enough to realise that they shouldn't attack a Pachy, or a crocodile, from the front.
Not so clever girl (and/or guy) I would say.
No wonder they went extinct.
Nevermind.
You play as Dakotaraptor.
You hunt (gameplay wise it's... well... one gets used to it), you eat, you drink, you sleep. But: You can be much more clever than your parents! But you can't be a parent on your own right now (will be ingame [u]in distant future[/u]).

And that's it.
Right now I can't recommend this game.
I know it's a niche game. I know it's a dinosaur simulator. And I know it's in early access. I backed this game back in 2016 (I guess it was 2016) and now... well. Here we are: You can play as a Dakotaraptor.
Nothing has changed contentwise since the release of the early access version back in August 2017.
It's been over two years, but it feels like 65Million years, and I am at a point were I'm scared to become a fossil myself before the game gets its first major content update.
(to be fair: The devs are publishing a dev log every other week so we can at least see what content may be ingame [u]in distant future[/u].)

[u][b](this salty review may change into a constructive one in distant future)[/b][/u]

author: {'steamid': '76561198078904495', 'num_games_owned': 285, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1614880248}
review:
I heard about what this game's ambitions were before I even bought it. It was supposed to be a game that had a focus on creating a scientifically accurate portrayal of the life of a dinosaur. I loved the Idea, and I hoped for a good game before playing it, but I have several complaints. First off, the controls are abominable. I've played a fair amount of PC games, and nothing has ever made my hands cramp more than playing this. The controls feel incredibly awkward, and this is only one of the reasons this game feels unplayable. There are so many more issues when it comes to difficulty and gameplay. To be completely honest, I'm not the best when it comes to playing games, but I at least know what a progressive game feels like. The mechanics of the gameplay are incredibly difficult to maneuver, and I often find myself extremely frustrated just trying to get past the first stage. When it comes the graphics, I'm a tad bit disappointed. I own an ASUS at home, and while it's not the most powerful computer, it has some pretty decent graphical capabilities. As I said before, I've seen the game in it's development, and there were some pretty major differences between the official release, and how it looked before. Since your most probably reading this review on the store page, I'll tell that the pictures you see on there are just the same as what I had seen many years ago. This is by no means how the game looks now. The graphics in the official release are much poorer. In the end, I don't hate this game for what it stood for, but I was hoping for so much more, and I'm utterly disappointed.

Update: May 4, 2021
I tried playing the game again, because I wanted to see if there was anything I missed out on, and I couldn't. The game doesn't even run properly and I can't even start a new save. This game is unplayable, and the fact that to it hadn't even gotten past the pre-alpha stage is infuriating. When I first heard of this game, it was in the latter years of my late dinosaur phase. I used to be obsessed with paleontology and I had expected this game to be the ultimate prehistoric experience. After this game, my love for the scientific intricacies of the lives of dinosaurs had slowly dwindled off, as there was little more to sustain that interest afterward. There will always be a place in my heart for these wonderful creatures, and I hope they make a comeback. I personally think that the feathered T-Rex has so much more potential for fear and thrill than everyone else says it does. Until then, I'm left with a void of unfulfilled dreams. I'll be waiting, though. I still have hope yet that these glorious animals will make a powerful and memorable comeback.

author: {'steamid': '76561198299255102', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1804, 'last_played': 1700197476}
review: Before you buy Saurian, you should know about this: This game is a Hell Creek real-life animal simulator rather than a intense or stimulating dinosaur survival game. If you want something very exciting, I don't recommend this game. But If you're interested in paleontology or you want to explore the Hell Creek Formation 66 millions ago with one of it's fauna, I recommend this game. You can be a protagonist of a dinosaur documentary! It's still being developed so the volume of the game may be not as big as you think. But I look for Saurian will be amazing dinosaur simulator when it's completed!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993971751', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 559, 'last_played': 1552676057}
review:
Just to give out a PSA, the devs don't work on the game full-time, they actually have jobs and just develop the game as a hobby on their freetime.

Despite that fact, they took hundreds of thousands of dollars worth of kickstarter money.

It's been 3 years since the game was released, and literally nothing meaningful has been added to the game in that time. The devs of course post constant devlogs to try to convince you they are actively doing things, but mysteriously nothing ever comes out of it into the player's hands.

This project is pretty much Star Citizen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996718510', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1031, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 396, 'last_played': 1687143360}
review:
This game is fantastic.
I know, from a traditional gamer's point of view, it may be incomplete... for anyone expecting a big world and lots of things to do like on games such as Skyrim, forget it, this is not why you are paying for it YET, while it's early access. Expect it will have a lot more features once complete. But I already expected it would be like this on early access and I don't care.

But the real reason I bought this game is because it is what I always wanted. To see our world as close as it can get to what it was 65 million years ago. To live the world as a dinosaur, and I must say, this game is trully a piece of art. If any of you like science and like dinosaurs, don't mind any of the negative reviews, buy this game. It really deserves to be bought for what it is.
This game is one of the main reasons I want to upgrade my video card.

Also, the game is kinda heavy on a low end machine, but I have an RX550, Pentium G4560 and 8gb RAM, and the game is playable on low to minimum with a little lag and it's still worth to play.

And also, I would like to congratulate the team for the iniciative. People need science, now more than ever. This is not just a game, it's knowledge being spread. I trully apreciate what you done, and thank you for providing me the oportunity to live the Cretaceous. I look foward to the updates, and will buy anything else you publish.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132731795', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1563066543}
review: I was one of the Kickstarter backers and just let it sit, waiting for it to be finished.  I must say.... it was due out in testing in January of 2017.  It is July of 2019. :(  Over two years and it's still in Alpha.  That does not bode well.  The gameplay is ok, but even casual is overly challenging when you're trying to find food.  Overall... it's frustrating and unfinished.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140306441', 'num_games_owned': 586, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2240, 'last_played': 1655741291}
review:
Saurian - gra, którą poznałem przypadkowo i która od razu mnie zachwyciła (a grałem w nią od bardzo wczesnych faz produkcji, gdy jeszcze dinozaurów było mało, a na mapie pełno bugów). Widzę ostatnimi czasy jak ludzie narzekają, że tytuł za bardzo się ociąga z dodawaniem większych zmian, z wypuszczaniem nowych, grywalnych gatunków, ale osobiście cieszę się, że twórcy wolą pracować powoli i dokładnie, dzięki temu świat tej gry jest piękny i coraz mocniej dopracowany.
Niezwykle mi imponuje to, jak ludzie odpowiedzialni za ten tytuł pasjonują się tematyką prehistorycznych gadów (i nie tylko), to po prostu cudne, jak za grę bierze się ktoś, kto ma w sobie miłość do swojego dzieła, a nie tylko chęć zysku. Te uczucia są zresztą widoczne już od pierwszych sekund przygody z Saurianem - wyróżniają się w nim niezwykle dokładne projekty występujących w świecie stworzeń, każdy z nich wzorowany był na prawdziwych skamielinach i spekulacjach naukowców, a nie tylko wyobraźni i chęci "przekozaczenia", żeby te wymarłe bestie wyglądały fajniej. Tak samo jak zwierzęta, również roślinność i poszczególne biomy zrobione zostały z dbałością o szczegóły, co szczególnie widać w dostępnej w grze encyklopedii, gdzie zaserwowano nam krótkie, ale treściwe opisy fauny i flory, a to kolejna rzecz wzbudzająca mój szacunek - coś takiego powinno być w każdej grze tego typu!
Rozpisałem się jednak o warstwie wizualnej, a co z resztą? Mimo tego, że Saurian wciąż pozostaje w early accesie, może się pochwalić wieloma różnymi mechanikami i mocno wciągającym gameplayem, generalnie nie mamy tutaj widocznej fabuły, bo sami musimy stworzyć swoją historię. Po nazwaniu i wybraniu płci swojego dinozaura, zaczynamy rozgrywkę jako świeżo wyklute pisklę. Od tego czasu naszym zadaniem jest biegać po całym dostępnym obszarze i dbać by nasza postać była najedzona, napojona, zdrowa i trzymająca się z dala od zagrożeń. Brzmi jak jeden z wielu survivali, tyle że w wersji z raptorami, co? A jednak jest coś takiego w tym tytule, co każe zapamiętać grę na dłużej. To nie jest prosty świat, tu naprawdę można wejść w skórę swojego podopiecznego i pozwolić wyobraźni na sklejenie epickich historii. Zachwyca i urealnia rozgrywkę masa szczegółów i świetnie zrealizowanych pomysłów, jak choćby możliwość wspinania się na drzewa w młodym wieku, to, jak inne dinozaury reagują na nas w zależności od naszego stopnia rozwoju, przymus wypracowania własnych technik polowania (lub wykorzystywania w tym celu innych), czy chociażby radość ze zwiedzania zróżnicowanej pod względem ukształtowania terenu i biomów, mapy.
Podsumowując: Saurian to gra od pasjonatów dla pasjonatów, bo szczególny zachwyt z tego tytułu będą mieli właśnie ci z fazą na dinozaury, ale i przeciętny gracz odnajdzie w tym tytule sporo uroku. Polecam każdemu, kogo nie odstraszają zwierzęce survivale i kto chciałby przeżyć niezapomnianą przygodę!

author: {'steamid': '76561198154455369', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1648583425}
review: When they announced the releasement of this game, I was excited to see what they could do and oh was I impressed. Although I've only been able to play one dinosaur so far, I have enjoyed it! You age up over time and sleeping will not accelerate your growth, so that trick is out the window! Which means you have to play through the cycles, avoiding any possible threat. Currently you may get a few funny bugs or AI being dopey, but just ditch your parents and be a lone survivor! That's where the fun is at! If you're unsure still, just take a look at their dev blogs and videos, it's only going to get better! <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198073974485', 'num_games_owned': 42, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1561759535}
review:
I've been following this game for a while, mostly because I saw how accurate and up-to-date the art style was going to be. While it is clear this game is still undergoing work, it has been enjoyable to play and I'm going to keep going and exploring further from where I am now.
Things I Enjoy:
- variety of dinosaurs and other creatures I have seen. While I know there are only four dinosaurs that will be playable, the fact that the environment is still so alive with all the other creatures that lived in Hell Creek makes the game feel more alive. I've also noticed the AI is a lot better than the early comments made it out to seem, so that is clear progress the devs have made.
- the sense of smell as an added trait helps make hunting and staying safe easier. It still does feel a little buggy, like the distance at which I can smell something isn't always consistent, but the more I've used the feature the more I've come to enjoy it.
- the '1st person camera' - being able to investigate things up close with this camera has been a nice touch, especially because I've also been able to see the close up of my Dakotaraptor's face as it ages.

Things I Don't Enjoy: 
- it was a little hard for me to control the Dakotaraptor with precision, but I have gotten more used to these controls as the game has gone on. It does feel to me like the jump feature is a little random on how it decides distance. 
- another control issue I had: when using RMB to flap my wings and hold onto struggling prey, my camera view would sometimes shift into '1st POV' and disrupt the action. I don't know if this is a bug or my computer, but I figured it would be worth mentioning.
- the fact that a failed predation attempt leads to death is a bit upsetting. I'm playing in Casual, so it doesn't bother me too much, but being so severely punished for misjudging the strength of prey is a bit intense. I know this is a survival game and trying to be as realistic as possible, but when confronted with a prey that didn't seem to fight back, only run away, I found it strange that I died as a result of not killing it quickly enough. I don't know if this is something that will change or I'll better understand the more I play, but it felt big enough to me to point out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198313413190', 'num_games_owned': 131, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 442, 'last_played': 1523099796}
review:
Das Spiel ist sehr schön gemacht und das Konzept ist sehr gut. Was in Zukunft geplant ist hört sich sehr vielversprechend an. Dennoch seit fast 2 Jahren gibt es nur ein spielbaren Dino. Seit 2 Jahren hoffe ich wenn ein neues Update da ist, dass es ein neuen spielbaren Dino gibt.

Ich denke wenn das Spiel fertig ist wird es ein Hit. Darum drotzt mangel an spielbaren Dinos Daumen hoch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028137565', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1678731203}
review: There's still a lot of work to do in Saurian while I'm writing this. Trust me, devs are still working on it whenever they have time. More people are working on this game than at the beginning and devlogs come out once in 14 days. If you find the game interesting I suggest following it. This is a long project and I believe that eventually Saurian will be a fantastic dinosaur simulator. I try to play Saurian whenever a new patch comes out. There is plenty of potential in Saurian but you just gotta be patient.

author: {'steamid': '76561198365941516', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 317, 'last_played': 1670563174}
review:
A tremendous effort.
While I play this crippled as a VM on a Macbook Pro, I realize the amount of sweat and love for this sim.  Near and dear to my heart as an amateur paleontology geek, this hits the mark in oh so many ways.  While it would appear to need a fairly well endowed machine to run, it just might be worth it to some to see this in it's full glory.  

Like I said, I'm a Mac user.  Nothing would make me happier than to see this run native.  Please.  

Keep up this amazing effort while you refine and enhance what is simple an amazing possibility.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005339585', 'num_games_owned': 1234, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 1125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 884, 'last_played': 1664702691}
review:
This is a simulation game, based on realism.

Saurian let's you play (during Early Access) with one dinosaur. The game plays on a as realistic simulation as possible. So no arcade, killstreak of big flashy ui messages. It let's you cool down and try to let you live as a dinosaur, with every struggle and tediousness that brings, which for the game works, if you are willing to sit down and focus. 

I do admit updates are slow, but keep in mind this is a small team and with every step they take there needs to be a balance between as real as possible and fun gameplay balanced in.

So far I am really enjoying the game. It lets you experience how it was tens of milions of years ago.

TLDR: if you like dinosaurs and if you want to have an adult simulation pick it up!

I definitely love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198151381763', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1535823758}
review: This game is severely dead. It hasn't been updated in over a year? And it's almost impossible to find things to eat when you hit the awkward stage between juvi and adult because you can only eat the poisoned lizards really well. But then you die of poison not far after. It gets laggy in some parts in the game when you load new areas and some things don't load at all. So you can sit running into a tree fro 3 minutes before it shows up while trying to escape adult raptors. I really wouldn't buy it until it comes out fully or gets an update.

author: {'steamid': '76561198346118883', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1560255682}
review:
Someone else wrote that Saurian made them forget about "The Isle", but i can NOT understand this. This game has potential, and if you already own The Isle, and want something different, then i could probably recommend it... But if you just look for a fun dinosaur game, then as it is now, The Isle costs exactly as much as Saurian, and is MUCH better... Still think Saurian is worth the money it costs right now though, as it will provide hours of entertainment...

The best thing about Saurian, is perhaps the graphix on the sky and the lighting - like when the sun-light shines through the trees. It looks really good!!! The actual landscape have too bright colors or something, IMO, so it does not look natural (almost like they reflect more of the sunlight than what you see in real life). But as this is early access, i guess they may improve some things later on. I also like that this game is offline... Another thing - that i actually think this game got better than The Isle - is that the hunger decreases sufficiently rapidly so that you dont end up sitting still too much, waiting to get hungry so you need to hunt (unless you take down large prey, which can last all day)... On The Isle, a lot of the game is just about walking around, waiting to get hungry enough to hunt and eat. Or worse - laying in the grass, just chatting with people. I do like that chat, but i dont want to lay in the grass and chat the majority of the time i play the game, because i dont have anything better to do..! For this reason, i mainly like playing as the Rex on The Isle (it gets hungry quickly, and needs to hunt a lot)...

author: {'steamid': '76561198058876807', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 564, 'last_played': 1622603565}
review:
It's been 2 years since this game was released on steam in early access. A lot has been worked on, a lot has been added and while we probably don't even know how much more work they are putting in behind the curtain I am not enjoying it.

I played raptor enough now, I know the map now, there is no multiplayer still which means you are stuck in this constant cycle of running aimlessly around without any objectives or things to find. I sadly was not a kickstater backer but I've been following the development since the very start. The graphics are lovley, the models are top notch, the sound and animations are wonderful, and yet the gameplay fun is missing. To me the most important thing.

People will always compare and right now I rather play The Isle until this game gets more patches out. They are still working on their list and multiplayer will come at some point, but until then it is basically a dead end. I played it long enough imo and while I understand that a game needs time to be done I kind of wish they would have waited a bit longer with the official early access to avoid votes like mine.

Right now I cannnot recommend this game. I would love too enjoy it but the way it is right now is just boring.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970416597', 'num_games_owned': 1379, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 857, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 825, 'last_played': 1703673260}
review:
Saurian ist mehr Simulation als Spiel. 

Simuliert werden die Tiere und Pflanzen der Kreidezeit in Montana, USA, vor ca. 66 Millionen Jahren. Momentan kann man nur eine Saurierart steuern: Den Dakotaraptor. Man schlüpft aus dem Ei und muss überleben. Dabei durchlebt man mehrere Entwicklungsstadien bis man erwachsen ist. In erster Linie muss man Beute erlegen und aufpassen, dass man selbst nicht gejagt und getötet wird.

Das Spiel sieht mittlerweile ganz ansehnlich aus. Jedenfalls wesentlich besser als in dem hier verlinkten Video (05.04.2019). Die Pflanzen und Tiere sind schön modelliert und die Animationen der Tiere sind flüssig. Die Soundeffekte sind noch relativ spärlich. Bei mir läuft das Spiel flüssig und ruckelfrei mit maximalen Grafikeinstellungen.

Hier wird der Schwerpunkt auf wissenschaftlich korrekte Daten gelegt. Die Pflanzen und Tiere wurden in der "Hell-Creek-Formation"in Montana entdeckt. Man versucht mit diesem Programm also eine realistische Umgebung zu simulieren. Eine Vermischung von Dinosauriern aus verschiedenen Erdzeitaltern und Orten findet hier nicht statt. Mittlerweile sind relativ viele Tiere integriert (Triceratops, Tyrannosaurus, Anatosaurus, Pachycephalosaurus, zwei Ankylosaurierarten, zwei Krokodilarten, kleine Echsen und Säugetiere und noch einige andere Saurierarten, sowie zwei Flugsaurier und einige Fische).

Außer dem Dakotaraptor sollen nach und nach noch drei weitere Dinosaurier freigeschaltet werden, die man dann selbst "spielen" kann: Der Tyrannosaurus rex, der Triceratops und der Pachycephalosaurus.

Wer sich für ein "Spiel" interessiert, welches ein geschlossenes Ökosystem simuliert, dass wissenschaftlich verhältnismäßig korrekt dargestellt wird, kann hier mittlerweile bedenkenlos zugreifen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025427550', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 604, 'last_played': 1599625206}
review: Would recommend to keep an eye on this one. While still a quality game even at this stage of development, it's definitely not as feature-rich as other games of its type, with only one playable dinosaur so far (though Triceratops is to be introduced soon as of writing), and little to do once you reach the adult stage. There are also some QoL things it needs, e.g. better indicators for damage, seeing as the raptor prey restraint mechanic doesn't seem to be effective in damaging prey. But given the Saurian team's regular development updates and the frequency of patches so long after EA release, I feel it's safe to pick up this game either for later or to keep playing through the EA process.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036459369', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1553511831}
review:
I've been waiting on this game since it started it's kickstarter in 2016 and I'm just deeply disappointed that it's still not up to par with what they have been saying it is/going to be. It only allows you to play a raptor out of only 4 different species. It's just so clunky and basic.
If you want a multi-player dinosaur game you'll have better luck with The Isle even though that needs a lot of work as well, at least the graphics and species diversity is stronger.

review:

My biggest problem (besides those things) is that the game gets really boring at some point. The controls are really weird, at least to me, and the camera is just going crazy. 
I really wanted to love this game but I really regret buying it. I hope once the game is finished it will be more fun and not so glitchy anymore.

review: I love this game, though it feels like hunting as a dakotaraptor takes too long, its either we do shitty damage or we miss so much that it takes forever to kill anything! i feel as if it needs to be balanced, it looked like i should have killed a Thescelosaurus easily, but it took me more than 3 minutes while pouncing on it! Thescelosaurus looks like it just sorta be on the ground, instead of having the way larger adult dakotaraptor ontop of it biting over and over again while flapping its wings, though that might just be me there. and i always get killed while pouncing, on ornithomimid i feel like its either bitting me or its trample damage is hurting me.  and the crocs  are always one shotting me while im ontop of em. it also always takes forever to hunt Pachycephalosaurus and has been always running into the water and it seems a bit.. aggressive? that might be me though. I have nothing else to complain about, and i love this game though i feel like it needs balancing, like what i just said here ^^^

author: {'steamid': '76561198060609915', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 394, 'last_played': 1654806357}
review:
Since this game was the same price as "The Isle", I tihnk its fair that i make a comparison between the two so if you are ever stuck buying one of them I can help.

The difference between the two is Saurian is an Off-Line Single player based game while "The Isle" is highly focused on Multi-Player

Graphics 
The Isle (9)       Saurian (4.5)

Its unfair to compare but everything on the Isle is better in terms of graphics.  The character models both look great in both games, but for everything else the Isle looks amazing while Saurian looks like a game from the early 2000s.  Even still The Isle's Character Models still blows Saurian's Out of the water

Game Play
The Isle (7)      Saurian (5.5)

This is where i find the Isle lacks but still beats this game.  In the isle, you are bored at times, but the islands are so huge that theres always new content to discover.  There is about 10 complete playable models in the isle compared to Saurians one single Raptor, but even then...both these games lack a games purpose after you finish growing besides survival.   The AI is absolutely crap in the Isle. Theres one raptor that attacks and 2 that broadcast the crap out of its area as a beacon and run when it sees you.
As for Saurian, its not much better.  The AI is very basic, either attack or run away based on your characters current model. Its better than the Isle but not by much.

I will add on to this once i play Saurian a bit more if requested.  But IMO The Isle is far superior and a better bang for your buck.

author: {'steamid': '76561198256040719', 'num_games_owned': 21, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 6821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2543, 'last_played': 1657292218}

this game is an early access one, so ill be patient on waiting new dinos and new updates, they are slowely updating it.
the graphics are good, but my pc might get laggy at some point so ill put low quality, still fine and can play it.
the hints are clear, and its easy to learn how to play this game.
