author: {'steamid': '76561198055422734', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1703897335}
review:
Was really looking forward to just playing the alpha build but it's basically unplayable.
Everything lagging and slow. My PC isn't too high end but it is a gaming pc with a decent graphics card.
The game also has no option to change the graphics to a lower setting.
Loaded game. Camera struggled to even respond to mouse. Signifiant delay between pressing key and any action happening. Honestly could even't make my dinosaur walk it was that bad. Spent entire 5 minutes messing around in menus for some option to allow me to actually play the game. No luck.
Waste of money. Would not recommened. Very dissapointing.
I'm hoping once it's out of alpha I'll actually be able to play and won't have just flushed money down the toliet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198161456270', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1524058608}
review:
Минусы:
- оптимизация явно не в почете у разработчика
- управление (особенно при RPR) напоминает худшие игры с закликиванием середины 2000-х
- лютый дисбаланс - все, что меньше пожирается без боя, все что больше - выносит с полтычка; злобный дакотараптор выдыхается не пробежав и десяти метров, слепой Т-Рекс и т.п.
- графические решения - уродливая вода уродлива, вид бурного течения в мутной луже рубит реализм на корню, Луна зеленого цвета?, окружающий лес напоминает все что угодно, только не первобытные джунгли (с диким миром theHunter:Primal пластиковые кусты Saurian рядом не стоят)
- бесцельность происходящего

Плюсы:
- можно управлять куриц... оперенным динозавром
- анимация животных вполне приличная, правдоподобные модели - динозавры действительно выглядят массивными, живыми и интересными
- охота временами затягивает
- настрой разработчика на долгую разработку (сейчас продукт еще очень сырой)
- местами неплохой визуальный ряд, хоть и без огрехов (застывшая трава и проч.)

Итого: необычная игра с хорошим потениалом, которая при должном старании разработчиков получит немало фанатов, их любви (и денег).

author: {'steamid': '76561198206218277', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1531712395}
review:
jogo muito legal, bem feito


pontos positivos

-um ambiente bonito e agradável, com um realismo bom
- um jogo bem realista no quesito sobrevivência onde do nada pode surgir um dinossauro e te matar, ainda mais quando tiver dormindo
-uma variedade de dinossauros

pontos negativos

- pouca variedade de dinossauros no Mapa, poderia ter os Saurópodes e demais classes incluindo algumas cobras e Crocodilos maiores
- um único mapa com um único tipo de clima que varia desde uma floresta a um pântano, poderia ter mais opções de mapa como um campo aberto, deserto e um pântano bem mais alagado
- mapa pequeno demais, poderia existir um mapa bem maior, com uma boa variedade de clima, flora e fauna dependendo da onde fica, por exemplo, nos campos ter umas especies de dinossauros, nas florestas ter outros tipos e no deserto ter outros tipos diferentes de dinossauros, podendo ate mesmo existir praias onde mostre Repteis Marinhos e que seja permitido o dinossauro nadar no mar, nem que seja apenas para ser comido depois servindo como um limitador do mapa para indicar que o jogador não pode passar dali


levem isso como uma iniciativa para melhorar um jogo já bom, não como uma critica negativa ate porque eu aprovo esse jogo porem poderia melhorar muito mais se fizesse algo bem mais imersivo

author: {'steamid': '76561198294638851', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 3973, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2075, 'last_played': 1708738577}
review:
I just want to say first that i love this game even in the early stage it is in. I read some other reviews and some people were saying that their should be a sale or something like that, because if anyone who plays this game and like me loves dinosaurs would  love this game. And if it sounds like I'm begging I'm not trying to so sorry if that is what it sounds like. I'm also super excited for the Denversaurus teaser picture thing or that you  propably know what I'm talking about. It is not Edmontosaurus, but is another dinosaur I was hoping would be in the game. Now to some of my issues (lag, glitches, stuff like that). I got the finishing blow on a borealosuchus but I did not get the crocodile hunter achievment. Also, i killed an Archeoraptor as a juvenile but did not get the achievment as well. Now the next thing I'm sorry to even mention this it might even be what is supposed to happen, but whenever it is about to turn night in the game  i always lag like crazy. Anyway one last time really great game and I'm very excited for future updates.

 I just updated this review with the new update, love it even more but the only issue is that I know eventually all the water will turn to salt water, but one time I spawned in and the water was already turned to salt water 2 minutes into the spawn/file which was really annoying, but that is my only issue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135290466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1561141136}
review:
I really like the concept of this game.. 
It is realistic to the core, and adds a nice and almost scientifically accurate touch to how the Hell Creek formation should have been. The AI has improved since the last update and it's quite fun interacting with the environment in as real a way as it could have possibly been some 65 MYA.
It would be great if the game could bring in a bit of customization in terms of changing the overtone of the dakotas' feathers and stuff.. A bit of algae mopped on to the base of trees and stuffs like that..
Kudos to the team!

author: {'steamid': '76561198132085928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 3565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1678305734}
review: This is a great game for people who know a lot about paleontology and loves to see recreated prehistoric environments that are up to date with the latest scientific evidence. Right now I've noticed a lot of lagging and that the NPC adults sometimes stop moving at random locations, so I would like it if the developers could fix that. Also, I would like it if your character's parents in the game would stay close to your character instead of walking away from your character until your character is old enough to go off on its own. Another thing that I would like to see in the game is some sort of sexual dimorphism for the adults because right now I cannot tell if they are male or if they are female. On a more positive note, I love the fact that the developers are as scientifically accurate as possible to what has been discovered by scientists in the Hellcreek geologic formation in Montana, USA. I personally can't wait to see what will be added for the final product.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170201906', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 516, 'last_played': 1685225152}
review: nah

author: {'steamid': '76561198035508438', 'num_games_owned': 553, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1598455268}
review:
Saurian is a realism dinosaur game.
It has been hyped since the reveal of the project and i struggle in saying that at this moment the hype was justified!
let me explain before someone starts screaming at me: this will be explained in the summary!

[b] Pros	[/b]
[list]
    [*]Great looking dinosaurs that look "scientifically accurate"
    [*]Nice gameplay mechanics that change every life stage
    [*]Good looking map with some nice wildlife (More still being added)
[/list]
[b] cons	[/b]
[list]
    [*]At this time one playable dinosaur (6 in total!)
    [*]Long wait for updates. While they do keep us posted with devblogs!
    [*]Seems to be not representative of what the final product will be
[/list]

[b] Summary	[/b]
While the dinosaurs are from a high quality the content in the first release seems very hit and miss.
The ai acts stupid! for example i have seen ai just walk around in circles or just forget i was just biting them a second ago!
this is ofc expected from an E/A game, however "Realism" is being used as the main draw for the game!
And with that fact inmind and looking at the state the game is in right now the only thing i can say is that my opinion is wait for the game to get more content!
However if you like dinosaur games i'm very sure this will be a must own game at a later point in time!
That's why i will still recommend the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133716778', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1569972272}
review: I really wanted to like this game. Seemed like a good idea for a game, but then you start to play. In order to gain you sprint back you have to walk ungodly slow. I mean a snail passed me. The game also progress very slow. Inorder to get bigger you have to just eat something, which is like small lizards and small birds, and drink water. Then you just sit there waiting for your age to go up. Which is very slow, you can sleep it just doesnt progress your age. Then its like well for the hell of it, lets take on another dino about your same size. Well guess what you bite the MF about 90 f-ing times and the he bites you twice on your tail and you die. I mean for F**K sake. If you like games where you do 5 secs. worth of playing and then just leave you pc for an hour. This is the game for you. Oh and ther dinos will just kill you with one touch, so i recomend staying close by so you can run away. Thats this game in a nut shell. Have fun wasting your time and money on this one. Maybe it will get better, maybe it wont. Thats your risk, lol for that being said. Check how often it gets updates. Oh i know its still in the makings. but you can only play one dino so far. lol

author: {'steamid': '76561198334645182', 'num_games_owned': 106, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 534, 'last_played': 1552417914}
review: Cost of game not real. First of all, game very fast ended. Only one class available. Second dakotaraptor have awful WorKing pounce. author: {'steamid': '76561198205812988', 'num_games_owned': 36, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1547116094}
review: Hello everyone! I've got two dinos to adulthood and I have a few things that I would like to point out and maybe recommend the developers to fix or add to the game on the full release, but I would like to talk about the game a bit first. First of all, for the ones that are intrested into trying it out, if you love dinos and you want to control one on your own and survive, this is the game for you. You start out as a baby that is trying to survive by finding prey and avoiding being prey for the big ones. As you age, you get bigger and change! At the beginning, I have to admit I was confused. But as I died a few times I learned good ways to survive and strategies. Find water!! That's what you need most, and stay close to it. If you get lost, sometimes you can be running around and you won't find water. Near water there are birds you can catch and lizards also are plenty near the shores on certain spots. Now, to the actual review. I was so excited and happy to play this game, I really want to see this game fully out. Pros: -Graphics are really nice, the shadows mostly. Very accurate sunlight and moonlight interaction with the environment. -The growing stages are cool to see how you grow up to something stronger and larger! -Other dinos are really nicely designed and sometimes terrifying when you find them. -You have to actualy stalk, but sometimes you're algo stalked. In one time I looked around me and saw nothing when I went to drink water. I turned around a second later to see a T-Rex charging at me from nowhere and I had no idea! Cons: -Some graphical bugs make me sad but I bet most of it will be polished later on. I would like to point out some I would deffinately want improved: *On the Dakotaraptor some of the wing feathers when you see them from behind are just blocky and not refined as a shape. *When you walk through the foilage and bushes, it would be awsome if it moved out of your way. *Talking about foilage and bushes, the reeds and tree tops don't move at all either. Maybe make them move would improve the realistic experience. *The birds when they fly away sometimes it glitches weirdly and just turn all over and it does not look refined at all. *Maybe adding some night lights like fireflies here and there would also look very cool. -Some moves and actions are a bit wonky: *When you want to sit (C) it won't sit down immediately, sometimes it glitches and you have to press it a few times. *The jump action (Space) it's quite delayed which makes the jump on attack hard to calculate. *Sometimes when you get the meat out of the carcass it just rolls to the ground from your mouth and you have to get it again. -Adding more dinos. I know it is said there will be more to play as, but the issue is there should be more dino kinds just as fauna or prey/predators. Right now you only got T-Rexes, some small raptors, more Dakotaraptors, Pachycephalosaurus and Triceratops lurking around, oh and crocodiles (at least I did not find any other). Maybe adding more smaller hervibores and bigger predators to vary would be deffinately nicer. Right now the map is quite empty. -The targeting system is a bit strange too. When you press (E) it focuses your watch and you see hidden lizards or birds but when you run while using (E) it sometimes just goes away quicker, sometimes it won't even work properly. The blue highlight should stay on even if the prey is out of the foilage. (I got a few cases where the lizard ran out of the foilage to open space and using (E) it was not highlighted. ) Since some prey is small you can't really see it properly when you chase it down. Also, other dinos should be highlighted too since it only does highlight now the lizards and birds. -The scaring technique for Dakotaraptors should for my opinion remain as the one you use when on first stage where you spread the wings and tail feathers to intimidate as when you're older you just screech and kick the air. It feels a bit lame and not scary or intimidating at all. Just my opinion tho. -Maybe add the option to zoom in more to see more in detail your dino. It gets close but not close enough. -In one ocation I had to restart the game because when I went to drink water, my water bar just went down instead of rising up and no matter what I did it did not get back even tho it made the animation that I was drinking. -The eating secondary bar goes down quickly, but the first one goes a bit slower. Since you got nothing else to do right now than just wait for you to need water or food, maybe make it go down quicker? There was times when I was just sitting down doing virtualy nothing because you got not much to explore, no many dinos to see around. As mentioned before, right now it is kinda empty.. All of these are just from my point of view. I hope the developers take a look. See you again at the next update or full release.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028253457', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 545, 'last_played': 1646932417}
review:
I don't usually buy early-access, but this time, I did wholeheartedly. I am thrilled to support the developers of this game, even at an early stage. As a paleontology geek-and-gamer combo, I've been dreaming of playing a realistic, open world, dinosaur survival game for a long, long time. Tell me you're working with paleontologists to create a realistic world and I'll tell you I love you. Have I done that yet? I love you guys. XD

In pre-alpha, bugs come with the territory, so if you're interested in those, check out one of the other reviews. I'm feeling pretty optomistic about Saurian. The developers release patches frequently and seem to have an ear to the ground within their community, so I'm happy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068725551', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1506907618}
review:
I’ve been waiting for a game like this for a long, long time. The market needs a good open world, scientifically accurate, dinosaur survival game. There’s nothing wrong with the concept, and I’m glad that finally a serious project is underway to realize this long overlooked idea.

The title of the game, the store presentation, the desktop icon, and even the main menu all look professionally done. Beyond the main menu and into the main game, the early access state of the project hits you like a truck!

I don’t think there’s a single finished aspect of the game – and I mean this is a bare bones project that has just barely lifted off the ground. The art, sound, and graphic design all lack a general direction at this point. Everything is just thrown together to more-or-less demo the skills of its developers and to test the feasibility of this project. I’ve been hyped for this title since its inception, but this has been a sobering reminder of what to expect from an indie title versus a full production.

That said I would be remiss if I didn’t mention that this is by far the most disappointing purchase I’ve so far experienced on Steam in its current state.

The presentation suggests a game full of imagination, creativity, adventure, and survival. This is an ambitious project that nobody so far has been able to realize, but the product so far could not be further from what the store presentation suggests.

The cover art suggests an action packed, thrilling adventure 66 million years in the making. From hatchling to adult hood, you walk every step as one of your favorite dinosaurs in a scientifically accurate prehistoric open world. Interact with advanced A.I dinosaurs, marvel at their science derived dinosaur models, and be astounded by this rigorously researched world…

… Or not.

The A.I is literally on par with the failed Jurassic Park: Trespasser project. Within my 8 minutes of gameplay, I saw a T-Rex manically walking in circles in a knee high swamp. I saw a full grown raptor walking directly into a tree, determined to phase through it. I did eventually kill a fellow hatchling raptor, which most likely would have rolled over and died on its own if the coding was there. Long story short, I saw enough examples of the A.I. in the starting area to be disappointed. It was then I wished the game was an MMO.

The dinosaur models, while they may be accurate to the most recent scientific iteration, still simply lack imagination. So does the open world environment in general. There’s no artistic flare to draw you in… the world as it exists today just lacks creativity. Just because something is “scientific” doesn’t mean it can’t be awesome. I urge the developers to take SOME liberties with their art/sound design. As it is today, there is no direction here, and it makes for an awkward and disappointing experience.

Now I’m left wondering, because I’ve seen no direction in the development thus far, will this project actually pan out? Or will it be added to the heap of indie titles that merely served as a cash grab? There’s still much to be decided.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041771688', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 498, 'last_played': 1643760073}
review:
Edit: tried the game again after a few months. Still dying to EVERYTHING, from the new venomous lizards to the crocs and alligators. Im trying to circle around, attack fromjumping in the air, and everything instakills me in one bite. Not worth the frustration right now. Uninstalling, I'll check back in a few months again.



I love Saurian, for a pre alpha, this game is absolutely stunning. The dinosaurs themselves are gorgeously rendered, as is the environment. After 7 hours of play, however, I have uninstalled the game. I will not be playing it again until 

A) the raptor prey restraint isn't so frustrating. I've tried several combinations of clicking the RMB and LMB. I can never injure another dino enough to kill it. Ever. And

B)whenever I'm thrown off, I'm thrown off right in front of the dinosaur I'm attacking, and die instantly. 

Seriously, I've seen more loading screen than I have of this game. You die in 1 to 2 hits. That's it. This game punishes you for learning and trying new things. I'm an adult Dakotaraptor, and all I can eat are other predators, like alligators, that kill each other, or small lizards or the smaller black raptors. I'm not touching this game again until I don't die while trying to bring down bigger prey.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003895984', 'num_games_owned': 297, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1506140063}
review:
Awesome idea, with great potential. I mean, as a baby dakotaraptor I was zipping in between the legs of a massive triceratops, just for fun--how cool is that! You'll be wandering around looking for food, only to encounter a t-rex doing the same thing...except for it, you're the food. 

Pros: 
--Great graphics
--Movement feels very natural, very fluid
--Good fps; seems reasonably optimized (for my system, at least)
--Very immersive, feels like you're really a dinosaur
--Good survival experience--you never feel truly safe

Cons: 
--Right now, the combat is weird because every dino (no matter how large or small) seems able to kill you in 1-2 hits, whereas it takes you like 20. Not sure if it's a problem with hitboxes, or if it's intentional--but it gets annoying.
--You can go a long time without encountering any food, especially when you're young. This can lead to being near starving to death. Again, not sure if it's intentional. 
--Occasional crashes. This doesn't really bother me that much, since it's still in development, and saving is easy.
--No narrative; your goal is just to survive. It might be better to have another option than 'survival mode', one with a story to provide focus (like, an asteroid or ice age, for example). Otherwise, the game will eventually get boring unless you constantly add new, varied dinos. 

I think the main thing the game needs is an improvement to combat--no more instant deaths, but a bitter drawn-out battle of tooth and claw. That would make it an amazing experience. 

Generally I don't invest in early access games--but the potential here is so incredible I feel it's worth the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198419097054', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3095, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 727, 'last_played': 1690360050}
review: Love this game... I literally bought a laptop for this. Admittedly there isn't a whole lot to do yet, as once you've maxed out Dakota, there's nothing else left to do except muck around with whatever dinosaurs you can find but that isn't a complaint as this game is still basically brand new and in early access, so limited content and bugs are to be expected. I'm so eager for any update of new content we get, I don't regret my purchase at all. Remember that early access is going to be roughly 2 years so any new content will be slow to come out. Great job devs, take your time and make this game as great as I'm sure it's going to be once finished.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114662539', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 464, 'last_played': 1708308640}
review: So the game is really fun (to an extent), it captuers what you would want a dino game to be but my main problem is this.. as a raptor I feel that as a full grown adult I should be able to take down a pachycephalosaurus by jumping on its back THREE TIMES and biting the hell out of it. While I am getting hit one time and being immediately dropped. The devs set out to make a realistic game and or simulation and im pretty sure at the rate the pachycephalosaurus are travling when they tap my raptor it would not result in a 1 shot kill. As a full grown raptor I was also killed by what ever those little dinos are, a full grown dakota could pick one of those up in its jaws and make short work of it.  I understand its a pre alpha but ther should be some sort of evolution system that allows you to make your dino a more efficient killer or fighter. This is exactly why I am writing this review because I do understand that it is a pre alpha. I hope the devs understand this is a game overall and that inevitably realism comes out to be boring if there's is no flare, or touch of creative thought put into it.

review: very fun, yet challenging game with a strong focus on realism. although pre-alpha, Saurian shows a lot of potential! Everything in the game has been painstakingly researched by the devs to maintain as close of a scientific accuracy as possible, from Tyrannosaurus calls to every single species of plant. The game is not without plenty of bugs, however, this is to be expected from a pre alpha game. There are currently only a handful of fauna species in game, but many more will be added in the future. I look foreward to continue to play this game, and watch its ongoing development and refinement.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020777628', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1550343998}
review:
Hi everybody,

I found this game by random search for some kind of survival game as an animal with some mmo elements and although this game is in very early stage and only single player, it is exactly the kind of game which goes in such direction. Maybe the multiplayer part will be added in future?

It is fun (but also tricky) to hunt some preys or to use the parental protection as juvenile at the beginning of the game to attract some potential predators which will be killed by your "parents", so that you have enough to eat to go to the next age level, where you consecutively have less enemies by growing but will need more to eat and attack larger preys.
This game demands some skilled handling so that you manage to succed in the hunt for getting food or in escaping your enemies.
The atmossphere is quite tens as well immersive and quite frightening (particularly at night) when you smell the enemies but it is hard to see them in vegetation or in the shadows.

There is a lot of potential in this game and I am looking forward to the addition of other playable dinosaurs and living elements of each race. Actually there is only one playable race, when this comment was created, but 3 others have already been added (including Triceratops and T-Rex). I like the idea that this game wants to be more like a dino simulator by aiming to implement realistic fauna and flora of this epoch.

However, there is still a lot to do and to add, but the potential is big, especially if you want to find something more "serious" than other games of that category.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047647339', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 614, 'last_played': 1685631145}
review:
Ce jeu reste très en deçà des promesses, et du coup des attentes placées en lui et son équipe de développement. Il reste objectivement très moyen.

+ Scientifiquement correct et à la pointe des découvertes paléontologiques.
+ Beaux graphismes de dinosaures. 
+ Système d'interaction sociale sympa (mais encore très incomplet)
+ Faire évoluer son dinosaure depuis son enfance.
+ Un jeu calme ! Et ça devient rare.

- La physique des dinosaures est souvent foireuse. Le pathfinding de l'AI est affreux. 
- L'AI est nulle : si vous incarnez un jeune dakotaraptor et que vous suivez vos parents en vue de chasser avec eux, vous allez mourir de faim. Ils ne chassent pas. Vos parents de font rien la plupart du temps (boire, éventuellement). Pareil avec les tricératops. L'AI est débile. Ils passent leur temps à tourner en rond (en temps que juvénile, je me suis fait piétiner).
- Graphismes des eaux assez moches.
- La musique devient pénible à force d'être jouée en permanence, ce serait mieux qu'elle se déclenche contextuellement.
- Bugs de son au casque.
- Optimisation assez mauvaise, le jeu a fréquemment des micros freezes et des baisses de fps.
- Développement du jeu très lent, les attentes/promesses de multijoueur semblent inatteignables. Aujourd'hui, le développement est bénévole, à cause de l'un des développeurs qui à volé des dizaines de milliers d'euros.


Ce jeu m'intéressait tellement pour son approche simulation de vie de dinosaures, mais il est assez désagréable à jouer sur pleins d'aspects, en plus d'être pauvre en choix de dinosaures et possibilités de gameplay.


9/20

author: {'steamid': '76561198090958602', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1263, 'last_played': 1552829951}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993946962', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 954, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 597, 'last_played': 1693250666}
review:
EDIT BASED ON THE NOVEMBER 16TH UPDATE: 

The game is still rough around the edges and I can't quite recommend this game to those who aren't intrested in helping further the game's development, or really like scientific accuracy.

With that being said I think with more polish and fixes this game could become one of the best dinosaur games on the market. I truly feel that this game represents something important for dinosaur media as a whole. It pretty common in modern media to show dinosaurs as movie monsters more akin to Godzilla than actual animals. This game manages to harness the feelings of awe and wonder that dinosaurs inherantly evoke, while at the same time presenting them as actual organisms.  In Saurian you aren't just another scaly killing machine, you are just anotehr creature trying its damnest to survive in an unforgiving but beautiful world. The world of Saurian isn't made beautiful by cutting edge graphics, its made beautiful by the elegic atmosphere of its vigourusly accurate ecosystem. The accuracy of this game isn't just a scientific statement, its a very effective aethetic choice.

However I'm afraid I still need to temper this review with some bugs I've continued to run across.


Although the scent ability for the Dakotarpator works much better now, there are still certain animals which don't appear on it at all. Crocodillians and Tyrannosaurs for me do not leave a scent trail nor are they highlighted. This is especially a problem in low light where I can just not see a Crocodillian in the grass and then get chomped by nothing, even though it was only a few feet in front of me and I was smelling the air. 

Animals no longer seem to swim indefinetly nor do they run around in circles but just seem to stop reacting at certain points. Pachycephalasaurs sometimes will just stand in place, and one time I ran into an archeoraptor and it just stood there doing nothing while I chomped on it half a dozen times. 

The raptor prey restraint seems to work better, but it is still pretty difficult to actually latch onto your prey. However I haven't been shot up 100 meters in the air yet so this mechanic is progressively getting better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040987233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1504100461}
review: It obviously needs ALOT of work in every imaginable department of the game, but considering it's in early access and has only been out for a few weeks it ain't that bad. I didn't really buy this game and expected a masterpiece, I bought it because I am eager to see what the developers will make with it. My love for dinos has never left me ever since I was a little girl playing with her plastic dinosaurs in her barbie dollhouse and cheering for the "sharptooth" in the Jurassic Park movie, so playing as a dinosaur is a childhood fantasy made real (though, as stated before, the game need work before we can really get that wish fulfilled)... but I am indeed very excited to see how this game will grow in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019194643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 688, 'last_played': 1657048975}
review:
The game is really great and actual quite fun.
It is a childs dream comming true beeing able to try and live as a dinosaur, there already is some nice features and the devs are working hard on making their game a reality.

Are you considering to buy then be aware that several of the dinosaurs they want implementet still isent in, there are 6 creatures so far and many more to come where you can only control the dakotaraptor so far.
A lot of people experience severe lag or got problems with the optimization, it isent perfect yet nope, but it is doable for the most part.
If your one of those that cant wait to get your hands on a game trying to experience a dinosaurs life then go ahead and buy.
If you can wait though then give it some time until optimization get slightly better but I can whole heartedly recommend this game.

PS: They just added threat for the current animals and it work wonders.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962330581', 'num_games_owned': 49, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 627, 'last_played': 1597439883}
review:
I wouldn't recommend this game but it has potential, so if you want to help make a good product, then you can buy it, but I will recommend to wait until the AI has been updated. 
It's an early access game but at its earliest. So a lot of work is needed to make this game great.
It pretty much feels like they had an idea for a game, quickly created the basics and that is what this is in its current state. (The dinosaurs do look good though)

The control feels weird.
There's no real excitement, you could just go afk and only eat and drink when really needed, no one will harm you.
The map is boring, there's nothing special to explore. Some caves or something would help.
I really would love to feel the hunt, both sides, hunter and hunted but there' nothing, no feeling of danger.
The AI is so primitive. All dinosaurs walk alone, it simply looks like they just walk from a to b and if a tree is in the way, the AI dino will just keep walking in to that tree.
There's no natural feeling in this game, I want to see dinos act more like animals and less like robots.
The herbivores should walk in herds and then you could maybe try to get one of the younger/smaller ones and the leader/parents would try to protect it.
The shadows in this game are horrible. When I stand beside a forest or just a few trees, there is no shadow under the trees but when I walk under the trees, there is a solid circle shadow following me all the time, but no shadow in the rest of the forest only around me.

I played until full age, discovered most of the map and it's pretty boring all the way. 
With updated AI, more dinosaurs and somehow make the map interesting to explore, this game could be really good but there is a lot of work to do.

Glithes/bugs: When running on hills, my dino starts doing weird jumps with both legs together, it looks really weird and locks the controls for a few sec.
Sometimes I can see through hills/cliffs like the way I see under water.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125654343', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1547351129}
review:
As far as graphics and ideas go for games this has to be one of the better ones in my opinion. But i do not recomend this game for a number of reasons. First is that it takes you for ever to grow into bigger stages and while that alone is not really all that bad, the fact that even after you grow to full adult and those little $h@t stains of crocodiles can still one hit you is very aggrivating. That combined with the fact that as a small adult or younger there is almost no prey to go after. It is so scarse that it really is more of a pain than actually fun to play. There should be more prey items or more concentrations of them cause we see in the fossil records and by looking at environments that around today that most places are not that devoid of life. Also the fact that not even 5 minutes go by and I'm already starving and dehydrated is annoying. Lastly is the amount of larger critters in the game. The triceratops and pachys should have higher numbers as they travelled in herds not by themselves. The trex on the other hand should be less frequent. Trex was an apex predator and a very large one at that and so most likely had a large territory like modern apex predators. There shouldn't be a rex every five feet. the game says it prides it's self on scientific facts but i can't be the only one who noticed these things. Amazing game with great potential but not worth the 20 dollar price.

Updating to my original post, i still believe everything i said originally about the game and now have to saw i think the game is basically abandoned as the entire year of 2019 has gone by and there has been no substantial update and we are years sense the release and still can only play the stupid Dakotaraptor. Only dev logs have been posted so really don't waste money on this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042531964', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1546300855}
review: I want to like this game SO badly. It's a concept I've been dreaming of since I was a kid. Unfortunately, the more I play, the more frustrated I become. Even the most basic mechanic - jumping - is a mess. Hard to feel like a true predator when I'm bounding around like a drunken ostrich day and night. I've managed to put up with it until reaching Age 6 with my Dakotaraptor, but it's been a real test of patience. I know this game has a long road ahead, and I sincerely hope it will become more playable soon. In its current state, I can't recommend it to anyone. I will gladly update this review after some progress is made. I only hope my $20 helps.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052653211', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1523783971}
review:
I can't believe that some people say that this game isn't fun. It is! Especially when you get eaten by a T-Rex that came from nowhere. That happened 4 times to me. Just look somewhere else and well.. you got eaten. Sure it's not that big right now and you don't have much space to go but that's fine. It's not finished yet. 
I finally got a game I really wanted for so many years. Where you just can be a Dinosaur (or Animal) and no damn human.
Sure, there's the Isle but that's just, well, Dinosaur PvP with survival. That's not my thing and kinda stupid.
I always wanted a game like Saurian. Where you can live their life and just survive but without being afraid of losing everything if you die because you can save the game whenever you want. I hope they keep that in. What I also wanted was a game that does not feel like a game, if you know what I mean. Without any goal but surviving and living a life.
The dinosaurs behavior isn't that good and some of them should form herds what they don't do right now. I guess that will change, too. The T-Rex's worst enemys are trees because it runs against it every time. Yes, they have to work on the AI. But there are these little details that make this game already good. You can take food with you if you're in a hurry and you shake yourself if you go out of water. I love those details. The sound is well done, too. Right now it's no fun on the long run but that's fine. The more updates come the more the fun will increase.
There's so much potential and I believe they will make the best out of it. You have to be patient.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112780782', 'num_games_owned': 1469, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1637160781}
review:
Unfortunately, I can't recommend this game in its current state. I had a hard time deciding on this, since I am a kickstarter backer, but I can't just ignore all the flaws. I am also aware that Saurian is still in Early Access. Thus, this is a temporary thumbs down, as I will look at the game again in a few months and change it accordingly (Check end of review for 2021 update).

So what's wrong with the game? 

It is far too buggy to enjoy and has little to no content at this moment. Here's an overview of my first few tries:
1. I spawn and my Raptorparents immediately run towards a T-Rex, getting eaten up by it in seconds.
2. I spawn and my Raptorparents run straight into a river, where they stay for the next 10 or so minutes before getting eaten up by a crocodile-ish creature.
3. I spawn and my Raptorparents run into a tree and get stuck there two seconds into the game.
4. I spawn, immediately leave my parents and fall through the ground after about 15 minutes.

Just ignoring the Raptorparents and going on your own journey from the beginning is not much better, as most of the other creatures act just as dumb. Often they just stand around and don't move at all. 

The second problem is the lack of content. Currently, there's only the Dakotaraptor playable (there's going to be six in the future) and all you do is run around, try to find small lizards (or bigger snacks when you're grown) and drink from a river now and then. I am aware that this is how dinosaur survival was most of the time but at this moment - with all the bugs and lack of content - it is not enjoyable for me. There's also only a handful of other creatures, after about two hours I've seen almost everything the game currently offers.

Of course, it also has some good points. The graphics are nice to look at and it's obvious that the developers put a lot of effort into portraying the Hell's Creek formation and its inhabitants as realistically as possible. Once in a while (sadly not very often) the dinosaur AI works well and watching them roam around is fun for a bit. The dinosaur models are extremely detailed and beautiful. For a paleontology/dinosaur fan like me, that's very enjoyable.

However, due to the lack of content I got bored after about 2 hours and the constant bugs and barely functioning AI frustrated me most of the time. For the - in comparison with a few other Early Access games - pretty high price of 20€ I definitely can't recommend it in its current state. Especially not if you want a fun, long-lasting game at this point in time. Nevertheless, if you want to support the developers by buying their product and giving feedback, join the club :) 
I hope the devs will continue to put their all into it and I'm sure I'll be able to change this review in a few months time. Until then, this is what I experienced with the game.

Edit Dec 2021: 
More than 4 years after my initial review nothing much changed. They added another playable dinosaur, the triceratops, which is even more boring to play. The herd mechanic sounds interesting in theory but turns out to be really boring. You can't move away from your herd more than 5 meters unless you want to lose them and be easy prey, so all you do is eat and drink nearby, then wait and twiddle your thumbs until you get hungry/thirsty again. In addition, the warning you get every time you dare move away from your herd for just one meter too much in order to reach the lake where you NEED to go in order to drink is rather annoying. In short: Good idea, horrible implementation.
Other than that, they tweaked a few things here and there but nothing hugely noticeable. It's a bit easier to find small prey animals now and the AI dinosaurs work a bit better.
They added an encyclopedia in the main menu which doesn't add any real value to the actual gameplay.
That's pretty much everything that noticeably changed in the last four years.
At this point I'm just really disappointed and frustrated. We get endless devlogs but the patches and updates never contain anything substantial. I've already given up on this game and am not sure I will check it out again when, or rather IF, it gets a full release.

author: {'steamid': '76561198216868887', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1613439727}
review: I really was looking forward to being able to play this game and it holding up to all the promises made. However, right now in its current state, I cannot recommend this game. This is due to the buggy AI whether its for your family in early game or opposing enemies which feel more spawned in and useless than actually being alive and acting as if they have a goal. In addition, the biggest problem is the fact that I can't even play the game due to a 1 fps error which other players are experiencing making the game unplayable. Once updated and fixed, I'm sure this will be an easy recommendation, but currently, it isn't.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018521022', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1609463177}
review:
2nd Review EDIT: While i know this game is still in EA, there hasnt been an update since March 2019 and i am really dissapointed as a backer at the lack of updates. Right now, i havent touched this game in over a year because of how difficult it is to do ANYTHING an you still only have ONE dino to play as. This game as pretty as it is, an as nice as the OST is -- is NOT worth what i paid for in kickstarter. I hope that more balancing updates an game mechanics come VERY soon because right now, this game collects dust and i find that sad.

------------------
1st review:
Some folks will compare it to the isle, others will say its a
twist on ark survival evolved... others say mebbe a bit of
both smashed together. Saurian however, is more amazing
then both. DONT get me wrong im a ridiculous dinosaur fan
and have loved dinosaurs since i could recall as a child an here
as a 35 yr old adult this game captured my heart LONG before
most of you steamers knew about it. Im one of the many original
kickstarter backers cause' i believe in NOT just the fantasy dino
games like ark (lets face it... theres lots of dinos from differnet
time eras tossed together in there) who have employed the
power of wyverns, unicorns an gryphons now. BUT the amazing
world of REALISM. Urvogel Games LLC has taken the time to
contact PROFESSIONAL PALEONTOLOGISTS for real research into
the game! And its based on a specific spot in a specifc era: Hells
Creek. I mean hello, sure it limits the dinosaurs you can play as
but that doesnt make it any less fun in my opinion, playing as a
dinosaur is great no matter what type you get. At least its more
then just carnivores, there are herbivores involved too! Im excited
for the future of this game, you should be too! Im going back to
making my Saurian YT vids, feel free to find them here:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cA_czRaeHA4&list=PLnblVTY-RBgznvHDu3uMJ3VadvFbZ-gbT

author: {'steamid': '76561198066203375', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1596909275}
review: This game, I believe, has a ton of potential to it. However, that being said I cannot recommend this game in its current state. The frame rate drop, even on a decent computer with a decent graphics card, makes the game completely unplayable and half of the play time I have on this game is load time. Additionally, the raptor is quite difficult to control and the other dinosaurs are spread out so much to the point where I sometimes thought I was playing a Dino Walking Simulator. Granted the game is still in beta/Early Access and I knew bugs, glitches and the like were going to be common so I will give it a slight pass for some of its faults. I would honestly love to play this game a whole lot more but between the ridiculously low frame rate and rather lenghty load time I sadly cannot. I will be keeping the game myself hoping that somehow these problems are resolved in the near future. As for now, do not buy this game until full release.

author: {'steamid': '76561198353559330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1503191121}
review: This game is a very good game. I love how everything looks but this is just lag central! I haven't figured out how to reduce it just yet but I will eventually. Hopefully. I highly recommend this game and I hope the lag ends up reducing in future updates! I look forward to it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198291956401', 'num_games_owned': 80, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1621473417}
review:
Okay, I will not lie. At the current state of the game; it is not worth the higher pricetag! While yes sure, it is definitively playable; it is not 'fun'. So don't buy this game and expect it to be on level with many modern games, because it isn't. 

However; if you want to support the developers... Or even just the concept of a realistic survival experience, please do buy this! It is amazing how many updates the development team are pumping out at the moment. And the game, despite its flaws, does what it's supposed to! It provides you with a more realistic experience of trying to survive from a hatchling to an adult. There is no pampering, no handholding and it's not an easy game... And that's why I love it.

At the current state of the game; I'd give it a 5/10. I would give it a better rating based on the concept alone, but that wouldn't be just.

I hear alot of complaints about fps being garbage, but this has not been a problem for me at all. I'm on the higher end of the pc spectrum; so the game is running mostly flawlessly even on ultra with max foliage draw distance. There are short moments of dropped frames, especially during night/day transitions, but they are short and sparse.

--------

Edit:

It has now been two years. That support that I gave has given me close to nothing in return. The map looks still basically the same. Sure, there are more prey uncontrollable species populating the small world, but there's been NO change at all to gameplay, and two years later there's still not a single more playable species.

It's with a saddened heart that I reccomend you stay away from the game. It has potential, and it's still unforgivingly hard - but honestly, you'll pay $20 for an experience that you'll most likely not even have the energy to finish.

There is no reward for the player for growing bigger, there's no reward for progress, there's no real change in gameplay not matter what size you are - apart from a single pounce attack that is buggy at best. 

I used to try to help the developers with bug-testing and I was looking forward to this games future... well... now it's the games future and there's been barely any change. 

Don't buy the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198360680526', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1504716982}

author: {'steamid': '76561198152488119', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 460, 'last_played': 1680390175}
review: I love love love this game!!!! While I didnt hear about this game until Feburary of 2017 and wasnt really one of those "4 year supporters" at least I still found it when I did because then I knew that when the early access game aired, it would be like the bare bottom. So I wasnt expecting a extremely intruiging game. Whenever I first got it and was a little hatchling I switched between lives to get the feel of how different your experiences are, and they are pretty darn different. The ai acts extremely impressive, and it was challenging to get to adulthood. Other people are saying dont buy this game because it is boring, and I might just be weird but i find it so fun because right when you think that you are gonna have no more challenges all of a sudden all of the prey disappears or a hungry t-rex appears. Right now I am a 13 1/2 year old dakotaraptor and plan to play through another life all over again. Also I reccomend you buy this if you want to support the developers, as your purchase will fund them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078908229', 'num_games_owned': 554, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 448, 'last_played': 1687942062}
review:
Saurian - качественный симулятор жизни динозавра. Уже в режиме пре-альфа видны старания разработчиков и перспективность проекта. 
Озвучивать минусы, являющимися обычными спутниками пре-альфа, смысла не вижу.
Не уверена, что любителям экшена понравится данная игра. В ней скорее хочется расслабится, погрузиться в тот доисторический мир и помочь крохе динозавру выжить в жестоком мире.
Полный обзор у меня растянулся на несколько word страниц. Так что сюда при всём желании не поместился бы. Кому интересно, могу предложить взглянуть на обзор в формате видео, в котором я отражаю игру как таковую, приправленную щепоткой научных данных. 

https://youtu.be/6aszsboz13g

author: {'steamid': '76561198087797070', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 661, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 613, 'last_played': 1536437220}
review: I know my PC isn't exaclty cutting edge, it's not that great, but I think Saurian might have a lot of things going on at once. Like, I know it's early access and buggy right now but my I can't even move around without it lagging like crazy, and I have everything at the lowest setting even the resolution. It reminds me of how my PC can run Arma 3 pretty well on low settings but it could barely run playing Ghost Recon Wildlands because even the freakin grass was super animated and apparently vital. Idk if Saurian is doing the same thing with its flora and walking animations but just thought I'd mention my issues with it, I imagine others have a similar problem unless they're like a Youtuber with a crazy setup. I do still recommend it because hopefully all issues will be addressed and hey I could always get a better setup somewhere down the line.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116205644', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 366, 'last_played': 1526445238}
review:
After playing it for about an hour and a half, this game certainly has a lot going for it. The controls are a little different, but after you get into the swing of them, it doesn't bother you anymore - it'd say after like 10 minutes of gameplay you get them? 

Currently one dinosaur is playable, the Dakotaraptor. A cute little microraptor with a long swooshy tail. It's definitely visually appealing to just run around and listen to the little chomping noises! 


A couple cons would be sparse the game currently feels, prey-wise. The small lizards seem to crop up anywhere in no sort of set territory locations, so they aren't even more plentiful down by the water. The birds that you can find along the shoreline are very quick to fly off, and I've yet to successfully nab one from the air. Sometimes you catch a dumb one who won't take off, and it's just a large free meal.

My biggest, biggest issue is how the T-Rex enemies do not have footstep sounds. Twice now I have just finished eating some scraps, and then a giant T-Rex comes out of NO WHERE and just swallows me whole. I don't mind them doing that - they're large ass dinos - but at least some sort of thundering footstep warnings would be nice, so I could have some counterplay.

Otherwise, this is a chill game that I really can't wait to see move further. It's worth a 20 dollar investment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061123261', 'num_games_owned': 129, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1606278964}

Rather barebones at the moment, but that's to be expected of an early-access title. Still, even with everything not being implemented yet, I've had a lot of fun so far with this game. 

I'm excited for the other dinosaurs to become playable, the anzu especially. While the dakotaraptor is fun to play, it is the only dino available currently, so if you're looking to be one of the other announced playable dinos, I'd suggest waiting for future updates to be released.

Otherwise, is good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035557117', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 419, 'last_played': 1654806325}
review:
I've followed Saurian for a while, and I was incredibly happy to see it reach early access. I've definitely enjoyed what I've played so far. The environment looks nice, as do the dinosaurs themselves, and...well, I've wanted a survival game where you're a dinosaur for a long time. Ark mods aren't enough. You start out as a hatchling, and so far you pretty much have to start fending for yourself immediately, hunting down small lizards and birds and avoiding predators. Let me tell you, it felt good to eat some of the smaller predators once I grew a little. Revenge!

My main criticism at the moment is lag, honestly. The game runs poor for me, and my computer isn't bad or old by any means. I expect that to be ironed out soon enough, though, considering that it's less than a month into early access right now. The controls are also fidgety at times, but...well, like I said, it's been in early access for less than a month.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962558794', 'num_games_owned': 188, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1692736252}
review: I really enjoyed this game.  It is one of those games that starts out pretty difficult.  It took me a little while to figure out how to catch a lizard as a hatchling.  One of the best game mechanics is that your head will follow the lizard and it made things a lot easier once I figured that out.  I just learned to be patient and wait for the lizard to stop.  I then pointed towards it and sprinted for a quick catch.  I cannot wait for better AI behavior and, of course, more dinos to play.  This game is very playable, IMO, even with the bugs and early development it is in.  As of writing this review, I could only play as a dakota raptor to age 14.  Through this it includes several sizes and colour changes of the dinosaur you play.  Also when you get older you realize you cannot just live on lizards forever and it is more practical to just kill larger things.  As an adult I was able to take down a Trike, but it was quite a fight.

author: {'steamid': '76561198387775273', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 557, 'last_played': 1604460152}

author: {'steamid': '76561198110274910', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 580, 'last_played': 1584926389}
review: I truly hate to have to give this game a bad review, but at this point it must be done. It's concept and animations are beautiful, but the jittery, unresponsive controls and insane amounts of glitches just makes this game unplayable. Even for stronger computers that should play this with ease, it's not even functional. I know it's early access, but even now it's just too early to be charging this much for such a trainwreck of a game. And I've been through the early stages of Ark. I would wait for a few months for them to sort out the bugs, this game is currently not worth the $20 they demand for this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202778268', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5925, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5111, 'last_played': 1680304872}
review:
So I've followed this game before their kickstarter launched, supported their kickstarter, and have poured dozens of hours into the game. From my honest opinion, this game really is a no-go right now. Conceptually, it could be an awesome game. Right now, I cannot stress enough how slow the development is, and how repetitive and boring the gameplay can be right now. The developers put out "devlogs" every couple weeks, which describe their latest updates on game development. I've followed them since the very first devlog, and it seems to me as if the more recent devlogs have *heavily* stagnated in content. Development just feels like it's at an all-time slowdown. 

The only pros I could think of for the game are it's dinosaurs. They are constructed beautifully, and their animations flow better than most other dinosaur games I have seen. If you are interested in visuals, this game is for you. If you're interested in solid gameplay, I'd look for other options. This is due to a combination of poor optimization and stale gameplay. 

At this rate, I don't think we're ever going to be given what we were promised when we supported the game. If it takes over a year of time to implement just one playable animal, and still not have a completed Dakotaraptor by the time of it's release, imagine how long it's going to take to implement every thing they promised - 4 more playable dinosaurs after Dakotaraptor and Triceratops, a Post-Impact Survival mode, animal customization, or other planned features. As each day goes by, I feel more and more scammed by something which I had once put so much faith in. I want to see the game grow, and hopefully it does, but at this point, with 1 1/2 years into early access and still very little progress, I find it very hard to believe that it can or will. I would not recommend this game in it's current state at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054174673', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1648249826}
review: I have enjoyed every minute of Saurian even with some bugs and lag. The support team has been awesome about listening to bug reports! It's a work in progress but I'm loving the adventure!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972380640', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1686511360}
review:
For future reference I'm going to update this review as time goes on.

As it stands right now, Saurian is a very unique game and an amazing achievement. There exists few other games that want to tackle a realistic dinosaur survival. For that, Saurian has a long road ahead of itself. Currently in Early Access, the game is $20. While it is buggy and lacking in content atm, that may soon change. If you're looking to help the devs and try out the game yourself, I suggest giving them that $20. Otherwise just wait until it gets updated more to your liking because currently only the Dakotaraptor is playable as I write this review.

However, since writing it they have already patched some major bugs and added a new dinosaur. All of this happened in one day's time. I hope to see some great things from this game. If you were fed up with Ark and wanted a game that accurately depicted dinosaurs the way they existed while also promising multiplayer, this is your game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198218298812', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 553, 'last_played': 1620490894}

The game, for me, has serious promise and I can not wait to see it when it's fully developed. Excited!

author: {'steamid': '76561198153279897', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1022, 'last_played': 1566944937}
review:
Only on Steam (Early Access)
I absolutely love Dinosaurs and this game really hit the spot for me. Being able to run around as a Dakotaraptor with a prey in your mouth gives you a sense of great immersion feeling. Eat, drink and survive as you grow from a hatchling to and adult to take on bigger dinosaurs.

Great potential for this game as long as they don't change to much of the mechanics.

Pros:
- the basic eat, water, sleep mechanics
- having to run around with my prey in the mouth to save for a meal later
- the aging/growth system very immersive
- standing on the beach looking out into the ocean watching the sun set
- Jumping on the back to attack is a very neat and interesting mechanic
- Can't wait for more DInos!

Cons(I know its still early access)
- Can't drink water from the ocean to replenish water, only in ponds or streams, (maybe thats okay)
- Seeing a dinosaur skin being ripped from the body would be a great addition instead on just disappearing when finished
- Dead Dinosaurs seem to dissapear in less than 10 minutes even if there is still food left
- Jumping on the back technique need better instructions on "how to" rather then just spamming the RMB
- No Controller support yet :(
- Night time colors seem to be pastel and not very pretty to look at
- By adult growth (age 6) of the DakotaRaptor seems to be a bit buggy in my opinion, needs work
- By age 7 is took me about 20 minutes just to take down a triceratops, was quite a fun, challenging, intense moment, Still a one hit kill for them to kill me even at age 7.
- Needs a better movement mechanic, walking is too slow, Pressing W should make your Dino Run, Holding SHIFT should be a Sprint action that uses Stamina, and any button like CTRL for walk or "sneak"
- Running and jumping on a preys back needs percise timing, I always seem to jump way over my target, would be nice to implement a sneak and pounce system.
- One time I jumped on the back of a Pachy and took it down, when I did I went below the ground into water and had to swim underground until I foudn water so I could climb back up, not sure what happened but it did.
- NEEDS MORE DINOS!

But overall great experiance and Im still playing it, 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198160739963', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1502763403}
review:
De momento saurian esta un poco verde pero cumple con lo prometido.

En mi primera partida me eh encontrado con algunos bugs, el rendimiento esta bien (casi siempre), el interfaz me parece un poco simplista pero esta bien, es intuitivo.

Ahora mismo solo podemos jugar como dakotaraptor (de joven a adulto), mas adelante se podra jugar como tiranosaurio,pachycephalosaurus y triceratops, todos de la formacion hell creek.

Ahora mismo no tiene mucho contenido jugable, pero no olvidemos que es un juego en acceso anticipado, recuerdenlo antes de hacer sus criticas.

Recomiendo comprar saurian no solo por ser un buen simular sino tambien para apoyar a los desarrolladores.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041114813', 'num_games_owned': 157, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1652401566}
review:
For right now- i dont recommend getting this game. The Dev's i feel like had enough time to at least throw out Dakota AND, rex, trike, and pachy playable dinosaurs. But for right now its only Dakotaraptor. 
I haven't seen recent updates from the devs, they could be working on it- but you never know.

I love the movement- and i really think they did a good job at making everything 'Realistic' but here are my downsides so far.

-If you are taller than the prey you are trying to hunt, you cant bite it.
-injured effects are still there even when you are healed up
-AI kind of go stupid when you walk near them (walking in circles or completely stopping)
-The pounce is very hard to accomplish. Needs to be some indicator on where ur going to land or more control over it.
-Almost impossible to climb trees because you go through most
-Not a lot of different terrains..
-You basically have to walk around aimlessly for an hour trying to at least get to teenage years and grind on Lizards
-Its not really enjoyable for the ammount of time you have to wait to grow up
-I do not like the fact that the "alligators" (since i dont know the proper name in-game, im just going to call them that)- can kill an adult DakotaRaptor very easily if you mess up a pounce on it, or cannot hit it because its lower to the ground.
-Pounce is broke, where you stay on infinitely and can just kill dinos. (This was bugged in the latest update) 
-Camera issues

So far i dont have anymore concerns, but later in the future i may make another review for when they add more things.
But yea- so far, all of my hype for this game has gone down the drain.
I really hope in the future they will add things as quick as possible. Even Alpha testers (60$+ backers) didn't really get to experiance much and it was dissapointing. People who are buying it now on steam, or have backed it for 20$ and below, are just getting the same thing that the Alpha testers were, besides the 'Test level' for the Pachy and Dakota combat.

Also i love the dev's emu. So thats a plus XD

author: {'steamid': '76561198121271236', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1677107537}
review:
I would like to start off by saying I would highly recommend this game to anyone who actually has a gaming computer. It looks amazing from what I've seen in others playthroughs and that really got me hooked and excited to play.
I love simulation games, especially ones that pay such close attention to detail.
That being said, I have to not recommend it for anyone like me. None of my laptops or computers will run it without it being so incredibly slow that it is impossible to play. I tried every setting down to the lowest and there was no change, simply the same problems with a blurrier picture. My system met all the required needs but it isn't anything fancy.
As of yet I do not believe this is a game as widely available as they wish it to be.
I'm disappointed, and I think the price is a bit high for the current product, though it will apparently update and become the final release if you buy it this early so you don't have to buy it again.
I suppose I'll just have to wait.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025093383', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1502537082}
review:
I found out about Saurian when one of my favorite youtubers (JackSepticEye) played it.  It looked fantastic and fun, and as soon as the video was over, I went to snag a copy for myself. I realized that it was in early access and was prepared for bugs and crashes- I'm not new to the problems of a game currently in development- but the game was literally unplayably slow for me. My system hardware is above the minimum and meets the recommended requirements in most areas, but there was incredible lag on even the very lowest settings. I went to the forums and discovered this was quite a common problem. I tried many of the solutions suggested, but none of them worked for me, so I requested a refund

So be aware, if you purchase this game- it may not be playable for you. 

I'd try and buy Saurian again- When I'm convinced that they have actually addressed and fixed the cause of this problem, instead of the main response seeming to be "Your computer is old, buy a better one!"

author: {'steamid': '76561198241797366', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1703969406}

author: {'steamid': '76561198245670120', 'num_games_owned': 390, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 1033, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 538, 'last_played': 1529765312}
review:
I don't usually go for games in early access, but my friend pointed out Saurian to me and I was intrigued. As an early access game and a proof of concept, it nails that right down. But in its current state, it is very poorly optimised and even on my relatively decent PC I could only get 10 FPS on the lowest graphics settings.

But the concept is definitely there. You play as a baby dinosaur (in the early access version you only have one dinosaur species to pick) and your goal is to survive. It is not easy. This is hardcore survival if ever I've seen it. Plus it's dinosaurs. How can you not want to play as a dinosaur?

In its early access stage it's a bit difficult for me to recommend it in its current form but I'm going to go ahead and give it a recommendation because so far it looks very promising and I'm excited to see where the developers go from here with it!

This review may change as the game develops so watch this space!

Edited on 17/8/17: After a couple of updates since writing this, I can safely say it is somewhat easier to survive into the next life stage if you're careful. The lower graphical textures look nicer too although the optimisation is still poor. Hoping to see this in a future update!

Edited on 27/9/17: I'm starting to get the hang of the game now but PLEASE FIX THE FRAMERATE! I'm lucky if I get 10 FPS in an area with not a lot going on and it makes it very difficult sometimes. Also, there are times where the controls don't feel so responsive. Better optimisation is definitely needed right now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060066364', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1550948162}
review:
Ever since the Jurassic Park game came out of the SEGA Genesis, I loved the idea of playing a raptor, running around and eating other dinosaurs and all that, so this game was a must try for me. Unfortunatelly I can't play it.

I hope the "1 FPS issue on high end PCs" gets fixed soon, because currently the game is unplayable for me and from what I've read in the forums, even people with PCs that can't really be called "high end" anymore seem to have that problem.

Also, the frame rate issue aside, the game currently only offers me 4:3 resolution ratios for some reason. I've gotten so used to 16:9 that this just looks horribe and immersion killing to me, even if the frame rate were playable. Also the promotion videos and pictures clearly are all in 16:9, so what is this?

author: {'steamid': '76561198298875114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 895, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 468, 'last_played': 1696213111}
review:
На данном этапе игру хочется лишь ругать, а  не хвалить. 
Минусы:
1.-Оптимизация: О да, если вы-мазохист, любящий играть в 20 фпс, то эта игра(только на данном, надеюсь, этапе) для вас, игра ничем сверх некст-геновым не выделяется, но жрёт ваш FPS знатно.
2.-Ориентация ИИ в пространстве: Вылупился у счастливых дакоторапторов сыночек, потом из-за тупости дакоторапторы упёрлись в дерево до конца своих дней.
3.-скудность контента: Это, надеюсь, исправят в будущем, добавив своих "мегакрутых" геймплейных фичей.
Плюсы:
1.-Неплохой ИИ крокодилов и ящериц(наверное поэтому они и выжили): Ящерицы не сидят на одном месте, ожидая смерти от архерораптора или маленького дакотораптора, они быстро перемещаются и мансят(уворачиваются), кроки не будут преследовать вас по всей карте и при опасности уходят в воду.
2.-амбиции и будущие проекта: Проект ещё на стадии зарождения получил финансовый успех, а значит есть шанс, что он допилится разрабами и мы будем наслождаться красивым не багованным миром, хорошим искусственным интеллектом, и играть в пати в мультиплеере с друзьями.

На данном этапе её можно купить из соображений, что в будущем она станет лучше, а цену повысят(как с тем же ARK).
Кстати, вот оффицальная группа разработчиков игры в дискорде-https://discord.gg/5PDvj9
