author: {'steamid': '76561198014671974', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 481, 'last_played': 1607741102}
review:
Now I must stress one thing, if you do not meet the recommended PC requirements, DO NOT attempt to run this game. I purchased this game as a gift to one of my friends who I frequently play with. My assumption was that since he and I could play together in other titles, that he would be able to run this. I was of course horribly mistaken. I neglected to take into account my own PC's capabilities and not his. Does this mean I will request a refund, just because he cannot run it? ABSOLUTELY NOT. I made my gift purchase for the sole purpose of supporting this game, as it is the only way that I can further it's development.

Now the game itself. Why do I recommend it? For it's potential. I cant recommend it as a good game (yet). As of right now the first thing I noted was the clearly unoptimized rendering of the game. I knew this going in that an unoptimized game running on Unity was likely to cause severe drops in frames, and it would be nearly impossible for a low end PC to run. For those people I do not recommend it. I also cannot recommend it to the players of other dinosaur games. If you come here with certain expectations about what the life of a dinosaur should be, expect to be disappointed, because it's likely that you wont have your expectations met. Life can be dull, many already know this. The life of any animal can be dull, but that doesn't mean that, if nothing exciting happens, it must be doing something wrong. That isn't what Saurian is about. Saurian is about survival. For me it is the release into nature that keeps me coming back. There isn't a single thing that keeps me coming back other than just being able to be lost in the life of a simulated animal.

What needs improvement? I think that with future updates, the level of interaction with the AI needs to be improved. Right now the AI feels random and misguided. Upon spotting other AI or the player, the NPC's should engage in meaningful actions. As an adult Dakotaraptor, you will find that Pachys will often stroll randomly, ignoring your presence instead of attempting to stand their ground or fleeing as necessary. Then, once a certain age is reached, you become unable to use the fantastic RPR mechanic on Pachys, as the damage you put out can simply take them down in a single bite, all while being completely immune to their attacks. This has been what is killing the game for me, the lack of a struggle at the end game. A Pachy should be entirely capable of fighting off a dakotaraptor. A well placed headbutt needs to be able to break bone. Put those two things together and you already have more interesting combat.

Again, I only recommend this game because I see its potential and I do not want to spoil its chances as an Early Access game so early in its development. However, if improvements are not made I will change my review as necessary.

RECOMMENDED:
OS: Windows 7/8/10 64-bit
Processor: Intel Core i7-4790K 4.10GHz or equivalent
Memory: 8 GB RAM
Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 970 or equivalent
DirectX: Version 11
Storage: 5 GB available space
Sound Card: DirectX compatible soundcard or onboard chipset

MY SPECIFICATIONS:
OS: Windows 8 64-bit
Processor: Intel Core i3-4330 3.5GHz (Dual Core)
Memory: 16 GB RAM (1800MHz)
Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1060 SSC (EVGA) 6 GB VRAM
DirectX: Version 11
Storage: >5 GB HDD
Sound Card: DirectX Compatible Onboard Chipset

Please Note that your experience depends heavily on your computers specifications in this early stage of development. RAM and Graphics seem more important than processor power.

author: {'steamid': '76561198185823934', 'num_games_owned': 427, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 1642, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1655778780}
review:
Porque vc deve comprar esse jogo e ter na sua lista?
Vou tentar ser o mais breve possível e convencê-lo com três argumentos!

1: Trata-se de um simulador desenvolvido por especialistas (arqueologos), tentando passar o mais proximo possível as caracteristicas dos dinossauros com qualidade e todas as descobertas recente, há geografia e espécies, não aquelas bobagens que tentam enfiar na cabeça das pessoas como se todo mundo fosse kids!

2: Apessar de esta em pré-alfa, já mostra muito potêncial, fora o preço muito barato, quem perder essa oportunidade vai ter que desembolsar uma boa grana no futuro proximo ( não é que o jogo não vale cada centavo que cobrarem). Tem jogos extremamente inferiores com preço alto pense nisso!

3: A abientação (bioma) já passa aquele medo, você pode usar o olfato para rastrear, e pode se rastreado, ou beber água em um rio e derrepente um crocodilo a espreita te agarrar, escolher entre fêmea e macho, andar em bando, passar do estagio de filhote até um adulto o jogo está ficando muito divertido.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012910996', 'num_games_owned': 393, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1515806873}

author: {'steamid': '76561198214996511', 'num_games_owned': 29, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 958, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 877, 'last_played': 1522046033}

author: {'steamid': '76561198046410381', 'num_games_owned': 52, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1054, 'last_played': 1595839516}
review:
I would reccomend this game to people that enjoy survival games because it's not easy, just like how hard it would be for a basically orphaned baby dinosaur as your parents rarely hunt food for you to steal a bit of. 

There has been a couple of other reviews and blogs I've read that complain about how difficult this game is but once you understand that it's a survival game it makes sense for it to be slightly difficult, after exploring nearly the whole map and having a decent amount of hours on this game I can say it's not a walk in a park unless your park has countless amounts of pachy's (A.K.A Destroyer Of Dreams) anyway I'm very excited by the potential of this game going into the future and look forward to what the developers have in store for us. 

Yes there is a lot of bugs most of them are not game breaking and some are but that's to expected as it is a early access game and if you go into an early access game expecting no bugs you will be dissapointed by every early access game on steam.

So I'd recommend coming along for the journey if you have the cash to spare and you have a fairly decent PC because the game isn't really optimised properly yet but reguardless it's going to be a fun ride.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145987398', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 3370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 880, 'last_played': 1712355775}
review: You guys really need to fix the camera moving up and down and all around at least give an option to lock the camera..

author: {'steamid': '76561198014242690', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1512340464}
review:
The animations for the Dakotaraptor are gorgeous, and the fact that theropods in this game have feathers is amazing. While there is still not much to do in the game, it's a solid foundation upon which an amazing (maybe the best) dinosaur game may be built.

I fully recommend the purchase of this game, as is has the potential to become one of the greatest games ever. Supporting small game developers, especially when they are as committed to scientific accuracy and quality of animations as these guys are, is in and of itself worth the price of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070999452', 'num_games_owned': 265, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1549297836}
review:
I heared about this game in 2016 and wanted to kiscksart it but didnt get the chance, so i was pretty exited for it to come out. I bought it, installed it, and then played it. 1.3 hours later i've decided to review it the best i can.

I will start off by listing the pros.
1. great gameplay concept (i've allways loved the idea of playing as a dinosaur)

2. higher scale of realism then "The isle" wich to my knowledge, gamplay-wise, is the only competetor for this game (correct me if im wrong)

3.A groth system 

4. nice graphics

And now the cons.

1. The game needs a lot of graphic optimasation as it lag's on any graphic quality's higher then medium (the pc i am using esealy reaches the requirements to play this game, and i think its less of a hardware issue then a issue with the pc having to render a massive amount of foliage)

2. Hunting as a chick "Dacotaraptor" is pretty hard as the only thing you can hunt are lizards that you cant see most of the time due to the foliage (i recomend to just spam the "smell" button and to run and bite when you close in to the preys location.)

3. theres only one playable dinosaur in game (wich is the dacotaraptor (i hope i spelled its name correctly)) at this moment in time (the developers ill add more playable dinosaurs in the future)


All in all i would say one thing about this game wich should sum it up nicealy. It should not be out yet. with that i mean that the game feels more like a demo version, or a pre alpha build then a early acces game, but i would anyways recomend buying it. Dont get me wrong, this game is pretty boring at this point in time, but it can still give you a couple of hours of fun. And unlike other early acces tittles, this game will get updated. 

I would recomend you to buy this game now if you are interested in openworld realistic dinosaur simulators, but only if you have the patience to wait a half/one year then you will probably be amazed by what this game will become, and then you can say that you were one of the first people to buy this game, and that you followed this game since it came out, but for noe this game is not really worth what it costs. you can also buy The isle for the same price, but i personally would prefer this game as the devs seem pretty cool and the The isle devs seem to not listem to their comunity.

all in all. id say this game is still not worth it yet, as it is more like a ugly duckling, but if you wait and give it time you will recive a beutifule swan. I recomend this game and would recommend the devs to work a bit on the graphics optimisation.



I've now realized that its 5 am and that i should probably go to bed. I hope this review did help you. Thank you for reading and i wish you a plesant day/night.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120274868', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1548635456}
review:
First life. I spawn, my parent immediately glitches into a river and my little brother drowns himself (I think, he went in with the mother and was never seen again)

I search for 10 minutes for any food or even another dinosaur.

Find nothing, go into a cluster of tall grass and hear breathing. For some reason a fucking T Rex's footsteps make 0 sound and he ran up and killed me when i was trying to sniff the air for what was breathing.

it's fun as hell but obviously early access


UPDATE

Second Life: This time I stay with the parent and he doesn't glitch out. We find a small animal to kill and my parent misses an attack so I hit it once then go for another. The parent also went for the kill and killed us both. Thanks Obama

author: {'steamid': '76561198148073845', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1602531244}
review:
¿Que puedo decir de este juego que aun no se halla comentado ya? Comenzare mencionando unas cuantas cosas negativas  y luego ya comentare unas cuantas cosas positivas.
Primero es que el hambre y agua bajan muy rapidamente, aveces puede pasar varios minutos hasta que encuentres una presa (Ni hablar de cuando eres una cria/juvenil, debes de tener mucha suerte para sobrevivir) los transcursos de día a noche y noche a día el juego cae a unos horribles 5fps... 2 fps... 1 fps (Y no es que mi pc sea malo, me corre perfectamente juegos exigentes de graficos) Y la IA aveces no puede ser muy... IA...
Lo bueno es que, los aspectos positivos del juego hacen ver a los negativos muy pequeños, si uno se acostumbra a jugarlo, poco a poco se hace más facil, por lo que tiene una buena curva de aprendizaje, los modelos de los dinosaurios son preciosos, se nota mucho que los desarrolladores le pusieron todo el amor del mundo al juego, un mapa lleno de vida, con distintos lugares que investigar, a cada momento uno siente esa necesidad de sobrevivir. 
Sé que con actualizaciones aquellos errores que mencione antes, seran arreglados. 
Lo recomiendo, pero si quieres una experiencia más completa, te diria que esperes unos meses a que sigan actualizando.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110616103', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 515, 'last_played': 1628726228}
review: I used to support this game but not anymore, only played this game for 18 hours in the past years of its release and i don't want it anymore... nothing has been added besides small Ai animals that have twitchy animations. After over 2 years of "Development" still only Dakotaraptor is playable. from what I remember triceratops was suppose to be released over a year ago. lastly it seems the budget has been wasted on remodels and retexture's instead of furthering the core game mechanics and content. if its possible i want to get my money back. author: {'steamid': '76561198011180123', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1516765909}
review:
I am going to start by saying I fricking love this game.  And I desperately, desperately want to play it because I have been a paleonut since a kid, and is the reason why my friend bought me this game for my upcomming birthday.

However I just cannot recommend this game to anyone yet least they endure the same frustration as I.

The controls.  SUCK.

The camera flings around wildly when you're trying to look around, even with the sensitivity cranked down.   

There's no way I have been able to find to lock focus onto prey, which might not be an issue if it wernt for the way the camra wildly swings around and you cant focus on your prey.   If there is a way, I cant find it nor mention of it in any guide.


Prey is sparce and limited.  You're just as likely to die of starvation as you are to other preditors.  And when you do find prey (lizards) they are nearly impossible to catch.  Ive tried chasing, ive tried standing still and waiting as some suggest, but to no avail.  I starved with a lizard running over my feet that I had been trying to kill for 15mins.



I am going to let the game be for a couple of months, and hope some AI/content improvements have been implimented and will revise my review then.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052270990', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 404, 'last_played': 1679193506}
review:
I've been waiting for this game for awhile. My first experience with it however, was less than I would have hoped. My very first experience I couldn't even move. A lot of it was my error, but that first impression was less than optimal. I've tried other wild animal sims and quickly left them behind because they were boring. I hated Ark because I couldn't even make it off the beach I died so much. to me, dying without progression is no fun at all. That being said, until recently, my PC's had a 100% mortality rate. This game is unforgiving and brutal. 

 [b]It will not be for every one. [/b]

[u]WHAT I LIKED[/u]
I found it engaging even though right now, in early access, it is sparcely populated and not everything is behaving as desired. The animal models are well designed and georgous. Since I have an older machine, I'm running it on low settings, but the vegetation and water still look acceptable to me. Running around as a little raptor against all the odds staked against me evokes a sense of accomplishment and elation when I've overcome what's killed me over and over again. I squeaked happily as I grew for a second time, only to die from starvation once again. (my last few attempts at hunting those damned lizards did not go in my favor.)

[u]WHAT I DIDN'T LIKE[/u]
The game environment and world is unforgiving. You will die a lot. You will starve a lot. You will be killed by other dinos. Your parents will ignore you entirely - at least untill you get big enough. Once you manage to survive past babyhood, you will still die alot, likely to starvation. Your biggest obsticles will be eating and not being eaten, and you will die a lot. The world is currently not terribly populated and it's easy to go a long time without seeing or smelling anything. There is also nothing else to do currently than eat, drink and survive. 

Even with all of that, I'm going to keep playing because as challenging as it is for me to keep my poor Dakotaraptor alive, I want to see what else is coming. I want to play as other species. Currently, only the Dakotaraptor is available, but five other species will be available at some later date, as well as multiplayer and a more lively world. The developers have stated that it will get better, eventually. The evolution will take a couple years but it's been promised to evolve. I'm willing to patient and impatiently see whats around that next shrub.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139057912', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1521885034}
review:
Allthough gameplay is still limited at this early stage, with the beautiful aesthetic, incredible AI and great accuracy, this game always brings a unique experience with each playthrough.
I'm constantly amazed by the attention to detail in every creature and plant, and I've continued to find new and interesting scenery.
The animation of creatures is incredible, it brings deep immersion to the game, and when chasing lizards, it really felt like I was controlling a real dinosaur.
I'm really excited to see where this game goes, it's off to a brilliant start.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046728260', 'num_games_owned': 551, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1513363931}
review:
I agree with a lot of other reviews, so some of what I'll say might echo them. This game is gorgeous, and the time the devs have spent researching the Hell Creek formation and bringing it to life really show. The game is sort of bare, there aren't many creatures moving around, but those that do are very fluid.

The controls are relatively simple. Movement doesn't feel as fluid as it does in some other games but it is easy to adjust to. The UI could use a little work, it's really simple right now, but it gets the job done.

The AI is a little strange and unpredictable (but what animal isn't?) I have seen critters walking into trees which kind of breaks the experience a little.

Again there is a clear lack of content. Only 1 of 6 planned dinos are currently playable, and there is only a handful of other creatures in the world around you. I spent a lot of time wandering the forest with nothing else in sight, even small critters for me to eat were pretty scarce. The game is currently in development, and there has already been a bug fix patch within a week of release, so the content should flow relatively quickly. The devs are super open and really interact with the community which is great to see.

TL;DR: This game is sort of bare, but the premise looks great. If you love dinosaurs I would highly recommend picking it up. Otherwise, put it on your follow list and watch the development and pick it up when it has more stuff for everyone to do.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991196780', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1502244358}
review:
[h1][u]FIRST IMPRESSIONS[/u][/h1]

As interesting as the concept sounds, I can't see this game being playable much beyond a few hours at best. It looks ok (until it gets dark, then it just looks weird, not sure if the dev is trying to simulate some kind of night vision, but it looks kind of like the gamma is jacked up at night), and I know it sounds weird, but during the day everything is just too green, I feel like there needs to be a little more colour variety. The game runs smoothly enough for an early access title (occasional screen freezes here and there). But, you pretty much just run around a jungle eating and drinking. I lost my parents on the first day, because I "rested" without reading the hint properly, my fault entirely, but it seemed like a strange time to let you know you can rest to recover stamina, I assumed it meant sit down and you recovered it faster, had I read on I would have noted that 8 hours pass when you rest, so my parents peaced out. I then spent the next 18 minutes running about trying to find water in the dark, this wasn't made easy by the confusing music that made me think I was being persued the whole time. I guess the music was supposed to be creating tension, but it just served to confuse me. Then a pachycephalosaurus stepped on me and I died.

[h1][u]PLEASE RUN![/u][/h1]

I found, as with most Unity games, the controls were sluggish. Jumping appeared to be something that worked randomly. I couldn't get a feel for when it should and shouldn't work, like there was some kind of condition that needed to be met before I could jump (ie. running at a certain speed, having a certain amount of stamina, an invisible cooldown) And for some reason, for such a small, light and agile critter my dakotaraptor appeared to have incredible difficulty getting up to running speed. I mean, I would expect a predator like this one to be able to accelerate to full speed in a very short time, but it was like trying to roll start a locomotive.

[h1][u]TEACHING AIDE?[/u][/h1]

Perhaps the developers are going for an edutainment angle with this title. They do repeatedly mention  the maticulous care spent on getting the game as "scientifically correct" as possible, even down to accurately reporoducing the landscape and ecosystem. As mentioed before, as a game, I mean something to do that's fun, this seems to have very little replayability, or playability for that matter.

[h1][u]PROS & CONS[/u][/h1]

Pros
[list]
[*] Runs well enough for an early access title.
[*] Fairly decent graphics, the animal models look nice, as does the foliage.
[*] Interesting concept.
[/list]

Cons
[list]
[*] Sluggish (sometimes plain unresponsive) controls.
[*] Seems to lack playability, there's not much to the game other than running about.
[*] The environment, although supposedly faithfully recreated, is kind of bland, lacks colour variety, basically a sea of green.
[*] The price point is quite high considering the content.
[/list]

[h1][u]CONCLUSION[/u][/h1]

Only having spent 20 minutes playing Saurian, it might be arguable that I lack time spent in the game to make a valid judgement of it. But having only played the game for 20 minutes, I feel like I've pretty much experienced everything Saurian has to offer.  For the price of $20, there's games on Steam that have far more to offer. Although, if you're a seriously die hard dino fan, you might find this title inexhaustably entertaining. I myself am a huge dinosaur fan, always have been since I was a very young child, but this game is lacking any real hook to keep you playing it. It seems to me it would become tedious and repetateive very quickly. It's certainly a neat concept, if not wholely unique or original, but that's just not enough to get it over the line for me. Overall, not really a rewarding or fun experience.

So, because of this, I can't really recommend it. Maybe if it was a sub $10 (like $7 at the most) game, I could, but for $20, I think the devs are grasping. I think I will be getting a refund.

author: {'steamid': '76561198558928017', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1632815411}
review:
아직 알파 버젼이라는 것을 감안한 평입니다.

장점 : 아름다운 고생물학적 고증

단점 : 컨텐츠 부족

확실히 백악기 헬크릭 지층을 구현하겠다는 제작진의 덕심이 그대로 반영되었습니다. 하지만 현재까지는 진짜 "공룡"처럼 먹고 자고 먹고 자고 하는 것 외에 딱히 할 수 있는게 없습니다.따라서 차후 컨텐츠 추가와 최적화가 어떻게 되냐에 따라 이 게임의 승부수가 가릴 것 같습니다. 물론 지금이라도 컴퓨터 사양이 좋으면서 최신고생물학에 부합한 공룡 시대를 체험해 보고 싶으신 분들에게는 이보다 더 좋은 게임은 없을겁니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024695553', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 550, 'last_played': 1561261645}
review:
So, you are probably wondering should I buy this game... Well i wouldn't if i was in your shoes, I read all the reviews and watched the trailers and thought "that looks cool". Well it would have been if even on the lowest quality settings i wasn't getting like 6 frames per minute. I never even got a chance to test the actual game play. Maybe if I had i would like it but I cannot recommend it in its current state. I will update as development continues.

Update jan 2018: the update over the holidays seemed to have fixed my issue with single digit frame rates per minute. However i would still recomend waiting for more. I have not found the little time I have played un enjoyable but it is lacking many things. As can be expected by early release. However the developers have made regular updates and im hopeful that continues.

Update (late 2019): it is slightly better as i have upgraded my PC, i now have 32gb of ram and a Nvdia 1080. Sadly my frames still top out around 40 with drops and stutters constantly down to the single digits and i havent noticed any real changes since i first played it.... i mean you can climb trees now. i will change my review again if it gets better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198184064631', 'num_games_owned': 140, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1502519140}
review:
I found this game to be absolutely delightful to play.  It isn't far along in it's stage of development so currently you are only able to play as a Dakotaraptor, however; even with the one option it shows for a ton of potential.  I felt like the environments and the way that the current array of dinosaurs interacted were pretty well done.  You can run into T-rex's battling over one another, or other creatures.  I also recently learned from someone that this takes place in Hell Creek formation during the Cretaceous period. Just the idea that paleontologists had a hand in making this game makes it that much cooler to me.  The game has a ton of potential and I look forward to seeing where it leads.  Glad to be a part of this games evolution...lol no?

You can see my reactions to the game down below and how smart I am not haha.

https://youtu.be/i8dMq5mrhj4

author: {'steamid': '76561198288494455', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 765, 'last_played': 1620503081}
review: I have been playing Saurian for a few days, and i am enjoying it more than i thought i would. author: {'steamid': '76561198383292673', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1598728249}
review: This game is very good. While it doesn't offer endless fun at the stage it's at, while you do play it it is very fun. Great graphics and the accuracy is brilliant. Visually stunning, it makes up for the bugs that are to be expected at this stage. Additionally, it does have limited gameplay but only in the sense that upon reaching a certain stage there is no reason to progress and the game can get a bit repetitive after that. Until that point, it is a very good and well-rounded game, especially for an EA game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198257552336', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1738, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 19, 'playtime_at_review': 436, 'last_played': 1712206423}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197977071031', 'num_games_owned': 166, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1619293998}
review:
Reviewed at 6th of August 2017, Immediately after Early access release. (Will update as necessary.) I was a kickstarter backer for this game.

Positive recommendation based on understanding these pointers:
1. Only buy the game if you are into experiencing the long term route of seeing how it develops! As of right now, there isn't that much content to experience, the game is very bare bones as well as has a lot of glitches and roughness. I am on a very high end PC and am experiencing occasional performance issues. Lower end machines will likely struggle.

2. The game is dependent on simulation of life gathered from currently known scientific fact and as such relies heavily on a "make your own adventure" style gameplay experience. A lot of it's charm comes from as accurately as possible depicted dinosaurs.

If you're not into the abovementioned thematics, or want a more finished product, this might not be a game for you right now. Wait until it's further into development. That being said, if you're a hardcore dinosaur fan, you'll probably have a good time.

Now that's out of the way, here are some of my opinions:
The game is very atmospheric, you feel constantly on your guard which gives you a sense of belonging into the game world. Night time can even be a bit spooky, since it gets hard to spot any predator that's hunting you... And at first you also don't know all the things that are out there, so you're especially wary. Immersion is already rather good! I think going forward the game needs to push this angle to keep a grip on the player.

That being said, one thing that breaks the immersion are the way the controls respond as of right now. They're not terrible by any means, but very rough in some spots. You don't always feel in tune with your character, and especially at times some input may lag or not register at all and you're not sure why it happens. Did I do something wrong as a player, or did the game just buckle. These are minor complaints all in all, but do erode the immersion aspect of the game ever so slightly, when at times you feel like you're struggling to get your character to do what you need it to do. Some more fluidity and responsiveness would go a long way.

My other bigger issue with the game right now is the map. Meanwhile it's not terrible, it doesn't particularly stand out in any spots either. There doesn't feel to be much to see, which in turn doesn't make you feel like exploring. I understand the importance of keeping it close to real life simulation to hold true to the game's intent, but looking around, life has a lot of variety. I hope going forward the developers will add a bit more character to the environment. Some more distinct landmarks, small streams, boulder formations strewn around and that kind of thing...  I'm not sure if I'm expressing my thoughts on this matter very well, but let me summarize by saying that the world needs to feel a bit more full and alive.

The feature for using scent to hunt is currently a bit underwhelming and I find myself playing mostly without it, relying more on watching my character's head movements and listening for skittering sounds. Both of which, are actually very neat ways of incorporating your senses into gameplay.

Saurian is definitely worth your try if you're open minded towards experimental games and don't mind it if things aren't running smoothly straight away. The models for the animals are very beautiful as are their animations, so I got myself a bunch of good time from just admiring those. Saurian is trying to make an educational piece in a way that has quality as well as entertainment incorporated, and for these reasons alone it already deserves praise.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154235465', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 593, 'last_played': 1686517129}
review:
Edit: You should not buy this game! I bought this game on kickstarter, They had the objective of having the game release in 2 years if they were able to achieve the amount of money needed. They not only achieved that, they got more, which would be used for 2 more playable dinosaurs and a multiplayer function. Both things to be added to the game after the release. 3 years have passed, the game looks pretty much the same. Have little more AI than the last time, but still no growth stages for them. No big changes to dinosaur behaviour neither, just a few. The game is close to be abandoned. The devlogs are a joke. Still only one playable dinosaur. They probably already wasted the kickstarter money so, take your own conclusions about the likely future of the game. I wish i am wrong. I am really sad making this review, cuz i was really hyped for this game and it was a game with caracteristics i was looking for a long time.



Previous Review:
Ok so this is my first review on a game, which shows how much i expect of this game!

Ok so to start until one day ago i was definetly gonna make a bad a review of the game, but the 1st patch made me change my mind. Even though there are a lot of things that i will point out, that in my opinion still makes this game not worth the money it costs right now or really need work on.

Even if it this only in Early Access the game lacks to much content, The devs before the realease kept saying that you would have a full experience as a dakotaraptor on the EA. This is not quite what happens in the game. For now Dakotaraptor is the only dinosaur that is playable, so you spawn as an hatchling and grow to adult. The problem here is that you still dont have much AI. So after u played a couple of hours, you experience all that the game as to offer so far. Now why dont you have the full experience? because the lack of AI, and because the AI needs some work done. 90% of the times your parents die, so you are on your own from the start. So you need food. Or you hunt or you scavenge. But with the lack of AI food dead bodies are rare and the only living creature you can hunt as an hatchling is the lizard, which are terribbly hard to see in the game bbecause of the foliage. We definetly neeed more AI, not only more dinossaurs but more diferent ages of dinossaurs like hatclings.


Now about the visuals, graphics and sound. There were some problems in this part of the game, but this is all expected in EA games, and the devs were fast to fix the max things they could.

Visuals are great, but need a bit of otimizations as fps drop quite a few times with no reasons for it to happen.
Sound is amazing too, gives the right feeling when playing the game.

So after all this should you buy the game? Definetly, but maybbe just not right now. We need more AI to make the game worth the money, as right now it has not much content to offer as u experience everything too fast...


I love the game and i am expecting great things from it! i hope we get more content soon enough!

author: {'steamid': '76561198379413972', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1545521956}

author: {'steamid': '76561198052178720', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1599172243}
review:
I should mention that I backed the kickstarter for this, so I've been on board with the concept for quite a while now.

The game may not have much to it right now, but the attention to detail with the animation, the visuals, and the sound design is simply amazing. It paints a great picutre for what lies ahead for the game, which still has a long way to go, but if you're a fan of dinosaurs as the animals they really were, this is a game to keep an eye on! (And buy it if you really feel like supporting the devs!)

It's just the Dakotaraptor life cycle right now, and it's pretty straight forward hunt-drink-don't get eaten, but the polish shows even in the pre-alpha state. Like I said, worth a try if you have enthusiasm for the idea Saurian stands behind!

author: {'steamid': '76561198202841334', 'num_games_owned': 78, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 5759, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 837, 'last_played': 1656464343}
review: Because it's in Early Access, there isn't a large amount of depth to the game just yet. While there are some bugs, the devs do listen and respond quickly, and I'm pleased with how the patch fixed some of the major game breaking bugs for me. If you love dinosaurs, I'd give it a definite recommend! However, if you're looking for a complete survival game with a lot of content, I would hold off a couple of months until more content is released.

review:
Also wenn das 3 Jahre entwicklungsfortschritt sein sollen dann tut es mir leid. 
- keine Grafikfeineinstellung
-Massive FPS freezes
-Kamarasteuerung des Grauens auch wenn man die Senibilität komplett runter stellt
  
Fazit: Noch keine Kaufempfelung

Review vom 30.07 2020:

Nach 3 Jahren habe ich mir mal gedacht naja schaust mal rein da hat sich doch bestimmt was getan mal... 

Fazit: Absolut keine Kaufempfelung!!!!!
Nach 3 Jahren hat sich 0 was getan nix rein garnix... ist gibt immer noch diesen einen Federvieh zu spielen wobei ich sagen Muss Federn haben da garnix zu suchen aber naja... 
Aber echt 0 .keine Entwicklung nix absolute leere! TRAURIG und mega ENTÄUSCHEND!
Da hat THE ISLE mehr auf den Kasten als dieses Game hier....

EDIT: 20.11.2020

Nach etlichen Jahren hat man mal ein Dino mehr zu spielen als den Dakotaraptor
Es kam der Triceratop.
Was mir gleich auffiel bzw erst jetzt ist warum zum Teufel Bewegen sich die Triceratops als wenn sie auf eine Ninjaschule in der Kanto Region waren???
Leute dieses Tier Wog weit mehr als 5 Tonnen da kann es doch nicht sein das sie Laufen wie auf Federn... 
An sich Spielt sich der Triceratop fast gleich wie der Raptor nur das es halt der gegenspieler halt ist.. Es kann recht schnell öde werden da man nur rumläuft und Frisst frisst frisst aber da muss man drüber weg sehen denn das war das Leben eines Pflanzenfressers 90% Fressen 5% Schlafen 5% Trinken.
An sich hat sich aber sonst nix weiter geändert bzw nix besonderes, die Herden Laufen immer noch von Punkt A zu B und von B zurück zu A 
Mir persönlich fehlt einfach absolut das feeling wie man es bei The Isle bekommt...
Zum anderen ist mir noch aufgefallen warum zum henker hat ein Adult Trike Hörner die nach unten gebogen sind? Müssten die nicht genau anders rum gebogen sein? 
Weil es gab auch eine etwas kleinere Art mit herrunter gebogenen Hörnern.

Fazit: Immer noch keine Kaufempfehlung meiner seits aus da ich sehr stark befürchte das das nächste größere update weitere 3 Jahre dauern wird.. wenn überhaupt noch ein kommen sollte.
An diesen Spiel muss noch ne ganze menge passieren und in schnelleren Abständen langsam wenn es überhaupt noch was werden will.

EDIT: 24.05.2022 

Passiert eig im Spiel noch was? Ich sehe seit 2 Jahren so gut wie keine Verbesserungen...  Was soll so ein mist? Sorry das Game ist wohl Tot.. Eh da was Passiert, sind 20 Jahre wohl vorbei... 
Schade hatte dieses Game eig noch ne Chance gegeben, aber es passiert rein nix.. Game technisch, Grafisch ect... NIX

author: {'steamid': '76561198166827219', 'num_games_owned': 132, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1515713075}
review:
Let me start off by saying that I love this game. I love what the developers are trying to accomplish. I was a KickStarter supporter. And I say with certainty that this game will improve--and when it does, I will be excited to change my review to positive. So why is it negative right now?

"Early Access" is something that far too many developers abuse, and far too many players use as an excuse for poor content. "You can't judge it now because it's in early access," is invalid. When a game launches to Early Access, the whole point of it is to criticize it. You can't really judge a game that is in pre-alpha stages, because there is a lot to do, and it is in a closed group of testers / developers. But Early Access is meant for games that have left that stage and are ready for the public. Saurian is not ready for the public to take part. It is clearly in a pre-alpha state, but launched in Early Access regardless. This is what makes it tough to judge. You can't really say much because it is so underdeveloped, but on the other hand, it has fully launched for the public to play. So I'm left with judging the actual decision of bringing Saurian live.

Saurian has many issues. From piss poor optimization (30-50 fps + big stutters on a GTX 1070--which is well above recommended specs) to a massive amount of gamebreaking or simply obnoxious bugs. There is also a great lack of content and pretty mediocre AI. Obviously, most Early Access games will have similar types of issues, just not to this extent. There are certain expectations that Early Access games should live up to--it's not really meant to be a dumping ground for demos. Saurian is not ready for Steam, and certainly not the $20 price tag.

I suggest waiting until massive improvements are made. I believe that I will get the opportunity to change my review, and I look forward to that day. But it is not today.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071200067', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 534, 'last_played': 1641267943}
review:
I backed this Kickstarter when it was announced, even got the Art book but for what they promised, the devs sure as hell did not deliver. It is almost 3 years and still we only have one Playable dinosaur, alot of the other goals are not even close to done. 

Monthly updates on their dev blog merely show some fan art and plant models like we need more of those. This game roughly gained some steam around the time Mesozoica, isle and a bunch of other indie dino games caught on before Jurassic Evolution came out. Needless to say all of those games have failed as early access. 

Don't buy into those fanboy reviews. The developers aren't working hard enough. How can you say that you are trying when the game is still so bare after so long. Heck it still isn't optimised and people are hoping for a second playable? I'd reckon it will take them 4 more years to finish it and by then this half ass game will go into the gutter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025169823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1502033812}

The only real issue I'm having is the mouse/camera combo are really really sensitive (my first few babies would spin in circles while I figured it all out) and I can't figure out how/if I can reduce that a bit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110460054', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1607445399}
review:
실행 전에 다음과 같은 점을 명심하세요.
난 이 생태계의 밑바닥이다. 깝치지 말자.
처음 시작하면 먹을 수 있는 건 내 형제나 도마뱀입니다.
다른 건 뭐든지 날 한방에 물어죽입니다. 

여기서 할 건 먹고 살아남는 건데...
먹이 찾기는 힘들어, 속도는 느려터졌어,
부모는 나버리고 훌훌 떠나,
아무래도 제작진이 첫 공룡을 좀 잘못 고르지 않았나 싶습니다. 
사우리안에 애정이 있지 않는 이상 추천하긴 좀 그래요.

저야 재밌게 플레이했지만 티라노 같은걸 기대하신분은 많이 실망하실것 같네요.
찢고 죽인다!를 기대했는데 내가 찢어지고 죽으면 좀 그렇겠지요.
빠른 업데이트로 보완되길 기대합니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021398461', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1603066367}
review: This is a game best played for short bursts at a time. Do not expect something like Ark or the Isle as the point of this game is realism. This means that your objectives are survival. I absolutely love moving around through hell creek and observing and interacting with the fauna. I backed this game years ago and give it my full support even now for its accuracy. This is currently the most accurate dinosaur game in existence and it shows. I look forward to the other 5 playable species being added as well as the other NPCs of hell creek such as Anatosaurus and Thescelosaurus etc. This game is fun and I still play for hours on end even as an adult stage Dakotaraptor. The developers have been honest about the long timeline it will take for the game to be complete and I'm fine with it, I'll just keep hunting in the brush and avoiding rexes for now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078447500', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1606028036}
review:
WILL REVISE REVIEW IF/WHEN GAME IS WORKED ON
YES I KNOW IT'S EARLY ACCESS
GOT THIS GAME AS A GIFT 
UPDATED ON 15 AUGUST

That outta the way, lets get to why I can't recommend this game in the current state.
I mean, it works. You can age and survive just well in the current game (my game time of 3.3 hours shows how long I needed to get from baby to adult. This is plus/minus a few, since I died a lot and tried things out) but that's about it. It gets fairly boring after a while, due to bugs and currently boring environments/gameplay. 

Just to name a few current issues:
-The Juvenile Dakota has model issues with false weightpaint, the hatchling looks very messy and has almost no details
-Hunting is hard due to jumping delay and the pounce being hard to control. 

My biggest issue though, is with the accuracy thing that this game's aiming for. I am sure that these guys put in all their effort to study scientific accuracy of dinos, plants and environment of Hell Creek and have implemented the basics of that in this game.
However, I am told that Dakotaraptors are bad parents right at the start, having the two supposed parents walking off from me and my sibling to handle their own duties.  (Most birds of prey actually share tighter bonds, but I do not know if this applies to Dakota raptor parents also, so I will give them that.)
I get that we start in an age stage where hunting becomes a thing for us so that it doesn't start boring and I do not expect to literally be fed lizards to survive either... however, since birds and our fluffy Dakotaraptors are related, I think that they might share some traits with current day birds as well, given that evolution picks and chooses traits that ensure survival and reproduction... and that most birds of prey will take care of their young, until they are almost teens or even adults themselves, meaning that this is probably a favorable trait to keep. I may be wrong, but I also do not think that parents will turn on their own fledglings if they don't run away fast enough as hatchlings. To me, that's just not.. well... accurate. 
Of course it's hard to determine how an extinct animal actually behaved, but it feels more like an attempt to get out of actually programming in AI that cares for you or acts as if it wants to teach you how to hunt. Future updates will tell if this is true or not, since there are still five more dinosaurs to be presented that might have caring parents.

The stamina issue has been also discussed in the forums, but from what I read, Dakotaraptors were big, but lightweight predators made for sprints or general fast traversing. If the argument is that "sprinting" means "A small stamina bar" I can understand that. But let us take an animal made for sprinting: The Cheetah. This may sound extreme at first, but this is an animal with top speed and little stamina, meaning it is the highest extreme in the "top speed" = "low stamina" issue. Even an animal that powers itself out with an up to 110km/h sprint, can run between 300-500 meters whilst sprinting.
This should give the Dakotaraptor, who is made for far smaller speeds, have a bit more than the current ~100 meters maximum to run.
And it is also said the Dakotaraptor was most likely an ambush predator. If so and this is the reason the stamina is so low, then give it a way to actually ambush. There is no way to sneak up on prey, no way to make sure it does not see you, be it watching the direction of the wind to hide your scent, rolling in things to hide your scent or even just to crouch and wait for prey to stroll your way.

I adore that scientific accuracy is being taken into this game, but it doesn't feel like it at the moment, because too many things appear to just not be thought of in the long run. If and how this ends up later on the development, I can not say and I will gladly wait it out, because I do have my hopes that this game WILL turn out good.

As mentioned before, once these changes do occur, I will change my review to reflect this accourdingly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015384074', 'num_games_owned': 637, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 464, 'last_played': 1686959269}
review: Look, i'm gonna start out by saying that this game lacks a bit of polish at the moment, as is expected of Early Access. There are some bugs, there are some framerate issues. The usual. The reason i'm recommending it is because it already satisfies my dino sim itch better than anything else I've played. Some people claim there isn't really anything to do right now. They aren't wrong. But the game isn't about doing anything but being a dinosaur in an environment that's as realistic as possible. The game largely provides that already. If you're looking for a game that tries to be more accurate than others and simply allows you to be a dinosaur, this is it. The only question is when. For some folks, like myself, i'm good with it now. Others who want more polish and finalization, you'll want to give it a bit more time. But this is definitely the game we were promised, or at least is going to be. People like to criticize the devs for not being further along after the time and money put in, but i've worked in game development and I understand how difficult it can be. They're on the right track. If you're a dino fan this is not a game to miss.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015009553', 'num_games_owned': 300, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1501917827}
review:
ラプトルの赤ちゃんとして生き延びて成長していくゲーム。
成長すれば体も大きくなり大きな獲物も狩れるようになる、、のか？

コンセプトは良いがとりあえず狩れる獲物がほとんど居なくてゲームとして成り立っていない。
唯一狩れるはトカゲのみ。成長してもトカゲのみ。
草食恐竜のパキケファロサウルスでさえ異様な強さで、鼻先に触れるだけで何のリアクションもなしに即死する。
自機であるラプトル君だけが以上に脆いのかもしれないが、パキケファロサウルスが水辺てワニ数体を皆殺しにしていたり、
トリケラが2秒でレックスを殺しているあたり、たぶんこの世界の草食恐竜は強力な毒を持っている。

何度も言うがとりあえずゲームとして成り立っていない。
最序盤はトカゲで食いつなぐというのはまぁ自然な流れだが、成長すると足が遅くなりそれすら困難に。この時点で自力で狩れる獲物が同じラプトルのみになるので、兄弟を探して食べるゲームに。
もしくは草食恐竜について行って返り討ちにあった肉食恐竜の死体を漁る・・・。
肉食恐竜ってなんだっけ？

とまぁ草食恐竜が無双している様な書き方をしたが、実際のところ、そもそも恐竜が全然居ないのでお互いの接触すら凄く稀なこと。
ただただ草食恐竜の隣でボケーっとしているだけになる。

だが心配無い。
そもそも満腹ゲージに何の意味もないので餓死したりはしない。
一切何も食べなくても成長できる。
ただボケーっとして成長するのを待とう。


近年そこそこ遊べるEAゲームばかりになってきているが、そもそもEAってこういうものだったのかな？と考えさせてくれるゲーム。
にしても公開が早くないかね？
正直、直さなきゃいけない所だらけでフィードバックするまでもない。

2000円払って全然完成していない進捗を確認したい人だけどうぞ。
楽しみたい人は一年くらい早い。

author: {'steamid': '76561197961913635', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 604, 'last_played': 1633187665}
review:
I have been excited for this for awhile. While at the moment. Saurian is just tech demo basically. It looks far better then ark survival and Dino's do look more realistic, but there is a lot that still needs to be worked on and added to the game before you can really judge this.  With over 3,200+ hrs in ark survival and my own server. I can this is already looking and running better then ark.  There is a lot bugs and issues current with saurian and is no where near what the finished product will be like.  I hope they add better AI and Dino's act more real. Roars for passive and aggressive,  hopeful also have proper herds and what not. Breeding, raising your young and maybe some kinda level system, as start as child and grow to mature adult. 
Generally, it runs not to bad on my i7 3770k 3.5 GHz, 16 GB ram, SDD, GTX 980ti Sc at max settings for 1080p/60+ fps on window 7 64bit.  So far I'm very impressed, there are some performance issue, but not too bad. but as stands now. 
It's just tech demo.  Wait 6-8 month and then we'll see where it is and how much they added.  For now I'd say hold off.  But if you enjoy anything with Dino's,  I'd say get it now and wait for get better.   
My openly complain is the map is kinda blah,  few ponds and big open map with nothing to see, trees and shrubs. They look decent.  But the map is lacking verity ATM. Need wind, storms, land marks. Different region, 
One thing ark does have is way better map, at least on center map.  Hopefully it get better,  
Will update this when more stuff is added after year or so.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998554282', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 916, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 533, 'last_played': 1640059151}

author: {'steamid': '76561198026497155', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1507785181}
review:
Saurian was the first Kickstarter I ever backed, andI don't at all regret backing this game or supporting the crew who worked on it - however, in its current state, I don't reccomend this game very highly.

The game isn't very well optimized, which, at this early stage, is understandable yet still gets a negative mark from me. More than once a game has loaded in the background quite a while before it's able to be played, and once the loading screen was gone I was greeted with a 'game over' screen because I was killed before I could even play. The game is surprisingly lacking visually, with shadows that are harsh, bizzarely pure black and jpeg-esque (my graphical settings are currently on the second highest setting, and it looked the same on the highest). Trying to hunt the tiny lizards, the only thing that won't try to kill you back, is sort of a gamble when you get frame drops and lose your prey in the flat black underbrush. 

Speaking of prey...It feels weird to say, but the game feels oddly balanced? The Dakotaraptor dies if it gets caught up in a stiff breeze. Not just as a young stage, either. On my most successful run so far, my parents teamed up on and were both 
 one-shot by some jerk crocodile that walked away unscathed. I mean, I got a free meal out of it, so it wasn't all bad, but it was kind of eye-opening as to how weak the 'raptor is even as an adult.

Just all around, it's not too terribly fun to play at the moment. Watching the dinosaurs go about their business is very cool, though. I found myself spending a while creeping after a t. Rex hoping to steal some of its leftovers when I saw it stalking prey, only to be disappointed when it swallowed its meal whole. I saw another sort of raptor bully a Pachy without actually trying to attack it. I nipped at a Triceratops' ankles and booked it, watching over my shoulder as it chased me down. There is so much potential for when more playable dinos are added that I can't help but be exited about it. 

I will be watching this game closely for updates just as I had before it was released onto Steam, but at the moment find myself more frustrated than entertained when playing it. I will most definitely change this review to reflect my opinion as the game changes and continues to update along the way. I very dearly hope that it's not too long before I can change my reccomendation to a yes!

author: {'steamid': '76561198081029277', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 396, 'last_played': 1693308366}
review:
First of all, I'm going to start off by telling you to keep track of the game's progress and see how it goes. It does have promising prospects, but it is by no means ready to be sold yet.
Second of all, I have an awful PC which will affect my experience immensely.

Now, Saurian is a game I've been looking forward to. So, naturally, I needed it. I'm going to tell you how my first tries with the game went.

I got in, everything lagged to hell and back. Not only that, but the looking around with the mouse was hell. Okay, into the menu, go reduce camera sensitity. Weirdly, the menu when playing lags just as bad as the game itself. Never really had that before. Strange. I manage to return to game and actually start moving around. Moving around feels weird and clunky. I don't mind having to slow down after you build up momentum, but I have to build UP walking momentum?
 I'm not a vehicle. My first step should be just as good as all my steps afterwards. Nevermind. I could move, albeit sluggishly. I look at my family. Too bad on my first attempt mama, papa and my two siblings were frozen. Immediate restart. 

Okay! They move now! Very, very slowly. Even slower than me at walking pace. I have a feeling this was my PC chugging because they practically walked on the spot. I decided I'd abandon mother and explore. She was getting nowhere and I needed a drink and something to eat. After fighting with the camera to settle it in the direction I wanted to go and successfully having just a drink, it was dark. I couldn't find my way back to mama. I figured sniffing might show her, but no. Oh well. It was too dark for me to make anything out anyway. I slept. When I woke, mama and the family was entirely gone. Well, shit. I was also on the verge of starving. Well, double shit. I could see a pachy, but I was a fucking smol bean. I wasn't about to eat that. Another small raptor wandered up beside me. It looked flashy. Very snazzy. It was also chill. Well, there was my best bet at food, so I bit it. I died. Restart.

Well, now we were parked by the water's edge. Everyone was moving slower than before. No biggie. It'd be fine, I'd stay by mama this time. Mama went to the water. Mama got in the water. Mama abandoned the AI children who couldn't keep up. Nevermind them, I can swim! And holy shit, mama moves at a decent pace in the water! Not as slow as on land. Fantastic. I followed mama. We had a great time swimming together until mama remembered she was mentally retarded and began swimming in circles through a mangrove tree or whatever was growing in the water. I stared. I hoped I didn't have whatever she had. I quit. 

Fin.

I do very much hope that the game recieves plenty of optimisation and that the AI can actually become intelligent. But, for the moment, it simply isn't that way.

-------
Edit:

After messing around with the game a little more the game finally decided to run a little more smoothly. I can now play, albeit in a very jerky mannner and I can't enter an area with too many trees. But I can play. 

So, with that said.

The game is still slow to run, understandably on my PC. something confusing was that any stage below adult tended to have steps that slipped into one another, whereas the adult didn't and moved at a more bearable walkspeed.
In terms of food, it's hit and miss. Sometimes you can be in an area with plenty of food about and be just fine and other times you're going to starve. You're best bet is to find some water source and wait for something to come to you. As a baby dakotaraptor you're absolute best bet is to stick with your siblings and cannibalise them. So be thankful you have some siblings because you're parents are probably going to get themselves killed very quickly. The AI absolutely sucks and is by far the thing that needs the most work in this game.
Other than your siblings, you'll struggle to find food because lizards are almost impossible to catch Everything else will kill you immediately and your parents are long gone. You can always eat their corpses. Except, you can't because they've probably already disappeared. Corpses don't hang around very long and you don't know when they're going to disappear because they don't have decomosition/eaten stages.
But other than that, the models are fine, the map is fine, eating and drinking is easy to do, the game forces you to be very weary for better of for worse, which I don't personally mind and it's doing okay. There's definitely worse pre-alphas out there. Don't get me wrong, don't buy it unless your intention is to support the devs more. It's not something that should be sold at the price it is yet, especially after the amazing kickstarter it had.

Onto the other bad points as it stands.
- Glitches. It's in pre-alpha release so expect these around every corner.
- You're dead if anything hits you at dakotaraptor juv/sub-adult stage. It's basically impossible to hunt herbivores with my kind of performance until adult stage. You have to rely on killing other dakotaraptors or whatever the other little raptor is or scavenging if you happen to find  some tasty corpses.
- The stats drain so fast. I think they might've slowed the food down at least since there was an update released. I'm actually pretty happy with hunger now, it's more thirst now. I can't really explore much because I have to keep running up hills then down to a water source then up and down and up and that is very tedious.
- Progression is rather fast. I wouldn't be opposed to slowing progression down just a bit more. I'm thankful that it isn't painfully slow (because the game only plays when you're on it and you don't progress when sleeping. You must play it.) but it could do with coming down a notch.

- The AI is entirely braindead. I can't say anything positive for the AI simply because it's just so basic and slow to do even basic things. I'm expecting them to add and work on the AI because it really is what is going to make the game work in the long run given how many bots there are. But as it stands, everything moves downhill to a water source and swims about in it in circles until some croc comes and eats it. If you bite something, it attacks you, might chase you for a second, then forgets you ever existed. Nothing runs away despite there being a threat in the area. Most things just tend to walk up to a trex and die if one hapens to be there. Trexes will immediately fight  upon seeing eachother as well - I assume thing might change later down the line to have a bit more of a roaring contest go on before a fight breaks out to see if things can be settled peacefully. In terms of drinking, things manage but then they tend to step into the water and go into their circle of death for some reason. In terms of eating they half-manage. On the rare occasion you see something take a bite it'll probably be fien, but occasionally they'll jsut sit and stare. In general, the AI just isn't any fun and is just about functioning. It isn't a nice experience to play with an AI that's just so unaware of everything around it though. Each bot goes about its own little life with no interaction with anything else except food, water and maybe you.

So, all in all, no. I can't recommend it as a game. It is good for something that isn't even an alpha and it functions, eventually. But it's not worth the pricetag and if you buy it, really only consider it something to support the devs with.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083208023', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1372, 'last_played': 1620462542}
review: Saurian is one of the best dinosaur game to date, and one of the most scientififically accurate. But in this Alpha-stage,I can't really recommend this game. The frame rate often drops randomly and the A.I. for the NPC animals are still buggy.  I recommend to wait for another year or two, when all the playable dinos are available.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138606608', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 711, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1552942069}
review:
This game has great pontential. Keep in mind, this review was written few days after Saurian's early access release.

Pros:

+Dinosaurs look stunning, and so does the plants, and whole map. Lots of research has gone into designing them.
+Sound-design is very good. It captures well the prehistoric era (or atleast how we think it sounded back then).
+Controlling dinosaur has always been the clumsy side of this genre. Being able to turn it around while standing still is very useful.
+I think time it takes to age is ok, not too long, not too short.
+It's relaxing to play offline dinosaurgame for change.
+dinosaurs have feathers.

It's really hard to say anything about cons at this point. Ofcourse there is bugs, lag spikes and crashes, but they aren't anything that uncommon in Early Access games.

Overall, if the game seems interesting, I warmly recommend it, if you don't mind it being in early access.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056388702', 'num_games_owned': 205, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1602515623}
review: It's better than The Isle, PCE and The Archotek Project.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163906380', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1501853715}
review:
I have been waiting for this game since it was first announced. I was so excited for it to come out. But this game is unplayable.
I know my computer isn't the most reliable in the world, but it has worked pretty well and was able to handle other games such as the Isle, but this game is the bane of my computer. Even on the lowest graphic settings, it's unplayable. Even when I made the resolution as low as possible, it still unplayable. It doesn't even reach 3 fps. The camera sensitivity is absurdly high, the slightest nudge to my mouse and the camera flies into the ground. The camera blur is sickenly high, and even when the game eventually loads, with the gameplay sounds playing in the background, even when your little dinosaur loads and you can play it, the screen takes an extra 10 minutes just to get rid of the loading screen. And when the game crashes, it crashes HARD. It's crashed twice, and both times nearly broke my computer. The screen would go completely blue (not quite the bluescreenofdeath blue, but unsettling nonetheless) and I would have to manually turn it off and on again by holding down the off button until it makes a disturbingly loud click sound. And the delay in the gameplay is atrocious. And I know I can't speak for everyone on these issues, but they have made this game a nightmare to play.
The graphics may be beautiful, but when the issues are that bad, there's not really any defense.
I had such high hopes, but until this game is fixed, I cannot recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198367556697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 646, 'last_played': 1635460744}

author: {'steamid': '76561198335311406', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1693, 'last_played': 1535832909}
review:
Visto che non c'è ancora una recensione italiana tocca a me rimediare!
Gioco che consiglio solo ad appassionati di dinosauri estremamente pazienti con gli early access perché questo è quello che il gioco offrirà col tempo:
- 6 dinosauri giocabili, ognuno con i suoi stadi di crescita e caratteristiche.
- Moltissime specie AI ad arricchire l'ambiente ( e il vostro stomaco ).
- Ambiente di gioco molto accurato; tutte le piante e animali presenti sono realmente esistiti nella Hell Creek.
- Personalizzazione del proprio dinosauro per colori e caratteristiche fisiche particolari.
- Modalità multigiocatore ( con inclusi AI ) che spero sia una carneficina e non un facciamo amicizia con gli erbivori.
- Modalità hardcore per quelli che amano le sfide, con AI più intelligente e in cui morire significa ricominciare dall'inizio.
- Un comparto grafico carino con anche una modalità vr ( in futuro eh ).

Questo è quello che offre attualmente......:
- 1 dinosauro giocabile e non molti animali AI, AI fra l'altro scadente, non ci sono interazioni interessanti da vedere fra gli animali in giro oltre a qualche combattimento buggato e decisamente non realistico, sembrano si comportino più robot con ordini precisi che animali.
- Necessaria una gtx1080 o simile per giocare, qualunque altra scheda meno potente ve lo regge a stento o così così, e francamente dopo averlo visto ad ultra non mi sembra che abbia chissà che graficone da richiedere una gtx 970 o più.
- Varie persone avevano pre-ordinato la versione Mac più di 1 anno fa, ma dopo quasi 1 anno dall'uscita su steam non si è ancora visto nulla, nè gli sviluppatori ne hanno parlato molto ( non che ci si potesse aspettare chissà cosa da un team del genere ).
- No multyplayer, no personalizzazione, no altro, rigiocabilità pari a 0.
- Sviluppatori troppo lenti con gli update e che hanno rilasciato il gioco troppo presto in uno stato pietoso, al punto che creò problemi ai pc della valve richiedendo 3 giorni per approvare il gioco su steam. Update che non arrivano mai prima di 2-3 mesi e aggiungono sempre pochi contenuti, o almeno non abbastanza da giustificare l'attesa. Ci vorranno anni e anni per completare SOLO lo sviluppo del gioco base, e probabilmente altrettanti per aggiungere il multigiocatore, il vr e altro, e siamo già a quasi 1 anno dalla sua uscita senza nessuna miglioria particolare, sembra quasi che perdano più tempo a fare minuscoli devlog ( più di 50 per l'esattezza ) che i contenuti del gioco stesso. I contenuti aggiunti fin'ora sono un pizzico di ottimizzazione, vari animali ai ( e meno male, l'animale nuovo che esce ad ogni update è l'unico motivo che mi spinge ancora ad avviarlo ), e varie altre cose abbastanza inutili.
- Ricordate quello che ho detto prima su update e ottimizzazione? Bene, perché l'ultimo update che ha richiesto 2 mesi e mezzo per essere preparato ha distrutto quel poco di ottimizzazione e sballato i livelli di forza degli animali. La situazione era così tragica che l'update è stato praticamente rimosso facendo tornare il gioco allo stadio precedente. Già di per se gli early access sono delle test version, ma dopo la rimozione dell'ultimo update è uscita una versione testing ( con in essa incluso l'ultimo update ) dove i giocatori devono aiutare i devs a trovare il bug che ha incasinato tutto. La test version della testa version, ridicolo. Dopo un mesetto e mezzo circa il problema del bug è stato risolto, per fortuna, ma l'ottimizzazione mi sembra ancora un po regredita rispetto a prima.

Il gioco ha davvero del potenziale e una bellissima idea dietro con un'incredibile cura del dettaglio, purtroppo distrutto da un team di sviluppatori troppo piccolo e decisamente incompetenti ( tranne un paio di loro ), e onestamente mi sembra un vero spreco che un progetto simile che ha raccolto più di 220.000 dollari su kickstarter sia gestito da questo team scadente, fra l'altro la fanbase di lecchini con i paraocchi incapaci di muovere anche la minima critica con la scusa dell'early-access non aiuta. Continuerò a modificare la mia recensione durante ogni update sperando di poterla cambiare in positiva, ma se fra qualche anno la trovate ancora negativa cercate altro.

Voto idea di base del gioco: 10/10
Voto sviluppo: 0/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198313323966', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 626, 'last_played': 1577016428}
review:
Игра неплохая , интересная , сложная и увлекательная . НО присутствуют баги , лаги , краши . Надеюсь это всё исправимо . 
  Играя за взрослого дакотараптора , шкала пищи доходит лишь до середины . Что бы ты не ел , она стоит неподвижно , без намёков на увелечение . Думаю , придётся начинать новую игру. Удачи разработчикам !

The game is not bad, interesting, difficult and exciting . But there are bugs, lags, crash . I hope this can be fixed . 
    Playing as an adult Dakota Raptor, the scale of food comes only to the middle . Whatever you're eating, it's standing still, no sign of magnification . I think we'll have to start a new game.
 Good luck to the developers !

author: {'steamid': '76561198160060076', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3030, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 607, 'last_played': 1697657091}
review:
At the time of this review there are a few glitches, for instance, sometimes you’ll spawn underneath the map, just reload in this case and sometimes your hunger will glitch out preventing it from ever falling. The dakotaraptor is slow to walk and you’ll be tempted to sprint as often as you can, fighting is a little clunky and naturally as it is in early access there’s a lot of content yet to be added. 

That said.

Pouncing, once you get the hang of it is super satisfying. (It’s harder to stay on depending on your prey’s health, e.g. a full health pachy will almost immediately shake off a sub-adult Dakota, no matter how hard you mash the right mouse button) once you’re an adult Dakota however you usually never have to fear it shaking you off unless you allow it to.
The world is very attractive and every creature is distinct and eye-catching, the triceratops in particular looks like an art piece.

Overall its challenging enough and very promising, especially as something so early in development.

But I do think it is gonna be a masterpiece when they add multiplayer and new dinosaurs to play. I would also like to choose time period to play. For example I choose Triassic period, then I should be playing in Triassic with Triassic creatures or Permian ect. That would be awesome. (Also don't trust your parents. They will eat you if you go with them)
