author: {'steamid': '76561198068336219', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 630, 'last_played': 1656907973}
review:
After a few hours of playing i think im ready to review. I have to admit i have a hard bias towards this game in some regards as i was a backer and contiously followed in it's development, i will always recommend that people support the game as it develops simply because the potential here is something users like me have been begging for in a game since we were kids.

The wait for this game has been long and daunting but the result was a decent demo of things to come but, let me get some of the negatives out of the way. *Note* half of the stuff im about to complain about aren't fair since most is subject to change.

*****Negatives That I Hope Are Fixed In Time*****

Optimization 

- Super early access, the demo (thats what it feels like) surely wasnt ready for release, when i heard Saurian was being made public finally after years of waiting i thought we were getting a gorgeous looking game thats somewhat smoothly optimized. But suffice it to say i was dissapointed, the transition between afternoon to night is a laggy nightmare and i ended up dying constantly during those time periods.

Graphics

- foliage textures,  this is mostly subjective but it is increasingly frustrating to see how plain everything looks, some of the larger trees look like rip offs of modern day trees under a "scientifically accurate" blanket. The trees have really poor textures even under ultra settings (There is no noticeable difference between two of the top graphical settings). You would not be able to distinguish a regular piece of foliage from the games own assets. Makes you feel like they wasted time working on their own when could have imported better looking assets from somewhere else. 

Gameplay 

- Ai in general,  first time i played the game, i spawned near a river where my parents rushed to their deaths by attacking a pachy on the other side. The parents Ai puts no emphaces on survival as every time i respawn, the parents will charge to their deaths and the baby dakota Ai will often just stay frozen in place, waiting for whatever wants to kill it. Prey Ai seems especially stupid, when i attack it, it will flinch then go on with its business like nothing happened, the only good Ai seems to be the timid lizards that always dissapear into the greenery.

- Controls, this aspect of the game ceartinly feels rushed, some default key bindings are awkwardly mapped and non existent on console controls. Theres also an issue where the altered key bindings are reset to their default everytime i close the game.

- Camera, seems like the most apparent issue is the fact that the camera seems to operate in fixed angles that are hard to get use to, ill often try to get a look at my dakotaraptor or try to change direction, only to have the camera bug out and swing wildly to some other angle, it's more forgiveable when playing with a controller. 

- Missing assets or features such as spectator mode, dino fight club, plant collision, climbing, turtles, marine life, turtles, other dinosaurs, and turtles.


*****Positives, Things I Hope Will Continue To Improve****


Graphics & Gameplay 
- Amazingly detailed dinosaur models.

- Beautifally animated dinosaur motions, clean, and clear sign of attention to detail.

- Incredibly engaging goal of survival while balancing curiousity, you truly feel like a baby dinosaur really experiencing the world for the first time, not knowing whether something will chase after you or is just curious. 

- Seeing what is supposed to be a "scientifically accurate" depiction of the climate millions of years ago does wonders for the experience in the educational front and has a potential to bring interest to many new kids in a brand new way of learning.

- Breath taking graphics during the early morning when shadows and hard light help bring more dimension to the animals and plants.

- Cool looking growth mechanic that is stage based but is applied in a way that almost seems seamless, you could just barely see the dakotaraptors hair colours change from brown to black, to white, it was like it was growing in real time. Movements and animations continued to compliment that aspect of the game. 

Overall Saurian is a remarkably fresh game that brings a great deal of satisfaction in its execution with downfalls that should be fixed as the game continues to progress. While the long wait seems unwarranted and somewhat weird seeing the current state of the game, it is somewhat forgiveable seeing the size of the team. I can only hope they continue to do the game the justice it deserves. Hopefully more competition sparks from the release of this game too.


Edit: 3 years later and no significant change, no new dinosaurs or really anything that improves the gameplay experience, do not buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981629056', 'num_games_owned': 322, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1563138707}
review: Had to eat my own dead parents to survive only to be trampled to death by prey animals in my sleep, 10/10 would eat again

author: {'steamid': '76561198213037825', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1644730938}
review:
I should have paid attention to the negative reviews.

From an "Alpha" or "Beta" standpoint, I understand that a lot of the content is in development.
That being said, it is a very beautiful game, however a lot of the details are still lacking.

During my playtime there were about five deaths, one resulting in my "momma" dino killing me, and then me running away to barely survive only to be starved out.

There is  a severe lack of prey animals to eat, let alone other carnivores.
The game lags so bad it crashed twice, which is why I am now writing a review; since I can't play the game.

There are also mesh errors, in the department of weighting.  After you reach stage two of your dino's life the leg rigging has a vertice that isn't weighted properly so when you walk it clips into itself.

There is so much more issues that I have with this game, but I hope it will be fixed once it has a few updates.

I wish everyone on the dev team the best of luck and to keep up the good work; hopefully this game will be playable; however until it can run more smoothly save your $20.00 and go play a finished game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086015561', 'num_games_owned': 122, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 3407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 732, 'last_played': 1701838582}
review:
Absolutely beautiful game.. While the AI is still in the works, and some animals aren't implimented yet- The game is just addicting and has so many areas to explore, you'll get sucked into this world and want to see it with your own eyes.  This game is the new king of dinosaur simulations.


EDIT: This review aged like milk, but the game is still good. Just horribly slow in development.

author: {'steamid': '76561198194612621', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 46, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1711483168}
review:
Включая режим Ванги, уже вижу, как школьники, позарившиеся на цену игры ("Азазаа, дешевле АРКа в 2 раза!!!111"), начинают ее люто хейтить. Благо, им есть за что. Нюанс только в том, что эта игра из разряда "только для ценителей". Т.е., если вы хотите побегать за "Т-рекса в HD", нагибать стаи трицератопсов и громко рычать на всю округу, стоя на вершине горы на закате - вам не сюда. А вот если вас всегда коробило от того, кого в "Парке Юрского периода" обозвали велоцираптором, а при упоминании формации Хелл-Крик, вы думаете "ну да, где-то я про нее читал", то вы по адресу.

О чем именно я говорю? Дело в том, что это даже не игра, а песочница, симулирующая жизнь одного, отдельно взятого куска местности в Позднемеловом периоде. Разработчики очень сильно заморочились и попытались воссоздать все, что известно о Хелл-Крик и его обитателях того времени. Вплоть до текстуры почв. Да. И само собой, здесь не будет людей и машин. Никогда.

А теперь более четко о плюсах и минусах игры на данный момент.

Плюсы:
-Разработчики, которые в режиме 24/7 ведут диалог с коммьюнити.
-Научная достоверность. Это удивительно, но она есть. Велоцираптор и тираннозавр тут имеют перья. А те куцые растения, что есть, пытаются соответствовать. 
-Аудиовизуальный стиль. Да, коряво. Да, не технологично. Но каким-то непостижимым образом это работает. 
-Звук отдельно. Он прекрасен.
-Анимация и внешний вид динозавров. Анимации не без багов, но смотрятся отлично.
-Приятная физика. (Инерция хвоста!)
-ИИ. Скрепя сердце отнес его к плюсам. Он багованный, явно недоработанный. Но он есть и работает на честную симуляцию жизни. И иногда все-таки умеет создавать шикарные ситуации.

Минусы:
-Освещение и тени. Ночь и текстуры в тени кошмарны. Тут спишь только чтобы не видеть этого ужаса. А ящериц ищешь подальше от деревьев потому что в тени их просто не видно. А тени движутся вслед за солнцем быстрее, чем я хожу.
-Странный баланс между потребностями в еде и воде. Очень быстрое обезвоживание. В итоге весь геймплей сводится к тому, чтобы ходить по песочку у реки и искать ящериц и трупы, оставленные пахицефалозавром. Об этом ниже.
-ИИ. Нет, у меня нет шизофрении. Просто отнести его однозначно к плюсам я не могу при всем желании. Потому что пахи - это Рэмбо под спидами, который атакует все, что шевелится, а что не шевелится - шевелит и атакует. А чтобы кого-то отогнать, его нужно убить.

В целом мне, как человеку, в детстве укушенному компсогнатом, играть интересно уже в преальфу. О потраченных 400 рублях не жалею. При условии, что разработчики не перегорят, будущее проекта вижу просто шикарным.

Игру рекомендую всем, кто любит динозавров в частности и животных вообще. И прошу ее не хейтить. Для этого есть другие проекты.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052078357', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1657174459}
review:
Wanted to pounce a Tyrannosaurus Rex
Saved the game
Ran behind the Tyrannosaurus Rex
Pounced the Tyrannosaurus Rex
Tyrannosaurus Rex shook me off
Tyrannosaurus Rex looked at me
I looked back
Tyrannosaurus Rex killed me

Loaded my save back in
Hear my Dakotaraptor get killed while the game is loading
Finally load in and see the Tyrannosaurus Rex eating me.


Lesson of the day, save the game when you are far away from a Tyrannosaurus Rex.

66 million/66 million would be stupid again.

Edit: They fixed this glitch just a few days after it happened. Talk about a responsive Developer team!

author: {'steamid': '76561198135959914', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 565, 'last_played': 1522972709}
review: I dont recommend buying this right now. There is an annoying lag spike every 15 to 20 seconds that makes me want to punch a wall. It screws me over when im in combat. The lag spikes have to be the main thing that kills the game. And I KNOW im not the only person suffering from it. Ive seen alot of youtuber's/friends mention the lag spikes so dont say i have a bad gaming PC or its an only me thing. If i were one of the developers I would fix this in the first or second update. And i know the game is in alpha so dont say ( Uh.. uh.. its in alpha.. uh.. you have to expect problems ) im telling people one of the main problems with the game right now. People dont want to spend their money on a game that has an annoying lag spike every 15 to 20 seconds. But when they fix this I will change the negative review into a positive review because this is one of the only problems with the game right now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029834215', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1501805261}
review:
I never review things here, since I tend to give opinions on my channel, but it's late and I've just finished recording from start to adult in about 4+ hours. I've an i7 8600 and GTX1080 for the record. The game runs fine (bar the odd lag spike) and only crashed a handful of times after becoming an adult.

My parents split and I think the dad got custody over one of my siblings, leaving Me and my brother (who I named Jon) to live with mum. She hunted us a pachy before going for a swim where she was eaten by a crocodile, leaving Me and Jon to fend for ourselves. We spent our young lives to the age of 4 or 5 along the river where mum was killed, food often came to us, and life was good. Until one very dark night... my brother scared the shit out of me, and got ate by mistake. Jon was dead. I cried. I was alone. I left the riverbank where my mother and brother had died, in search of new purpose and adventure...

That's where I left off. There isn't much of an end-game right now beyond exploring the environment and trying to hunt bigger prey for bragging rights. The AI needs a lot of work. The map has little incentive to leave your immediate area. You grow too fast and other dinos don't seem to grow at all, but these things can be put down to being in alpha; thus I hope we'll see gradual improvement. At 14.99£ this is an investment in a unfished product, make no mistake there, the game is not finished and your paying to be along for the ride. For the price of a takeaway? I'd say it's worth it. Jon's death haunts me. :'(

author: {'steamid': '76561198247358804', 'num_games_owned': 39, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1553556715}
review: I suppose it is time for me to give this game a review - now, don't get me wrong, I'm not the greatest at giving reviews and most likely won't make any sense but here it goes. I followed Saurian from day one. At first I thought it was just going to be another borin dinosaur game that won't get too far. But, to my surprise it seemed to be taking off with flying colors considering all the feedback and the dedication the team was; so, I decided to pledge 20 bucks for it. And as the months went by, my hype only became more until the day it released. Excited and hopeful, I downloaded right as I got the email. A few minutes into gameplay, I was in LOVE. The graphics, the music, the landscape was all to BEAUTIFUL. Fell in love with it. All that aside, of course the AI seem to be a bit buggy at times but all in all, the game is amazingly well bulit and can't want for more dinos and content to be released. Keep up the amazing job guys! 10/10 in my book!

author: {'steamid': '76561198161720096', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1622060219}

author: {'steamid': '76561198090956304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4083, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 432, 'last_played': 1685558812}
review: I definitely recommend this game, but only if you don't set your standards sky-high for the moment. Not gonna lie, it still needs a LOT of polishing. The AI system is buggy, you will likely get quite a bit of lag depending on how advanced your PC is, the game world is still largely empty, and you'll probably die a few times before you get the hang of survival (not helped by the fact that animals you can actually prey on as a hatchling are scarce). That said, it's an Early Access game for a reason and I can see the potential everywhere I look. The graphics are gorgeous even if the saturation is a bit off at times (particularly at night), the soundtrack is great, the animals look stunningly realistic even if their AI needs work, and the attention to detail and scientific accuracy are nothing short of amazing, and the game in general is still quite enjoyable if you keep your expectations relatively low. If it continues to get the attention and support it truly deserves, then I have no doubt that it will eventually grow into something incredible. So by all means, purchase this game and support its development, just keep the words "Early Access" in mind.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966679128', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1552964496}
review: Saurian in its current state is to say the least, not good. But of course this game is about DINOSAURS! So that alone is amazing, but that's as far as it goes. In my opinion, games this underdeveloped should not be approved on steam. I only say that, because atleast in this situation Saurian has a hefty price tag attached to it for such an underdeveloped game. Ive been following this game and helped to fund it on Kickstarter and I suppose this is what all kickstarter funders wanted, but WOW this is early development. So for the average joe who is looking for a game to play and enjoy, this is not the game for you. Not yet! There isn't much to see or do right now with only a handful of dinosaurs and wildlife. Honestly, its just plain boring. Don't get me wrong, I AM EXCITED about this game. But, I think I would have preferred to wait longer in order to enjoy a better developed game. So with that being said, this game is full of potential HOWEVER wait, it's not worth the current $20 price tag.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105101222', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 950, 'last_played': 1506423781}
review:
I highly recommend waiting before you purchase this game. I also want to point out that a lot of the hypey reviews were posted merely minutes after this game was put on store. Don't trust the hype.
The core content during this stage is eating, drinking, "hunting" and growing up as a small carnivorous raptor on single player. The 'secondary level' content is interacting with the animals in the world around you, and obversing them.

Eating is simple, even in the worst of times where there was nothing to scavenge a little lizard would scurry out of the bush and provide enough to keep me going for while. This was by far the most enjoyable part of the game especially when you're just a little youngling look for scraps. Overall though, once you eat, there is little to nothing left to do.

Drinking is a breeze. Despite the small amount of hazards in the marsh areas including aligators and extra foot traffic from all kinds of dinos... once you've drank you don't have too for a long period of time. So once it's done, just like with hunger, there is nothing to do except sit around and wait. Maybe roam.

Hunting is by far the worst aspect of this game at the moment, which is unforunate considering how much of a core element in plays in the games overall enjoyment. Apart from the small lizard, you can hunt almost anything you find. APPARENTLY. In my experience, the aligators were impossible to kill (and could kill you in one bite while out of water). Other creatures weren't only impossible to kill from time to time, but almost immediately killed ME with one bite. In other words, if the animals weren't outright immune to my damage, only some of the hits worked, and the ones that did dealt almost no damage... but for them, I was merely a one or two hit kill even while I was an adult. As an attempt at faining content, this game is constantly trying to kill you so you're forced to restart.

Growing up is enjoyable and right now genuinely the only thing 'to do' in this games current state. Although once you become an adult, there is little drive to play any more. All attempts at hunting will result in instant death or extremely buggy AI ruins the experience. I'd say only 1/6th of the dinosaurs in this world are opperating properly, and even then its only a short amount of time till they too end up bugging out. I also bring up AI because it affects the 'parenting system'. Which in of itself isn't actually a system at the moment. Rather, the adult AI just doesn't hunt you. In reality, you're just following a buggy AI trying to scrap up its kills for food or eat its body once it's died. There is no interaction, let alone actual 'system' in place for parenting at the moment. It's a thinly veiled way of making it seem like you have parents, when its in fact just AI you spawned next too, perhaps for early food.

All of that being said, the animal interaction is nul. It's just simply not in the game at the moment. Generally all AI have the same behaviour, just different 'kill / ignore' parameters. Which are buggy as well. Even the camera you're playing with is buggy and extremely difficult to work with. If your graphic settings aren't on high then nighttime is a nightmare. Everything turns into a mess of green and it becomes completely impossible to move around in the world let alone distinguish plant from empty air. After saving a 4 hour long save file every time I try to spawn in Pachy swarm and kill me, even though they weren't there when I saved. It's also worth mentioning that just having this game loaded makes my computer constantly nonresponsive, even when parked in the main menu. And yeah... as the loading screen warns about... the game WILL crash within 2 hours or so... So once you begin playing, it completely becomes obvious as to why there were delays. This game was not ready to be shipped, and is absolutely walking the borderline on it being an 'actual' game.

Lets hope we see some fast improvements, and good content in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116254327', 'num_games_owned': 110, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1000, 'last_played': 1674840131}
review:
I've watied for a game of this genre for about 10 years, and I've only known of Saurians' existance for about 3 - 3 1/2 years. In those 3 years, I watched Saurians' development arrise, from their Facebook posts, to their bi-weekly Devlogs, to their Discord announcements. Unlike some people I see complaining about the game being in a "lack of content state" as of right now, I knew that not all 3 years were spent working on assets specifically for EA launch and putting them into the belt line of production....But rather to create assets as they saw fit in the growing ecosystem. Those 3 years were divided up into a few things. 1.Research. 2.Artwork/Concept designs. 3.Figuring out what will and what will not be in the game, deciding if it felt in the range of a "game". 4.Modeling. 5.Programing. 6.Animation.7.Music/Sounds. Yes, I'm well aware that not all of those things are done by the sae person, they have a decently sized staff team for an Indie game, and not all of those were going on at once. To furter that point, adding creatures/features takes longer than you might origionally think, by doing moding, animations, skin ideas, using those skin ideas, texturing, vocalizations, A.I, stats, and whatever "unique" feature said animal would have. Side note, about the people complaining about the lag/unoptimization, I seriouslly hope you knew this was a brand new EA game, and not a 100% full release. It's widly known that EA games are buggy, lag, crash, exc. Even games that are finished/have a  large staff team have the same issues! Look at Ark. Ark is leaving EA soon, and it's still extremely unoptimized. Overall, this game is amazing/fun as it is right now, and yeah, sure, there's bugs here and there, and teh occasional crash too, but yah know what...that's what EA games are known for, and I'm ok with that <3 .I hope you guys enjoy this game as much as I do, and soak in all of the potentional it has for the future! I strongly encourage you guys to buy it if you haven't already. Here's the link to their Discord and Facebook page:https://discordapp.com/channels/127251911295369216/199945425522917376
https://www.facebook.com/sauriangame/

author: {'steamid': '76561198299447674', 'num_games_owned': 107, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 756, 'last_played': 1669507330}
review: Saurian is probably one of the best Dinosaur Simulators I have ever played. In my opinion, the game is quite easy, that is only because of the 'Save' feature. Without it I probably wouldn't have made it to adult. There are a few bugs right now, but it is still very fun and addictive to play. The achievements really want me to keep playing and unlock them all which is a good thing. If you want a realistic, 'Be the Dinosaur' type of game, then this is the one for you. I'm going to say that it might be a bit boring right now since it has just released and you can only be one Dinosaur and grow up quite quickly, so you may want to wait a while until the next couple of updates release. But it is still worth every penny! :) Here's an FPS tip for those who have 'Toaster' computers like me: put your settings on 'Very low' and change the resolution to 800x600 or less. (Going below 800x600 isn't too good in my opinion.) The game is still very beautiful on 'Very low' settings!

author: {'steamid': '76561198079415689', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 768, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1530529923}
review:
After finding this on Arvalis's art account, I was rather excited. I had adored dinosaurs when I was a kid, but sadly no game lived up to my expectations. This is the best dinosaur simulator I have played despite its many flaws as of now, although most are either extremely hard to control mobile games on janked up sci-fi crossovers.

I would not buy it if you are looking for extremely gripping and fulfilling gameplay or a bug free experience right from the get-go. There are some bugs (surprisingly few for pre-Alpha), and quite a lot of the game is empty (spaces for additional dino species I wonder? 6_6). As well as this, the AI isn't extremely intelligent. It's better than what you would get from ARK, but still. Some dinosaurs will get locked into the face-to-face bite contest (particularly rexes), and I saw a rex throwing a triceratops up into the air at one point through glitches and some dinosaurs just flat out walk into trees.

The crocodile (I.... forgot what it was called) seems to have the best AI so far. It lurks in the water and quickly goes toward any dinosaur that is unfortunate enough to come to the edge. It also does some hefty damage if it gets you from the front, so be prepared to run. Note: Do NOT use RPR on these guys, they can hit you even if you're on its back. This will kill you instantly.

Pachys seem to like coming after me, and they tend to stick in groups if others are in the area. Triceratops seem to be solitary despite the females supposedly being in groups. I expect this will be fixed in the future. Rexes and Dakotas only attack me when they are hungry, a refreshing change from the perpetually rampaging ones from ARK and a realistic one at that.

This is more of a note to the devs because I'm not sure where the bug report is.
-Killing something with RPR causes you to clip below the ground into the water underneath.
-Killing something with RPR whilst in the water causes you to endlessly sail away, and nothing stops you. You clip through trees, the ground, everything.

Pros
-A realistic looking simulator with a nicely sized world.
-Huge potential
-Some AI works as intended
-Oh thank Jeebus the dinosaurs have feathers
-A couple of hours of fun before it becomes more of a bug test
-Most bugs are rather humourous
-I actually came across Dakotaraptors of differing age groups, which was a pleasant surprise

Cons
-After a while it does get rather monotonous
-Little content, however, as the game is updated I expect this to become less of an issue
-Game looks rather terrible at night
-RPR is finicky, and has quite a few bugs
-Scent mechanic is borked

If you are willing to follow the game and help the devs weed out bugs then I would recommend it. If not, I would wait.

Oh, and I am neutral on this game for the most part, I just want to see it be supported and become much better than it is, which I believe will happen with time and the help of the community. In other words, I am hopeful. Good on you Urvogel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095792578', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 4797, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 822, 'last_played': 1656776648}

author: {'steamid': '76561198164994162', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 595, 'last_played': 1654647048}
review:
FIRST REMARKS
----------------
I KNOW THE GRAMMAR IS BAD....I DIDNT WRITE THIS FOR GRAMMAR...I WROTE IT QUICKLY WHEN THINGS OFF THE TOP OF MY HEAD CAME TO ME.


first of all, the game is great, love it, and the devs have worked their asses off!! so im not bashing them or the game itself!! but basically, ive compiled a list of things after the review i wrote below that would make the game MUCH better than its contemporaries (COUGH COUGH**....WOLFQUEST....IM LOOKING AT YOU!! ...COUGH COUGH****) 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
REVIEW  7/10 (in my opinion) 
----------
for those wanting a review of the game, id say the game is REALLY well done. however, its rather bare bones. it IS early access so thats expected. but im just being honest here. the parents usually die right at the start of the game and you find yourself MOSTLY just walking around and exploring. while this is awe inspiring, it doesnt make for a super interactive FUN game that you cant wait to wake up the next day for! this is not a criticism, just my honest opinion :) that being said...here i am passionately writing about it and playing it as i write LOL!!! so you be the judge of that!!! so yes...its fun! but its NOT challenging anndddd the lack of variance in the game is EXTREMELY boring!!!!!! again, its FUN but then again it ISNT at the same time in a weird way! also, i wish the hunger bar would go down more. its not really challenging when youre pretty much never hungry unless you sleep O.O...........
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

LIST OF THINGS TO IMPLEMENT
--------------------------------
anyways, here is a list ive made of things thatll make this game better!!!!!!:

1.) make sure that when the game comes out that the weather patterns change. just having sunny days all the time is quite boring. before anyone says anything to that......i know the devs talked about this already, but i just wanna say it anyways just because it really would be GREAT to add that to the game!!!! <3 <3 
2.) (again, i know this was talked about) implement mating rituals/mating calls. 
3.) implement aggressive calls/territorial calls.
4.) implement nesting behavior, and if the species does so, implement parenting behavior (obviously Dakota raptor will be the exception...) 
5.) implement achievement type goals in the game. lets say the animals life cycle is to grow up/mate for the most part. maybe have an achievement system which does a bit of a tutorial on what the player is supposed to do in order to gain a mate and hatch young. this way players that dont enjoy sandbox style game play can feel entertained. 
6.) implement other dinosaurs attempting to take your territory.
7.) implement territory marking/defending. (PLEEASEEEEE DO THIS!!!!!!)
8.) implement food shortages/surpluses.
9.) implement chicks (that your dinosaur hatched) that even vary in size/color SLIGHTLY. to sort of give the illusion theyre real animals, and that you are contributing to the evolution of ''your'' species you're playing. 
10.) along with changing weather patterns, changing seasons would also be cool. i.e, winter/summer etc.
11.) also, another thing i noticed is that predators dont really exhibit hunting behaviors quite like the real thing. i get it though im sure thats DIFFICULT to program... but if the''crouching'', ''stalking'' behavior was a little more polished for the predators, it would make the game better than it already is :). 
12.) introduce male courtship fighting possibly? i know we know little of dinosaurs, but for instance Pachycephalosaurus presents evidence of this. could that be implemented in that species???
13.) please please please make sure the hunger bar goes down more than it is right now. its hardly challenging cuz your dino never really seems to get hungry :((
14.) JUST thought of another thing...implement a system where if youre the predator you can sense if the prey is weaker, therefore easier to kill (just like the real deal). then itd be more realistic!

so far, thats all i can come up with off the top of my head without thinking too hard. i know thats a huge list but there ya go hahah! other than that i think the game is GREAT so far. its definitely boring for now as it is bare bones at the moment. but i understand :). sounds harsh....im sure if the devs read this theyd throw their keyboard in a rage cuz theyve worked so hard on it! i feel bad being so honest about some ones work they've poured their hearts into, but this IS a product and it i have to give my honest opinion :(( <3 but honestly, i REALLY REALLY love this game so far! if any devs are reading this, please dont take my review the wrong way! keep it up!!!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198043851786', 'num_games_owned': 1376, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 2925, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2753, 'last_played': 1602437864}
review:
Decided to take a swim with daddy Dakotaraptor. He got angry for whatever reason, then proceeded to eat me. 

Life is cruel. 

Saurian leaps for realism and authenticity. Simply put: Live the life cycle of a dinosaur during the Late Cretaceous period, simulating an accurate representation of its natural day-to-day struggle/survival. Dakotaraptor is currently the only playable dinosaur/theropod as of right now. However, the developers plan to feature a more varied selection of playable dinos in the near future. 

For the most part this game has enormous potential, it just happens to lack content thus far. Hell Creek's environment is plentiful and immersive to say the least, while Benjamin Bartlett's Walking with Dinosaurs soundtrack is simply fantastic coupled alongside the gameplay/visuals. Not that Saurian's original soundtrack isn't without merit, it's mostly subtle pieces that fit accordingly. The official soundtrack has yet to be completed/implemented into the game. 

As expected an Early Access title is not without its setbacks, bugs and glitches are commonplace, plus animations still feel mixed. For those who are still interested, it would probably be advisable to wait until new updates yield more content. 

Avid dino fans, keep an eye on this one!

author: {'steamid': '76561198082073893', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 3867, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3120, 'last_played': 1664655057}
review: It's been about half a year since the last patch, and more than a year since the last content update that was actually noteworthy. The game is 2 years into development and it is still largely the same, at this rate i expect this game to be finished within half a decade or so. Almost everything about this game is either mediocre or outright bad from the looks to it's gameplay. Saurian as of now makes for a neat, short survival experience with little to no replay value to it, and this is in no way worth it's price tag. Don't get this game, you are in no way missing out on anything here, and you're better of saving your money for something else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198172171066', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1669923233}
review: My computer isn't the best, it runs it decently on low with low resolution. The trailer is basically the game right now. You're a Dakotaraptor that has to eat, drink, hunt, and avoid predators so you can grow. The game definitely has problems right now, but it literally just came out. It lags a bit, can crash, AI can be odd, and some other bugs. But if people were expecting some awesome, polished, out of this world game right off the bat that's kind of an overly opptomistic view that will get shot down pretty quickly. I bought this game because I wanted to be a part of its growth, I've been waiting 4 years for it to come out to the public. If you can wait until some more updates, or have only just discovered it, wait. I'd advise following the game for updates and going on the official website to learn what will be coming. If you would like to begin playing and experience the growth of this game, buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102849192', 'num_games_owned': 207, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 486, 'last_played': 1579878660}
review: Saurian yeni çıkmış olmasına rağmen bence gayet güzel bir oyun ve daha oyunun yarısı bile tamamlanmamış durumda ama tamamlanınca mükemmel bir oyun olacağına eminim. İleriki zamanlarda multiplayer ve dinazor tasarımlarıda eklenicek ki bunlar daha eklenicek şeylerin çeyreği bile değil oyunda tam sürümde sadece 6 dinazor kullanılabilir olacak bu sayı değişebilirde ancak doğada çok farklı kendi hallerinde yaşayan ve dinazorunuz büyüdükçe size verdikleri tepkiler değişen çok daha fazla canlı türleri olacak. Alamaya fazlasıyla değecek bir oyun bence 10/10 ♥♥♥

author: {'steamid': '76561198036494097', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1770, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 438, 'last_played': 1634238133}
review: Отличная игра!Оправдала  ожидания.Несмотря на то, что  это  ранняя  версия, взаимодействий с миром у игрока достаточно,хороший искусственный интеллект,красиво воссозданные  биомы без резких обрывов и изменений с плавно переходящими границами,прекрасное звуковое сопровождение.Советую всем любителям дино!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198344258178', 'num_games_owned': 27, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1708195786}
review: Tras haber dejado la primera reseña del juego hace 3 años, las cosas han cambiado mucho en cuanto a mi jugabilidad y visión del juego, las criaturas son más variadas y ya no juego con lag. Pero aun así sigo esperando que llegue lo que nos prometieron, y eso esta en camino, ya que están trabajando con el Triceratops, además de estar trabajando en otras cosas, espero entusiasmado que esa masiva actualización llegue para darle vida al juego otra vez.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153469442', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1524847099}
review: Definetly worth a purchase, I have loved every second of this. Yes, All you do is survive but that is exactly why I bought it. Though I would say I have encountered a few bugs but that is to be expected in an early access game. None of the bugs have affected my experiance and they are only minor. Highly recommend if you love survival/animal/realistic/dinosaur games. I congratulate the team on paying pain-staking attention to detail. It is worth every penny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005207115', 'num_games_owned': 175, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1523028706}
review: Not really anything interesting to do in this version. Also it is very buggy with large frame drop issues even on a GTX 1080 ti. There was no point in releasing this version of the game, they should have waited half a year or a year to be able to release something more interesting. The game might turn out good in the end, but do not buy it in its current state. It's not worth your time or your money right now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198264699316', 'num_games_owned': 73, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1965, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1598567244}
review: For what it is I really enjoyed this game and it holds a huge amount of potential.I already have seen some bugs like glitching through the floor and ai just standing in place waiting for you to kill them.But being an early access game I dont hold it against it.This game if it goes in the right direction will become a fantastic game.I personaly enjoyed every second of playing it because of the hype and how long ive been waiting, I could honestly give it a 10/10 because of how excited I am.But never the less this game will become much better as the devs have put alot of time and hard work into the game wich I respect them for.So I ask you to give it time and buy the game for some enjoyment unless at times random ai standing in place and other things like instant KO's annoys you ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)

author: {'steamid': '76561198044360200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1658551052}
review:
The game needs a VERY strong computer to run. Granted my laptop isn't built for gaming and doesn't have the GeForce graphics card the minimum specs call for, but it lags even on the worst graphics settings and a comically low resolution. I very much hope it gets optimized, and soon.

Besides that, there just isn't a whole lot to it just yet. That will change of course as time passes and they make the game more complete, but at this first build it's a bit bare bones.

author: {'steamid': '76561198358917364', 'num_games_owned': 24, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1033, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1609447710}
review: At the moment Saurian is in a very rough stage. It doesint have very advanced ai (It is very buggy) and many bugs are scatterd through out. However there is still fun to be had. Running around and hunting prey,defending it from pesky archoraptors,just enjoying the graceful animations,taking on a trike. There is a lot of positives and negatives so it really comes down to your personal preference and patience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198282999018', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1530, 'last_played': 1541303820}
review:
终于等到saurian登陆steam，这次扮演的是达科塔盗龙，虽然可以选择性别，但目前好像没用。进入游戏后是雏龙（我还以为是从壳里出生开始），左上角有提示，无奈英语渣只能机翻。从提示知道父母不会管我们死活，而且变成幼龙后会视我们为猎物。获得了基础的信息后我就开始到处浪了，遇到鳄鱼调戏一下，遇到怀俄明厚头龙调戏一下，遇到三角龙调戏一下，遇到霸王龙调戏一下，至此死亡无数…
然后遇到了冥河盗龙，我想同是雏龙总打的过吧，然后不管我挑战几次，都是我打他几次都不死（血厚？），我只要被打一次就死...(ノ=Д=)ノ┻━┻（现已知道冥河盗龙只是体型较小，而不是雏龙）【重新开始新游戏后，在雏龙阶段，成功靠走位秀死冥河盗龙（一雪前耻）】


照顾一下和我一样英语不太好的人（机翻，互相体谅一下吧）

主菜单
New Game：新游戏
Load Game：读取存档
Options：设置
Credits：后期团队
Quit：退出

主菜单设置
Gameplay：游戏性
Camera Sensitivity：相机灵敏度
Show hints：显示提示
blood：血

Video：视频
Fullscreen：全屏
Vsync：垂直同步
Resolution：分辨率（只能主菜单改）
Game Quality：游戏质量（只能主菜单改）
Very Low：非常低
Low：低
Medium：中等
High：高
Very Higm：超高
Ultra：过激的

Audio：音频
Sound Volume：音效
Music Volume：音乐

想改按键只能进入游戏后，主菜单不行
ESC→ OPTIONS（设置）→CONTROIS（控制）→鼠标点要换的键位→Replace（更换）Remove（删除）Cancel（取消）

游戏里
RESUME：继续
HELP：帮助
SAVE：保存
OPTIONS：设置
SAVE AND OUIT：保存并退出

游戏里设置
CONTROLS：控制
GAMEPLAY：游戏性
AUDIO：音频
VIDEO：视频

BUG反馈方法！！！(我并不知道制作者团队能不能看懂中文，但有发总比没有好)
F1：反馈界面
SYSTEM：系统（可以看自己电脑的配置，英语渣一脸懵逼）
REPORT BUG：错误报告

bug reports will be sent to the developer with anonymous debug informattached.a screenshot of the game will be also be sent with your bug report
错误报告将发送给开发者提供匿名的调试informattached。画面的游戏也将被你的错误报告发送
leaving an email address is optional.but will allow the developer to contact you for additional information if required
留下一个电子邮件地址，optional.but将允许开发者接触你的其他信息如果需要

Email Address：电子邮件地址
optional：可选择
Description：描述
describe the bug ，including what you were doing when it happened.
描述错误，包括你在它发生的时候做的。

SUBMIT：提交
Bug report submitted successfully
成功提交错误报告

目前基本操作
WASD：移动（废话）
空格：跳跃（废话）
鼠标左键：攻击（废话）
鼠标右键：保持平衡（仅限骑龙状态，样子像是在扇动翅膀）
鼠标滚轮：视角远近（虽然移动鼠标也行，但是有区别，自行体会）
E：闻气味
H：隐藏右下角的状态
C：按一下休息，再按久一点睡觉
Q：切换走路奔跑模式（更新后大写改成Q）
SHIFT：冲刺

右下角的绿条是饥饿值，蓝条是口渴值，红条是血（废话），白色的圈是体力值，奔跑后会多一个在缩小的圈，恢复体力的方法有按c休息，大写切换走路模式。

按E键可以闻气味。（从下面开始就是自己实践出来的，可能会影响游戏体验，慎读！！！如果发现了新的内容，或者理解有错的地方，会回来添加和改正！！！）
黄色气味：肉食动物，
绿色气味：草食动物，
紫色气味：尸体（食物、腐肉？），
鳄鱼没气味，所以无法追踪。

躲避天敌
嗅觉在晚上比较有用，像我大半夜去浪，不知道前方有什么的时候，可以闻气味，由此判断周围有什么类型的恐龙。但切记对鳄鱼没用，所以夜晚过河或喝水时自求多福

背景音乐很重要，尤其是前期，可以知道有没有什么恐龙要攻击我们。包括敌意持续多久，快露出你的后背，我要扑了(๑•̀ㅂ•́)و✧（更新后，AI现在会无限期地记住攻击者攻击）

睡觉前和存档前观察周围是否有肉食动物，如夜晚看不清就要闻气味确保，当然你想体验一下进档死的话，我也没什么意见，或者你运气超好(更新后，游戏加载过程中,AI不再会移动了)


前期发育
可以吃蜥蜴：较难遇到，且走位很骚，虽然还是被我咬死了，但是大部分躲到草丛里找不到。
达科塔盗龙父母：对，你没看错，出生的时候跟着走，他们可能会和怀俄明厚头龙打，两只打不过一只的哦（你们的骑龙术呢，只会左键吗？）。会和鳄鱼打，被一口秒杀，好可怕，如果附近有别的龙，估计也会打 输吧
鳄鱼：请不要在水里和他打，我以为一只卡住了，调戏了一下然后被追，游不过，在水里好像不能加速( •̥́ ˍ •̀ू )嘤嘤嘤~，岸上的可以绕圈圈咬尾巴，害怕被咬的可以冲刺咬一下，然后重复……
骨丘鸟：（8月15日更新后增加）
其他的血太厚，我只调戏，没耐心杀_(:з」∠)_

按ESC后，右上角的AGE是年龄（一开始单纯的以为是级别，AGE 10～11发觉不对，机翻了是年龄。对于之前看了评测的人，真是对不起了）
总结
AGE 0 雏龙，眼睛绿色
AGE 1～2 幼龙，眼睛黄色，获得骑龙能力
AGE 3～5 亚成年，头部黑色，眼睛黄色
AGE 6～10 成年，头部白色，眼睛红色
AGE 11~ 14（更新后，防止玩家超过最大年龄 14）

详细【由于以下内容为更新前实践得出的，所以可能和更新后的有所不同】
AGE 0～1 吃一次就可以了，然后就是到处浪或者找个离水近的地方等着右上角出现英文，按C睡觉，醒来就是下一阶段，同时获得骑龙术（瞎编），至此看到什么龙都去骑一遍……（由于是机翻，所以只知道空格和鼠标左键）
AGE 1～2 眼睛黄色，不用按C睡觉，但是AGE 2饥饿值会开始掉。
AGE 2～3 需要睡觉，醒来没有获得能力
AGE 3～5 头部黑色，不需要睡觉，AGE 5掉饥饿。
AGE 5～6 需要睡觉，没有能力。但是骑着怀俄明厚头龙，它是甩不开我的（如果不咬死它，就会边叫边走）。骑三角龙要保持平衡（但由于机翻的原因，所以我是乱按的，目前只骑着咬死过一只），骑霸王龙会被直接甩开。骑鳄鱼（骑不到了，不知道是我手残还是成年后不行）
AGE 6～10 头部白色，当时最高只玩到8级，原因在于雏龙状态使劲作死๑乛v乛๑嘿嘿 
AGE 10～11 需要睡觉，没有能力
AGE 11～14（更新后，限制了年龄，但以下内容是之前没限制的）

AGE 16的时候发现骑不了怀俄明厚头龙，而且不主动攻击我了，受到攻击会逃跑。AGE 17的时候发现三角龙会主动攻击我。
AGE 30 偶遇两头霸王龙互怼，所以我有幸吃到霸王龙肉๑乛v乛๑嘿嘿（因为之前会被一口咬死，所以平常都是调戏完霸王龙就跑，这次吃肉中被另一头杀回来咬上一口才发现霸王龙已经不能一口咬死我了） 
然后AGE 31 杀死了一头霸王龙，从此不再是调戏完就跑，而是来啊，互相伤害啊
AGE 33 发现三角龙已经甩不开我了（可能年龄越大，骑龙技巧就越好，也越不需要靠右键保持平衡。不过我之前不能骑怀俄明厚头龙了，所以我怀疑年龄再大点，估计连三角龙都不能骑了。不过这些都是推测就是了）


达科塔盗龙目前不能爬树，从HELP：帮助里没看到有这个能力,实践中也把基础键都试了，，希望后续版本加上去，我想体验一下你咬不到我，只能仰视我的感觉。๑乛v乛๑嘿嘿 

骑龙术
总结
空格加鼠标左键：骑龙会有一条长方形，全白甩不开（怀俄明厚头龙），全红要保存平衡（三角龙），完全没有，是被甩开（或者骑不了霸王龙）。不过貌似受年龄影响，我现在骑不了怀俄明厚头龙，但是骑三角龙甩不开我了（AGE 33）
鼠标右键：保持平衡（扇动翅膀）

详细
由于机翻的意思是（一旦安装皮瓣来维持你的平衡按人民币和点击鼠标左键你的猎物的伤害），所以我不知道怎么保持平衡，尝试了很多次，也只是有次乱按WASD骑着咬死了一只三角龙。
AGE 6 以后怀俄明厚头龙会主动攻击我，所以我也是AGE 6 以后才知道骑着怀俄明厚头龙，它会甩不开我。也许亚成年就会主动攻击我也说不定，但我躲在安全的地方休息直到成年，顺便记录游戏里了解到的事，所以亚成年遇到怀俄明厚头龙会攻击我还是不攻击我，我是不知道的！

经@ZHIJEFF（steam玩家）指正，RMB（机翻：人名币）的意思其实是：Right Mouse Button（鼠标右键），对此我英语渣表示感谢。
至于操作，目前还在实践，不过已经成功在骑龙状态用鼠标左键加鼠标右键杀死了一只三角龙（第二只三角龙_(•̀ω•́ 」∠)_虽然也是乱按杀死的，但至少知道按什么键了对吧）

小细节
一、如果周围有肉食动物，按C休息的时候，达科塔盗龙会坐立不安的解除休息状态。（但貌似只是偶发事件，或者是BUG）
二、成年以后到处浪发现，在有沙滩的岸边（海边和河边）可以看到冥河盗龙的尸体
三、晚上是有星星和月亮的
四、有两条河流通往大海，所以你根据河流到了海岸边，沿岸往左或往右可能会遇到另一条河流。
五、霸王龙杀死猎物后会走开，但有时候会在尸体周围绕圈圈，不过可以乘机偷吃。
六、成年，但AGE忘了多少，骑鳄鱼，结果鳄鱼弹上天了（模型挤压？）
七、你可以在游戏里遇到达科塔盗龙从雏龙到成年的四种阶段
八、河流的尽头有大海的地方，沿岸走左边或右边，结果两边直到撞空气墙都超远的
九、海岸边会发现正在游泳的冥河盗龙
十、有些地方的空气墙是可以卡进去，虽然进去后会原地踏步，但是可以靠跳跃卡出来。
十一、往日出的方向走，可以到大海
十二、在左边海岸接近尽头的几处森林里，都有个没有和大海连接，但是水流颜色和大海的一样，也解不了渴的地方
十三、霸王龙遇到另一个霸王龙会互怼
十四、你可以拖着尸体移动，但尸体是会消失的，所以不要囤食物
十五、年龄越大，三角龙越难甩开我，而且右键的效果也比较容易看的出来（更新后，防止玩家超过最大年龄 14）
十六、鳄鱼不会死亡翻滚
十七、吃鳄鱼肉的时候，鳄鱼并没有像之前那样消失，反而是被叼着，不过我无法移动，但是可以跳跃，鳄鱼会被叼着一起动。怀俄明厚头龙、冥河盗龙、蜥蜴……达科塔盗龙可以叼着，但显示尸体在原地，叼着空气？(方法是吃肉别点太快就行，不过我发现这个的时候，AGE 是33，可能会受年龄限制)【更新后，可以叼着尸体移动，但貌似怀俄明厚头龙不能叼着了】
十八、达科塔盗龙有时候会左顾右盼，如果周围没有恐龙，那可能就是蜥蜴
十九、你可能会看到在水底的蜥蜴（更新后，有时候移动视角可以看到水底了，有时候又不行）
二十、蜥蜴是有气味的，颜色是绿色。鳄鱼没有气味，鳄鱼的尸体也没有气味
二十一、从水里出来，会甩干身体
二十二、你可以听到咬合声
二十三、走在不同地面上的声音是不同的
二十四、你可以在水里休息和睡觉，比较深但是不会变成游泳状态的地方（以后更新可能会改成窒息会扣血吧）
二十五、有些区域的水里可以攻击，不过从这个区域出来就不能攻击了（上岸后再回去那个区域也不能攻击了，但有些时候又可以【迷之BUG】）


8月6日更新后（以下是载入存档发现的，可能受年龄影响【AGE 36】）
一、【防止玩家超过最大年龄 14】但是载入存档还是之前的年龄，不过不会再加了
二、成年后下水里，鳄鱼不再一定是逃上岸，而是有可能在水里绕圈圈，如果靠近会攻击，也可能会游远
三、【不知道是不是受AI躲避行为（避开威胁而不是逃避威胁）影响！】霸王龙会被我追着咬（所以说我是威胁咯）
四、【受血贴花影响】你会看到血龙，并且血液貌似不会消失，血液覆盖头部后，会看到头部有好几条白线
五、尸体的某些部位还是会颤抖
六、载入存档可以消除血液覆盖效果
七、跟在霸王龙后面，达科塔盗龙会盯着霸王龙的尾巴一起左右摇头（如果你没被咬死的话）
八、睡觉不会增加年龄值，但会扣饥饿值和口渴值，所以睡觉前最好猎杀一头恐龙不吃完，这样醒来就可以补充饥饿值。
九、你可能会被恐龙撞死（还是踩死？）
十、霸王龙现在会把尸体吃光


8月15日更新后（因为改成最低特效依然一卡一卡的，所以暂时不玩了，等下个更新再说【第二个档，这次更新没开新档，AGE 14】）
一、奔跑模式按键大写改成Q
二、晚上的星空有银河了
三、喝海水减口渴值（脱水）
四、增加了骨丘鸟，没气味，但是尸体有气味
五、进水里可以消除血液覆盖效果
六、多了很多尖尖的石头
七、更新后的晚上和更新前的很不一样
八、晚上气味颜色和白天的不太一样
九、还没从夜间变成白天的太阳颜色是不一样的

8月29日更新后（还是卡，开新档也卡，主要是控制的达科塔盗龙，走路会一卡一卡的）
按"1"有威胁叫声，不过是原地叫的。

【不更新了，没什么意外就这样了吧】


寻找沧龙
一、想去大海的话跟着河流走，不过河流的尽头可能是大海，也可能是山，山的会有空气墙挡着
，有些在山上，有些在山下，而且空气墙附近霸王龙出现率很高
二、成龙状态下水里，鳄鱼会上岸，怕我了吧๑乛v乛๑嘿嘿 （更新前）
三、喝海水不解渴（废话）
四、往外海游很远，我只得到了已停止工作，貌似这个版本还没有沧龙

悬崖跳海（突然有个念头就浪了一晚上）
从河流的尽头沿海岸的左边开始走，转了一个大圈，最终到了海岸的右边……顿了一下，然后飞奔跳入大海，终于找到可以跳海的地方了，在海岸的右边悬崖上。早知道一开始走右边了( •̥́ ˍ •̀ू )嘤嘤嘤~


希望添加的！！！
一、AI雏龙：本想杀落单的雏龙的我，奈何只遇得到冥河盗龙的雏龙，还打不过的那种( •̥́ ˍ •̀ू )嘤嘤嘤~（现已知道冥河盗龙只是体型较小，而不是雏龙）
二、鳄鱼的死亡翻滚：想看死亡翻滚的不用尝试了，因为我没见过（死亡N次……）
三、尸体被吃时，逐渐变成骨架：游戏里是凭空消失
四、三角龙可以把比较小的树撞倒或者角插在比较大的树上暂时拔不出（你问我三角龙为什么撞树，当然是我引它撞的啦。或者后续版本达科塔盗龙可以爬树后，三角龙为了教训我，把树撞倒这种情况）


游戏体验
由于我很喜欢恐龙，所以面对别人说的视角问题、优化问题、到一个地方会卡一下加载地图、AI恐龙比较蠢问题……我是不怎么在意的，毕竟是抢先体验版，所以我相信会慢慢好起来的。
相反，雏龙到成龙所要面对的天敌和饥饿，和恐龙的对峙，为了吃上一口肉的斗智斗勇，都让我很激动。别忘了这是一个弱肉强食的史前世界。一点难度都没有，还有什么意思，更何况可以存档的耶，学我去浪啊，死了大不了读档，大不了存档的位置刚好有霸王龙，趁我加载，拿我性命( •̥́ ˍ •̀ू )嘤嘤嘤~至此存档前先观察周围有没有肉食动物，这些都是实践出来的，看我攻略安全玩到成年，不冒险还有意思吗？如果累了也可以欣赏日出日落，观察丰富多样的植被，看AI恐龙互怼。

author: {'steamid': '76561198009725095', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1518907652}
review:
I have been looking forward to this game for months since I first heard of it, and I was not dissapointed. 
Ofc the game as it is right now is still pretty basic but it has just been released right now and Early Access has only just began. It has a lot of potential and already is fairly unique with its dedication to realism and scientific accuracy, something you do not see often especially with Dinosaur games. 

It is an enjoyable experience to play, even if right now food for a Dacotahraptor hatchling can be scarce (but right now everything is subject to change and it adds challenge to the game to find a food source!). There are still some issues such as AI clipping into objects but the game has literally just been released into EA and such thing are to be expected. 

Overall the amount of details that has gone into the models and the flora and even the sound effects is just amazing and exemplary in my opinion! 

Also: I do not meet all the recommended specs for the game and I'm able to run the game on Ultra with mostly fluent frame rates (it never dropped below 24 FPS, and most the time the game runs on 30 to 40 FPS!) I'd say for an EA game it's already good optimised, and it will only get better. 

Overall I was not dissapointed and I have faith that with time this game can become something truly extraordinary. It has all the promise and all the potential, and will only continue to be better. I look forward to see how this game progresses through the course of Early Access.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050684944', 'num_games_owned': 240, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 42005, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1310, 'last_played': 1685293661}
review:
Early Access game: So Bugs, crashes, and bare bones content is to be expected. If you don't like that, I advise waiting until more is done.

For everyone else, here is my review:

Pros:

- Amazing models
- As accurate as current science allows. Even the plants are species found in Hell Creek
- Beautiful music and sound design 
- Atmospheric 
- RPR (Raptor Prey Restraint) is a unique combat style over just chasing and biting something
- Herding, Courting, and Nesting with AI

Cons: 

- The Aforementioned Early Access issues. This is to be expected and I don't mind it

This is not a game that you have challenges, quests, and a story. If you want those things, this is not the game for you. This  is a survival simulation of Hell Creek dinosaurs. Right now it's just one option, but there will be more in the future.

What this means is that you eat. You drink. You sleep. You try not to die, and try to survive. That is what you do. There is no quest to go find the golden marmoset for XP, or any sort of story.

The challenges you face are not given by NPCs, but rather are 'can I kill that prey without dying myself?' or 'if i cross this river, will a crocodile eat me?'

I for one am loving this game, even the bare bones early access it is. It has some performance issues, especially at sunset / sunrise, it has some bugs, some glitches, the AI needs to be worked on...but I'm still loving it

author: {'steamid': '76561198051469629', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 923, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 456, 'last_played': 1602544192}
review:
A long time ago when I first got Saurian, I was impressed and hopeful. Now it's been what, 2 years now and everything's still the same except for 4 new AI creatures. 90% of the promising stuff the devs show in their devlogs is just that, logs. Eye candy. Show-and-tell. All pizzaz and no substance. The devs seem to be far more interested in running a blog than actually updating their game and giving their playerbase the ability to do what an Alpha build is supposed to do: test and give feedback on features that will be part of the final product. Instead it's all done in-house, you just need to read the recent reviews to see where that's getting them.

And because of this, I've lost faith in Saurian. It was promoted to become the best, most scientifically accurate dinosaur survival game on the market, but when games like The Isle and Primal Carnage have work done to them instead of a wall of text from the developers in the form of a blog telling you why you should still be psyched for such a hollow project where the last content update added a tiny AI lizard that you'd forget was there without scent, it's easy to see why this game is quickly becoming nothing more than false promises and raising suspicions of whether or not the devs will just take what they earned and run like so many have before.

If Saurian has any chance to improve, it's in content updates that shake up the gameplay and give players variety, not running a blog about projects that will likely never be included in the game. The sooner the devs realize that their released Alpha should be the testing ground ALONG WITH the closed development version, adding other species to play as (something they dangle in our faces with every new game), and focus on implementing the content they display so proudly on their blog instead of focusing solely on their blog, the better.

Until then, my update stands. I cannot recommend an EA so hollow it makes DayZ with removed zombies look like a Triple A release.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073710056', 'num_games_owned': 309, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1547433103}
review:
-Spawn in world
-So far so good
-dad killls mom and eats her
-I also eat mom, because im hungry
-dad wonders around doing nothing
-im starving and thristy as dad stand there
-leave pack to forge on my own
-grow to a juvy
-Attempt to kill pachy, falls off after 1rst try
-dies after missing the jump on 2nd try

10/10 would become an orphan raptor again
--------------------------------------------------
Seriously though, as a backer on kickstarter for this game for welll over a year now it is nice to finally obtain some sort of playable product. The proof of concept seems great so far, and its fun to be able to play as a raptor. However, I would say that at this point that is all this game is. Nothing more than a proof of concept, which is to be expected as this is Pre-aplha. There is currently only one dinosaur you can play as, frame rates as low even on higher end pc's, ai needs some work(ie, dad doing nothing, pachys and other dinos not being afraid of my when im hunting them, and etc), and many features are missing from the game. Its a great concept that I can't wait to see excecuted in the coming months of updates. At thisp point the game is still very rough but in the future I have confidence this will be a master peice.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966405327', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1656603453}
review:
This game has a huge amount of potential. Developers have been very transparent, and as content continues to roll in I expect it to get even better. As it stands as an alpha, there's a long way to go, esspecially when it comes to AI performance. In practice though, the game operates on an engrossing concept and I can't wait to see where it goes. 
I recommend this game, but also suggest waiting till performance is stabilized and more content lands.

author: {'steamid': '76561198286655285', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 948, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 417, 'last_played': 1654412374}
review:
(Review was made on third of August 2018)

The game has a very big potential. As of right now, there isn't much content, but in the future, they will add lots of things to make Hell Creek feel alive. Just look up their homepage and their DevLogs. I understand people saying the game is boring right now, but I can give you an advice: Be patient. The devs seem to be a very nice team, and even if there is a lack of content, sometimes strange graphics and dumb AI right now, I'm totally convinced that they won't disappoint their customers and will deliver a nice and complete game in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053212531', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1574591325}
review: I have to say for the very first version of an early access game, i am very impressed by how playable it already is. It is a little rough but only because my rig is on the lighter side (everything above the recommended settings other than my graphics card: 760 and my i5 processor) but even given that my rig isnt exactly up to date i was still able to play fairly well without sacficing much on the graphics side of things. I'd say that given the next couple of months we're going to see some very big changes that will really flesh out the rest of the game. My biggest critique would have to be that the world doesn't really feel all that dangerous when there are predators nearby or i feel that it is odd that the ai doesnt hunt you rather while being a baby dahkotaraptor. Granted i haven't played all that much just yet so at the same time i do feel that my opinion isn't quite right yet if that makes sense but like i said people kept saying how much potential "the isle" had and all i have to say to that is well they're still saying that XDDDD, where saurian is already beyond the level of potential that "the isle" supposedly had, so if that doesn't tell you anything about how good this game is then you must be a dev for "the isle".

author: {'steamid': '76561198032562667', 'num_games_owned': 318, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1503496127}
review:
Saurian has been in production for a few years now and it has a good-sized group of loyal followers. This shows in the reviews  but try not to be fooled by the currently 'Very Positive' overall review score, this game is an investment rather than a product I would consider worth my money at this point in development. I pre-ordered it myself and have eagerly awaited it's release. 

First off, this is about as early access as I would ever consider buying into. It is pre-alpha stage and has almost no content. You get to play one dinosaur, a Dakotaraptor, which you start off as a hatchling and slowly progress up to an adult. You would do well to get there at all, since there is little in the way of edibles and everything in the world one-shots you from a few feet away but the progression is fair in timeframe if you can find the food required. This isn't where the problems stop though, Saurian is currently a bit of a mess of mechanics. The AI is still very early (I hope), with other dinosaurs staring into space and ignoring you completely. The graphics are suffering from an excess of contrast in this build making daytime shadows/plants ugly and night time a mess of green and brown. The controls are flaky, delayed and suffer from poor hitboxes, so combat is just clumsy right now and the overall performance of the game is satisfactory at best with mild stutter and freezing when loading new models and landscape. (i5 3570k, 16gb, nvidia 1070)

It's not all bad though, as early as it is, it shows a lot of promise. The lanscape is lovingly created and a good size with some variation to see. The dinosaur models are very detailed and well animated, although still need a little work on tranistions. The health, hunger, hydration and stamina bars all react well, aren't too high or low and look good. It's just that if you aren't an absolute dinosaur junky, this won't be enough to keep you entertained for very long.

Summary: I want to give this game a thumbs up because I think developers are good and the long term plan is awesome but I am struggling to find positives at this early stage that outweigh the negatives to any degree. IF you are a dino junky and have to buy every game with dinosaurs in, then you'll likely have a few hours of fun here but otherwise I would wait a few months for the game to flesh out a bit and for some of the obvious failing to get some dev attention.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993565692', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1561735448}
review:
Dinosaur video games often suffer from the same problem - A lack of focus on the science, and a complete reliance on pop culture, for instance, the Turok reboot saw dinosaurs as near-zombie minded animals that would attack everything on sight. People seem to have forgotten that dinosaurs were animals no different to the animals surrounding us in our daily lives.

Saurian attempts to (re)create the cretaceous world grounded in fact and accuracy, and educate its players. From the feathers covering the small dromaeosaurids to the drastic growth stages of Tyrannosaurus and even down to the vegetation that would have covered the Hells Creek formation.

The game has a ways to go to truly capture the feeling of a living ecosystem - The foliage needs more movement, combat needs more impact and weight and of course, more life needs to be added. Following Saurian from the beginning has been a pleasure, and the team have made a solid and extremely fun game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066546258', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 505, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1586971348}
review:
Es ist sicherlich viel zu früh hier ein echtes Urteil abzugeben. Hängt doch das Meiste stark davon ab wie das Spiel sich entwickelt, denn, und das kann nicht oft genug betont werden (!), es ist eine Pre-Alpha!

Derzeit ist der Dakotaraptor, einer von später insgesamt 6 Dinosauriern, spielbar ( Dakotaraptor, T Rex, Triceratops, Pachycephalosaurus, Anzu und Ankylosaurus ). Man startet als frisch geschlüpfter Hatchling und versucht über Juvenile und Subadult bis zum adulten Tier zu überleben. Zur Zeit kein leichtes Unterfangen, da die Spielwelt im Moment noch nicht mit sehr vielen Tieren bevölkert ist. Diverse Fähigkeiten wie das Erschnüffeln von kleinen Beutetieren, bis hin zum Anspringen und Festkrallen an der Beute sind aber hilfreich um letztlich doch durchzukommen.

Alles im Spiel ist nach dem derzeitgen Stand der Wissenschaft modeliert und nachempfunden. Die Devs stehen mit einer großen Zahl namhafter Wissenschaftlern in Kontakt, die alle Infos liefern und die Endergebnisse absegnen. Spezialisten für damalige Fauna und Flora, ja sogar für das Wetter und die Katastrophen der damaligen Zeit garantieren ein letztlich glaubhaftes Spielerlebnis, selbst wenn dies nur wenig in unser von Jusassic Park und Actionmonstern geprägtes Bild passt. So ist z.B. der gefiederte Rex ohne gefletschte Zähne ein doch sehr ungewöhnlicher Anblick. Doch die Welt wird sich daran gewöhnen müssen. Wwie es dem Menschen leider nur zu eigen ist, geht das natürlich nicht ohne motzen und meckern, und Leuten, die sich verzweifelt an ihren Hollywood-Monstern festkrallen, von statten. Womit wir beim Technischen des Spieles wären!

Grafisch zeigt sich das Spiel noch eher etwas bescheidener. Das es damals noch kein Gras gab unterstreicht dies unglücklicherweise noch zusätzlich. Die Umwelt sieht bei weitem nicht schlecht aus, man erahnt halt nur, das hier noch etwas an der optischen Qualitätsschraube gedreht werden muss, und sicher auch wird!
Selbiges gilt für die KI der NPC-Dinos, denn die kann zum momentanen Zeitpunkt nur als unterirdisch bezeichnet werden. Ich war immer der Meinung das ein Spiel wie Saurian mit seiner KI stehen und fallen wird, so kann man nur hoffen das ganz besonders hier im Laufe der Entwicklung sehr stark nachgebessert wird. Sicherlich ist die derzeitige KI aber auch nur als rudimentäre EA-KI gemeint, um dem Spieler wenigstens etwas von dem notwendigen Leben in der Welt zu bieten.

Auch die Steuerung präsentiert sich etwas schwamming, was grade das Jagen und Kämpfen ein wenig zum Glücksspiel macht. Auch hier wird sicher nachgearbeitet. 
Als besonders störend erweisen sich jedoch die teils imensen Lagspitzen alle paar Sekunden. Vermutlich beim Nachladen der Spielwelt. Dies, so muss ich sagen, ist definitiv ein Faktor, der den Spielspaß sehr stark trübt. Hier würde ich schnellst mögliche Nachbesserung empfehlen!

Im Großen und Ganzen, mit allem was im Moment im Spiel so zu sehen und zu tun ist, möchte ich aber behaupten, das für Dinoliebhaber hier nach den 2 geplanten Jahren Entwicklungszeit, sicher ein Traumspiel herauskommt. Zumal noch sehr interessanten Features kommen sollen. Wetter, Katastrophen, Multiplayer, Endzeitmodus und anpassen des Erscheinungsbildes des eigenen Lieblings, sind da wohl die Hauptpunkte die zu nennen wären.

Ich gebe dem Spiel hier eine absolute Kaufempfehlung. Ich denke man sollte hier nicht nach dem gehen was in diesem Moment alles geht oder nicht geht. Viel mehr sollte man sich überlegen ob man ein tolles Dinospiel haben will oder nicht. Wenn ja, so muss man immer im Kopf haben das jeder einzelne Kauf seinen Teil dazu beiträgt, das Saurian best möglich mit tollen Features entwickelt werden kann. Das Spiel jetzt zu zerreißen und nicht zu kaufen um die Verkaufszahlen zu drücken, um dann am Ende als toller Kerl dazustehen und zu sagen:"Habe ich doch gesagt!", zeugt höchstens von bemerkenswerter Kurzsicht, nicht von großer Sachkenntnis. Dies sei besonders in Richtung 'The Isle'-Spieler gesagt!

Mit knapp 1000 Stunden Spielzeit habe ich jede Menge von 'The Isle' gesehen und weiß somit aus Erfahrung, das auch bei dem Spiel nicht alles Gold war was glänzte, und bis heute auch nicht ist! Zudem zeugt es von extremer Ignoranz, diese beiden Spiel jetzt zu vergleichen, wo Saurian grade erst in EA gegangen ist und The Isle seit dem schon 2 Jahre Entwicklung durchlaufen hat. In Foren und besonders in Reviewes dick den Platzhirsch für The Isle zu geben nur weil  einem die Konkurenz nicht paßt, ist mehr als nur unangebracht, wenn nicht sogar reinweg dumm!! Um so mehr als die beiden Spiele alleine schon zu zwei völlig verschiedenen Genres gehören. Ich spiele The Isle auch gerne und viel, aber fair bleiben und beidem erstmal eine Chance geben, tue ich dennoch. Frühestens wenn beide Spiele fertig sind kann man vielleicht anfangen zu diskutieren.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988631496', 'num_games_owned': 494, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1607057836}
review:
Dieses spiel hatt sehr viel Potenzial. Es ist noch im Alpha status und wirklich weit vom Release entfernt, und das merkt man auch. Zzt. fühlt es sich eher an wie ein Walking Simulator (Spielspaß sieht für mich anders aus) jedoch darf man nicht vergessen das wirklich noch in der Entwicklung ist. Wer gerne bei der Geburt eines Titels live miterleben möchte wie es sich von zeit zu zeit verbessert der kann hier sorgenlos zugreifen. Solltet ihr allerdings einen Titel suchen der euch auch lange unterhält, dann wartet lieber noch ein paar Monate. Das spiel bietet aktuell noch nicht viel Content.

Meine Eindrücke über das Spiel:
Positiv:
+ Schöne Grafik auf Ultra-settings allerdings extrem Performance lastig und nur auf High end Rechnern zu geniessen. Ansonsten auf minimal Grafik eher unschön anzusehen.
+ Die Dinos sehen wirklich gut aus wenn man sie denn auf Ultra geniessen kann.
+ Die Welt hatt genug KI Dinos um sie belebt zu machen, jedoch übertreiben die entwickler hier nicht wie der Spawn in ARK zbsp. trotzdem kommt die atmosphäre zzt irgendwie nicht so rüber.
+ Die Spiel idee ist gut durchdacht (Jagen, Essen, Trinken, überleben)

Negativ:
- Starke FPS einbrüche die dazu sorgen das das spiel beim nachladen der Map auf 1FPS freezed
- Man kann die Grafik nicht wirklich einstellen. Nur feste einstellungen nutzen von Minimal bis Ultra. Keine Schatten oder Kantenglättung etc. Die Auflösung ändern scheint dabei kein einfluss auf die FPS zu machen. Zumindest bei mir.
- Game crashed gerne mal.
- KI noch zu blöd so das sie nicht Lebendig wirkt. Eher wie ein Lemming.
- Steuerung fühlt sich irgendwie leicht schwammig an.
- Extreme Performance lastig, hier fehlt es noch an Optimierung
- Man hatt das gefühl man wandert einfach nur sinnlos umher.
- Zzt. Kein anreiz es lange zu spielen ausser den Dino aufwachsen zu sehen. (Rumsitzen, walken, Essen, Trinken)
- Kein Survival feeling da man selten angegriffen oder gejagt wird.
- Kamera kollidiert gerne mit dem Boden so da die Kamera dicht ranzoomt.
- Der Sound ist wirklich noch sehr schlecht.

Mein System:
CPU: AMD FX 8350
Grafik: NVIDIA GTX760 Phantom
Spiel auf SSD
12GB Ram
WIN10

Ingame FPS auf minimal Settings mit 1920x1080 = 42-1 FPS im durchschnitt um die 25-32FPS

author: {'steamid': '76561198088311782', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1505729726}
review:
So, as much as I'd LIKE to recommend Saurian right now I just can't.

Because at the moment it is completely unplayable for me. 

First time I tried to open the game I got to the main menu before it crashed. Next 3 times I tried it froze at the loading screen and I had to completely shut down the program before trying again. Once I finally got back to the menu I turned the graphics down to the lowest setting (considering how many problems I was already having I thought it would be best) and after a long loading screen finally got into the game. Of course after actually getting into the game it was lagging so horribly (keep in mind this is on the lowest setting) that I couldn't even walk two steps. I tried exiting out of the game and bringing it back but even when I got back in (after multiple freezes again) it wasn't any better.

I might not have a super high end gaming computer, but my computer isn't some old heap of garbage either. But in it's current state, for me at least, this game is completely unplayable.

I backed this game on kickstarter so I really want to like it, but for anyone who hasn't already purchased it I strongly recommend that you wait until it's been updated a bit into a more playable state.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078638647', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1543188592}
review:
I know this game is in early access but I don't feel it is at a point where it should have yet been released at all. 

The game developers have been working at this for a while, and I can't help but feel they've put too much time into how accurate and pretty it all needs to look, and less time into the actual game mechanics. I honestly expected a lot more considering the amount of work and time that's already gone into it. The AI is terrible - dinos will just stand there still and let preditors eat them. The whole game feels unresponsive and slow. The camera angles feel dodgey. It's much much too dark at night on my screen yet there are no options to alter the brightness in the graphic settings.

I'd avoid. At this stage it's not worth paying any amount of money for, unless you have some hope in this game and want to support the developers. I sincerly hope this game improves, because the concept itself had a lot of potential.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081741784', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1602490118}
review:
I know it just came out, but for most of us we have been waiting several years for this games release and let me tell you it does NOT disappoint! 

Saurian is a EA game right now, but with it's stunning models, amazing yet simple mechanics and beautiful open world landscapes/scenery It's absolutely worth the money/risk. The dev team is made up of incredibly nice people who are dedicated in making this the ULTIMATE dinosaur lovers dream come true; Paleontologist approved and with an incredibly accurate representation of the Hell Creek Formation in it's glory days Saurian makes up for lost time in the Dinosaur niche of gaming.

Currently you can play through the lifespan of a Dakota Raptor, starting off as a hatchling and fending for yourself in a harsh enviroment filled with danger you work your way up to adulthood and take on big game such as Pachycephalosaurus..Or maybe even a Triceratops if you're gutsy!

More playable species are soon coming in later updates where you will be able to enjoy the stark contrasts of growing up with different familes, dodging teeth and simply surviving. 10/10 would recommend this game to anyone who enjoys Dinosaurs, or a nice surival game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051360150', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 5757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1630759288}
review:
Este Early Access es más sólido que muchos de los que he llegado a ver, tiene sus problemas pero nada que me imposibilite jugarlo e incluso disfrutarlo. Creo que la base está ahí, y está bastante bien además. La semilla de la promesa ya está plantada, y en estos 2 años de desarrollo que tendrá el juego a partir de ahora podrá florecer y convertirse en el juego soñado de simulación realista de dinosaurios.
Mi hype era grande desde hace mucho tiempo pero no he dejado que nuble mis expactativas, sabía que no sería un juego finalizado, y sabía de antemano lo que habría y lo que no, así que no ha habido decepción alguna.

Los desarrolladores son apasionados con este proyecto, es algo que se nota, y esto hace que sea más fácil confiar en que no es simplemente una estrategia para quedarse con nuestro dinero e irse de rositas, porque han estado trabajando en este juego a pesar de tener trabajos, en su tiempo libre, y sacando dinero de su propio bolsillo (hasta que llegó la campaña de kickstarter).

Deseo con todas mis fuerzas que este juego reciba el apoyo que necesita para salir adelante y convertirse en un producto acabado. Y a ser posible que exista la posibilidad de hacer más juegos como este tomando como referencia otras formaciones prehistóricas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016846693', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1629579979}
review:
Ein wirklich gelungener anfang für eine Sauriersimulation.
Das ein oder andere kann noch verbessert werden, wie die Grafik, sprich die Auflösung ich finde diese zu klein und in der Dämmerzeit kann mann kaum was sehen, ist ein komischer schwarzübergang.

Gameplay:
Die KI ist noch zu verbessern und vielleicht noch ein paar Interaktionen mit der eigenen Spezies einarbeiten
z.B: auf Gefahr aufmerksamm machen, Hilferuf, Paarungsruf für die Erwachsenen Tiere. Soweit ich weiß sind Dekotaraptoren auch Rudeljäger gewesen... u.s.w. hauptsach es wirkt realistisch.
Da es eine Lebenssimulation von Sauriern ist würde ich es beforzugen wenn noch die Vermehrung eine rolle spielen würde, also eingenen nachwuch bekommen, würde hauptsächlich die weiblichen Tiere betreffen mit Nest bauen, Eier legen, auf das Gelege aufpassen, halt je nachdem welches geschelcht man spielt.

Umwelt:
Den Tages und Nachtverlauf finde ich zu schnell, den könnte man ruhig auf die hälfte des jetzigen wertes reduzieren.
Es wäre auch toll wenn sie die Pflanzen sich beim durchlaufen sowie von Wind bewegen würden.
Schwimmen mit Wellenbewegung.

Ich hoffe das ein paar sachen die ich aufegzählt habe auch im Spiel auftauchen könnten, das wäre echt super das Spiel selbst finde ich sehr gelungen und macht auch jetzt schon spaß.
Ich werde weiterhin mit euch mitfiebern das die early access phase noch viele tolle und realistische veränderungen mit sich bringt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060484327', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 6354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1687810254}

author: {'steamid': '76561198050675631', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1502082107}
review:
I like this game a lot.
I keep in mind that the game is still in early development and while most certainly change as its being updated and more.
However it does have pros and cons
While the game is very early in development it has more cons than pros for the time being, don't let this discourge tou if you wish to buy it, however since its only in the early stages for you it may not be the best buy!
Pros
-It's dinosaurs
-You get control of the dino from the first stage in its life, and go from there.

Cons
- It's a tad laggy but an be fixed in game once playing by reducing the folliage
- The attack button doesn't seem to work but drinking and eating does
- Graphics maybe a tad out dated but thats to be expected from early development
- If you buy, DO NOT GET STEPED ON, instent death as baby dino

besides these the game is pretty great, what may not work for me may work for you guys! good luck and happy dino living!

author: {'steamid': '76561198003541937', 'num_games_owned': 373, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1501748970}
