author: {'steamid': '76561198087667590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1020, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 498, 'last_played': 1607031166}
review:
Edition : 16/08/2017
Les mises à jours (même si elles restent trop peu fréquentes pour le moment) ont permis d'améliorer un peu le jeu par rapport à ce qu'il était de base et donc de régler certains problèmes. La luminosité est enfin gérer correctement, et la nuit rend maintenant très bien et très réelle, et rajout d'une autre petit IA (une sorte de petit oiseau dont j'ai oublié le nom), permettant enfin de diversifier nos proies et d'avoir une proie vraiment difficile à attraper lorsque l'on est petit

Je remets les points positifs d'avant, et je rajoute les nouveaux à la suite : 
- Graphisme très jolie, pour de l'Unity (attention donc pour ceux ayant des problèmes avec ce moteur) c'est vachement bien géré, on est vite plongé dans l'univers de Hell Creek
- Petit tuto en début vous expliquant la base (mais vraiment la base, ne vous attendez pas à avoir des astuces ou autres)
- Modèle 3D très réussi, même si certains ne sont plus scientifiquement correcte (t.rex par exemple qui devrait au moins être chauve)
- Les lézards, surement la meilleure chose que l'on trouve dans ce jeu, + ajout récent d'un petit oiseau en IA avec d'ailleurs une intelligence très correcte
Nouveau : 
- La gestion de la luminosité est maintenant très bien réglé, la nuit est maintenant très belle, et les effets donner par le soleil sont parfois vraiment splendide

Repartons sur les points négatifs, vous verrez que peu de chose ont changé, j'ai même dû rajouté des trucs
- IA sympa mais trop simple par rapport à ce que les devs nous avaient dis, les dinosaures se bloquent dans les arbres, ils se bloquent en mangeant, les Triceratops et les Pachycéphalosaurus attaquent les crocodiles dans l'eau  sans aucune raison, à part l'IA du lézard je pense que c'est raté sur ce point, lorsque l'on voit des triceratops manger des crocodiles ...
- Aucune animation de la végétation, tout reste statique, pouvant parfois vous effacer l'illision que veut vous donner le jeu
- Les animations sont depuis la dernière mise à jour bugué, plus de transitions entre certaines comme avant, et certaines marches (comme celle des crocodiles) semblent avoir des problèmes de walkcycle (l'animation semble d'un coup s'arrêter au bout de 3-4 secondes et repart)
- Le tuto est simpa mais trop simple, pour un jeu solo, il aurait fallu je pense mettre des astuces par exemple, sur ce que les paléontologues pensent du mode de vie présumé du Dakotaraptor, de façon à ne pas obligé le joueur à faire ceci, mais à l'aiguillé de comment joué comme un véritable Dakotaraptor, parce que là tu es laché comme ça, tu n'as aucune idée de quoi faire, où aller, qu'est-ce que je peux manger, qu'est-ce qui est dangereux (quelqu'un qui ne s'y connait pas en dinosaure sera totalement perdu dès son arrivé dans le jeu)
- Enfin gros points que j'ai trouvé dommage (mais ce n'est pas un défaut du jeu en soit), on ne grossit pas en direct, pour grandir vous êtes obligé de passer des étapes (en dormant quand le jeu vous le dis), alors que pour le réalisme, je pense qu'il aurait été beaucoup mieux de voir notre dinosaure grandir naturellement. Ceci est possible, certains jeux comme Prehistoric Kingdom ont réussi à le faire, donc pour moi, c'est soit de la flemme ou du mauvais travail

Donc conclusion final : Le jeu c'est bien amélioré, et si on avait eu cette version dès le début mon avis aurait surement été différent sur le jeu. Mais il reste quand même négatif, car 2 semaines pour ne régler que certains problèmes principaux qui aurait du pour moi être corriger depuis longtemps (je commence un peu à comprendre comment marche tout ces systèmes donc je sais de quoi je parle) montre que les développeurs ne semblent pas beaucoup se bouger, voir même que seul les remarques positives non constructive comme je vois partout sur steam sont pris en compte par ceci. Ma note reste de 5/10, ça ne vaut pas plus pour le moment et le jeu reste encore loin d'être le jeu promis par les devs, MEME pour une pré-alpha

(not english version this time)

author: {'steamid': '76561198042760236', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1619113106}
review:
[i]This review was made on the day of release - Pre-Alpha 1.0.1468. Some parts may become outdated.[/i]

Ultimately, Saurian is a game of passion and determination. Having watched the game develop years ago as a hot topic around various forums, I'm still in disbelief that it's finally entered Early Access. 
There are still some pretty hefty issues in the current game version (the most notable being the random AI "freeze" that occassionally happens shortly after starting a new game, but this is afterall a pre-alpha product and is being improved upon by a team of highly dedicated developers. 

I acknowledge the issues that certain people have with the game, as it's an Early Access product; not a full release. [i]However,[/i] when it works as intended, Saurian is brilliant. You cannot help but feel like you're walking through what is essentially a very alien-planet to what we know today. At its core, it's fascinating. Even during the slower moments of gameplay (e.g. walking to my next destination) I am fascinated by this world and the unique floodplain environment of the Hell Creek Formation. 
As a juvenile, the game is brutal. While I do perhaps think it should be just a smidge easier (then again, dinosaur hatchling death rate statistics...) there is a certain helplessness you feel when even that other tiny raptor starts running towards you. In addition to this, I adore that the game forces you into developing your own playstyle. Through the younger years of the Dakotaraptor, I find it highly unique to be playing as the scavenger rather than natures wrecking ball. 

Here are my personal pros and cons with the game. Yes, there are other issues that other players have reported, but these are the ones that standout the most to me. 

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
[list]
[*] Dedicated development team.
[*] Amazing atmosphere + sound design/score. 
[*] Dynamic music. 
[*] Some of the best models and depictions of prehistoric life ever created. 
[*] Fluid and weighted animations. 
[*] Well-detailed interpretation of the Hell Creek Formation. 
[/list]

[h1]Cons:[/h1]
[list]
[*] Animals seem to freeze in place (ocassionally), but does ruin the game in some ways due to the lack of interactivity.
[*] Strange lag spikes. 
[*] Content is lacking to some players (will change over time). 
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561197960386986', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1592094644}
review:
Alright, so basically, to set up the expectations - you control a baby dinosaur and your task is to survive in the semi-hostile environment. The biggest problem you'll immediately be confronted with is eating. Food is scarce, but fear not, you have SIBLINGS. And then maybe if you're lucky, your mother/father will die and you can eat them while taking naps with then. As you do this you go.
Oh man, it's great. This is pre-alpha, so many things aren't polished or finished or tweaked to perfection yet, and you can only play as a Dakotaraptor. ♥♥♥BUT♥♥♥ there is just SO much RIGHT with this game this game- so far, it's what I hoped it would be when I supported their kickstarter.
Finally a no-bs dinosaur simulator.
As a starting point, this pre-alpha is already a high watermark, despite some expected slowdown issues etc, I can't wait to see where it goes.
If you're a fan of dinosaurs, it's so worth your time. If you're anyone else, who wants an authentic, scientifically accurate experience, it's so worth your time. If you liked Jurassic Park and wondered what the actual animals might've been like, it's so worth your time. If you're anyone, it's so worth your time.
Just my 2 cents.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073791374', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1544317409}
review:
As an avid dinosaur lover, it disappoints me to no end to see how bare bones this game is. I was hoping that combat wouldn't be as simplistic as it would be in the isle, given that its contemporary possesses a far larger selection of playable dinosaurs, but nope, as of its current state, saurian is about as shallow as a drying puddle. 

As a baby, any animal that is slightly larger than you can apparently reduce your bones to jelly with a single nip. While I don't mind the fact that you have to play as a vulnerable infant at the start of your journey, I am not cool with playing as an animal made of paper mache. Sure I can buy a crocodile mangling me within seconds if it got its jaws on me, its absolutely infuriating when a marginally larger acheroraptor drops you with a tap of its jaw. This game is supposed to strive for realism, yet there is little to no feeling of impact when animals enter conflict with one another in this game. When I attacked a acheroraptor, I expected to get bowled over and mauled, but instead I got slapped down like an underleved RPG character taking on a boss would. 

This dissapointing combat system might be slightly more tolerable if it weren't for the fact that the only prey you can realistically hunt as an infant, barring exploitation of a the terrible ai, are tiny lizards, that are at least from my experience, litterally less common than eight ton t.rexes. So far, the only times I've been able to eat are when a t.rex randomly murders a pachy and walks away from the corpse without taking a single bite of it.

I realize that the devs put a lot of effort into making this game, but maybe instead of paying painstaking detail to recreating realistic flora at least 95 percent of people won't appreciate, more time could have been spent working on ai, combat, and adding more prey species for the early game.

I'll stick around just cause I am obsessed dinosaurs too much, but unless you share a similar devoted passion, this game would appeal to almost no one in its current form.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973295718', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1641083819}
review: Even if this game were to be well polished with solid optimization and was fully feature complete I still could not recommend this for one simple reason: what is the point? Outside of taking on a personal non-scum challenge where if you die you start over and then just see how well you can do, I have no idea what I'm surviving for. There's no end-game or win condition so far. You just run around, eat and drink, make babies, and eventually die. There's no multiplayer so you can't form packs with other players or fight other players. And when you're not hungry there's very little to do. You are playing an animal so you can't craft or build so there's no Minecraft make your own goal thing going on here. It's a limited experience and I think the devs should market this as an interactive educational tool, not a game. Maybe sell lisences to museums.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072074323', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 1350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1656497628}
review:
游戏背景设定在6600万年前的地狱溪，玩家需要扮演一只达科塔盗龙宝宝在这片土地上生存下去 ；游戏目前只能操控达科塔盗龙一种恐龙，游戏内的AI恐龙种类也没有超过10种，江来会有雷克斯霸王龙，厚头龙以及三角龙供玩家操控，销售额达标后还会有追加物种:大面甲龙和安祖龙，还会推出多人联机模式
·
优点：
不错的游戏画面，恐龙模型真实严谨，动作生动自然，生态系统严格遵从6600万年前的地狱溪（植被），AI不会过分追逐玩家（这是同类型游戏的一大诟病），并没有遇见BUG
·
缺点：
游戏性不是非常理想，幼崽生长速度缓慢，成长过程中容易感到乏味，玩家无法与同物种AI合作捕猎，AI父母也不会照顾玩家吃喝，成年后不能繁殖后代从而导致玩家只能无所事事的杀戮，因为地图加载问题导致偶尔的顿卡，阴影效果不好，没有多人模式，可操控恐龙单一，AI种类也很少（毕竟EA版本）
·
·
综上所述，游戏的缺点略多于优点，所以目前阶段不建议想体验较好游戏性和想与小伙伴一起玩耍的玩家入手，但如果你是个恐龙迷或生存狂，那么你绝对不能错过这一款游戏

author: {'steamid': '76561198158451044', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1626384319}
review: Overall, this game is already good and it's going to improve over time. Of course I'm not saying that the game has flaws, but that's why it became early access. The mechanics and gameplay are fantastic, and all of the models are top notch and accurate. However the game is not yet fully optimized and the a.i. needs some tweeking. However with the amount of dedication they are putting into this game, it will be one of the best dinosaur games out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037415254', 'num_games_owned': 257, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1711193180}
review:
After years of bad dinosaur game after bad dinosaur game... I am so happy that I can finally say that this game is enjoyable... 

Now it's not perfect, it is incredibly clunky and poorly optimized, as well as that the AI is incredibly dumb... And yet it is still a fun game to play. 

Some things that I really like about this game is the focus on realism while still striving to be a fun and enjoyable experience, far too many devs only go for one of these and the game can often suffer as a result. 

Another thing is the music of this game is great, one momment it can be peaceful and relaxing and then the next you feel like you are playing a horror game.

This game is in a very early state and that is quite obvious, but what sets this aside from a couple other dinosaur survival games, is that they didn't use that as an excuse to release with actually nothing to do gameplay wise like another dinosaur game I had the displeasure of playing... Saurian actually has gameplay and goals to achieve, the most obvious goal is to survive and make it to adulthood, but there are also other things you could do such as try to get the achievents.

And finally I can say I do recommend this game, and as long as the devs keep at it I can see this becoming a great game.
(I will continue to update this review as new versions of the game come out)

author: {'steamid': '76561198200540275', 'num_games_owned': 123, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 990, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 536, 'last_played': 1620438914}
review: Okay, okay i'm not trying to kiss the developer's asses or anyhting but I just gotta say, THIS GAME IS FREAKIN AWESOME. Now this may be the EA release and yes it is $20 but what is being planned is very significant and planned out. They may not have an ETA but they have worked hard the past couple years to bring this jewel to life. Ever since I was a child I have wanted a realistic dinosaur game. This game fits perfectly with that dream making it a reality. Now I really don't want to bash on other games, but Ark and The Isle eat your fricken heart out. I would reccomend this to anyone who has a somewhat decent computer and as much love for dinosaurs as I do. Over 11/10 could use Raptor climbing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030251565', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1501724714}
review:
I simply can't recommend this game right now, not in it's current state and at it's current price.

I know a lot of people are going to give it a pass because it's early access, but if this is what they were going to give us for how long this has taken, then they should have kept it back longer. It's stutters constantly on a high end computer, with low frame rates even when it's not stuttering. The world is empty except for large dinosaurs, which I know sounds stupid for a dinosaur game but being so empty of other life makes it feel completely lifeless. The scent system seems pretty broken and only adds to how empty it feels. Most of all, the AI is useless. My parents get themselves killed immediately most of the time, and when they aren't doing that they are walking into trees, walking around in circles, or even standing there and not moving at all. I mean at least a dead parent is free food, right? In fact that is the easiest way to survive, follow your parent around until they get themselves killed and just eat them and bam, you'll be grown up before you know it!

I see the POTENTIAL, but what's here is little more then what a demo during the actual kickstarter should have been. It is absolutely beautiful, with amazing detailed models and textures. The lighting is awesome and pretty realistic. It looks great, but as far as an actual game goes... there's just almost nothing to play here.

Here's hoping it gets better. For now, you might as well just skip it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120550530', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1512957626}
review:
Uhhh been watching the game for the past 2 years. Was pretty hype but uh not so much anymore
to be frank the concept was cool and on paper the game sounds great. However the game is wonky as all hell. Even rebinding keys is busted af. For example, mouse and keyboard is horid because of the awful camera so I picked up my xbox controller in hopes of a better experience; almost had it until everything I mapped on my controller was switched around... The AI are unresponsive until provoked and with that it becomes a waiting game for adulthood.
Still kind of support the game and hope it gets better but for now this is what I think of the game...

*EDIT*
Soooooo upon receiving several comments from fans of the game, I feel as if I need to make a few things clear:

...what the hell? I didn't mention anything acting like this is my final opinion nor did I mention this being a finalized product. I said this is what I think of the game atm and that I still have hope for it. I know the dev team is tiny and like I said I still support the game but (very important) IMO this game feels terrible. At least read my review before you flame me...
It's constructive critisicm and what my main issues with the game was worth. I could have literally typed "this game is a steaming pile of horse shit" but that's not helpful at all. There's no context as to why I dislike the game, just a rude remark appointed towards the dev team and community that are all trying hard to make this game likeable. Chill out, I know it's not complete but my opinion will remain the same until we get to this point. That being said, everyone who upvotes this game and says "this game is amazing and really good" then copy/pastas a quote from the fking information of the games website is actually ruining this game... If the game is percieved as good in it's current condition then nothing will get changed. Don't be afraid to downvote and critisize  the game...

author: {'steamid': '76561198063372597', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 60962, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29392, 'last_played': 1702127738}
review:
대가리 깨져도 사우리안

2013년 가을에 개발 소식을 처음으로 발표했을때부터 이 게임을 기다려온 사우리안의 개돼지가 이야기하는, 사우리안에 대한 소개글. 스스로 대가리 깨고 또 꺠면서 쓴거 맞습니다. 현재 사우리안의 테스터 활동을 하고 있습니다.

테스터요.

(사우리안에 대한 과도한 팬심이 들어가있는 글입니다.)

공룡을 사랑하는 모든 사람들에게 추천하고 싶은 게임이지만, 다양한 컨텐츠를 원하는 사람들에게는 아직 구매를 별로 추천하지 않는 게임이라고 할 수 있겠네요.

저는 제작 발표가 되었을때부터 지금까지 3년 10개월동안 기다려왔었고 킥스타터에 40딸라나 후원까지 했을 정도로 이 게임에 애정을 가지고 기대해왔습니다. 그런데 뚜껑을 열어보니까 버그도 많고, 나오는 동물들도 별로 없고 최적화도 그다지 잘 된 편은 아닙니다. 예상했던것보다 완성도는 많이 떨어지더군요. 지금 당장 구매하시는것보다는 좀 기다리시다가 차라리 나중에 구매하시는걸 권장드립니다. 게임 자체가 나쁘다는건 아니지만 생각보다 빈약한 컨텐츠에 실망하실 분들이 많을 것 같습니다. 다시 이야기하지만 이 게임은 완성된 게임이 아닙니다.

그래도 설명할 것이 상당히 많은 게임이기에, 혹시 이 게임에 관심 있으신 분들을 위해 긴 글을 씁니다.

사우리안은 사실 너무 일찍 얼리 엑세스 게임을 내놓은 감이 없지 않습니다. 그래서 아직은 컨텐츠가 부족한 느낌이 강한데, 점차 동물들을 추가하면서(이중에는 아직 학명이 안 붙혀진 동물들도 있습니다) 정식 발매 단계에서는 약 40여종의 동물들이 이 게임에 있을 것이라고 합니다. 또한 많은 공룡들이 다코타랍토르처럼 여러 성장단계를 가질 예정인데, 이중에는 티렉스나 트리케라톱스같이 이미 있는 몇몇 공룡들도 포함됩니다. 미래에 추가될 동물 종들의 예를 들자면, 티렉스보다 큰 초식공룡, 9미터 악어, 키가 큰 익룡, 그리고 새끼 랩터가 쉽게 사냥할 수 있는 거북 등이 있습니다. 공식 사이트에 가시면 이들의 3d 모델이나 컨셉아트를 보실 수 있습니다.
다코타랍토르 다음으로 플레이 가능한 공룡들 발매 순서는 파키케팔로-트리케라-티렉스-그리고 아직 시작화면에서만 볼 수 있는 안킬로사우루스(갑옷공룡)와 안주(닭같이 생긴 공룡)라고 합니다. 사우리안 팀은 각 공룡들마다 독특한 플레이 방식을 만들고 싶어하기에, 이 과정은 꽤나 긴 시간이 걸릴 것이라 합니다. (게임 발매로부터 티렉스가 플레이 가능한 시점까지는 약 2년 정도 걸린다 추정하고 있습니다.)

아무래도 물 게이지가 너무 빨리 떨어져서 멀리 이동하기 힘든데, 사우리안 맵은 4평방킬로미터 정도 크기이며, 습지대, 해변가, 평원 등 다양한 환경이 있습니다. 참고로 아직 풀숲이 많이 울창하지 않는데, 나중에 숲이 완성되면 작은 동물들이 큰 동물들로부터 숨는 장소가 될 것입니다. 
스트리머들의 방송을 보면 티렉스가 스테미나가 많다는 이야기가 간혹 나오는데, 실제로 티렉스는 많은 작은 공룡들보다 스테미나가 많습니다. 개발자 말에 따르면 랩터가 티렉스를 피하는 가장 좋은 방법은 나무 사이사이를 민첩하게 움직이며 큰 티렉스를 따돌리는 것이라고 합니다. 물론 나무나 풀숲이 울창하지 않은 지금 상태에서는 티렉스에게 너무 가까이 다가가지 않는 것이 가장 좋습니다. 

다코타랍토르 플레이에 추가될 내용도 있습니다. 예를 들자면 다코타랍토르는 새끼 때 나무를 타는 능력을 가질 것이라고 합니다. 여러분들이 궁금해하시는 번식도 추가될 내용 중 하나인데, 다코타랍토르(랩터)가 짝짓기 춤을 출 것이라고 합니다.
또한 언제 추가될지는 불확실하지만, 계절이나 자연재해(산불, 홍수)등도 넣을 계획을 밝힌 것을 보면, 개발자분들이 자연환경 자체 또한 플레이에 중요한 변수로 생각하고 있음을 알 수 있습니다. (비가 내리는 양을 무작위로 정하는 알고리즘과 비 효과는 어느정도 개발 중인 것 같습니다.)

이 게임에 나온 모든 다른 동물들은 유저가 아니라 인공지능으로, 주인공처럼 체력, 스테미나, 배고픔, 목마름 게이지가 있고 생존하기 위해 움직입니다. 게임을 하다 보면 공룡들이 물을 마시러 강가로 가는 모습과 배부른 티렉스가 주위에 있는 다른 공룡들을 무시하는 모습을 볼 수 있습니다. 
이렇듯 동물들이 모두 자신의 인공지능으로 판단하고 움직여야 하기 때문에, 한 동물을 게임에 넣기까지 생각보다 많은 개발자들의 노력이 필요하며(특히 여러 성장 단계가 있을 경우), 버그가 발생하기 쉽습니다. 이 인공지능을 개선하는 것도 개발자들이 현재 집중하는 부분 중 하나입니다.

참고로 배고픔 게이지에 대해 설명을 하자면, 먹이를 먹을 때 차는 짙은 초록색 게이지는 배에 들어간 먹이양을 뜻하며, 소화가 되면서 짙은 초록색 게이지가 떨어지고 옅은 초록색 배고픔 게이지가 찹니다. 배에 들어간 먹이가 모두 소화되면 배고픔 게이지가 떨어지기 시작합니다. 
스테미나는 걸을 때는 느리게, 앉아 있을 때에는 빠르게 회복됩니다. Q 버튼을 누르면 스테미나가 소모되지도 회복되지도 않는 빠른 걸음 상태가 됩니다. 빠르게 달리기 위해서는 그 경보 상태에서 벗어나야 합니다.

게임을 해 보신 분들은 티렉스나 랩터 등이 깃털이 있다는 것을 눈치채셨을 텐데, 티라노사우루스는 최근 몸 대부분이 비늘로 덮여 있었다는 것이 밝혀져, 사우리안 제작팀은 이에 맞춰 바꿀 것이라는 의향을 밝혔습니다. 하지만 랩터들의 경우에는 깃털이 있었다는 증거가 뚜렷해 유지될 것으로 보입니다.
사우리안 팀은 공룡 과학 고증에 맞추기 위해 전문가들과 소통하고 개발자들 스스로도 논문을 읽으며, 앞으로도 최신 과학을 반영해 계속 업데이트할 것이라고 합니다. 
(고증의 예를 들자면, 다코타랍토르가 앞으로 6-8미터를 점프하는 능력은 공기역학 과학자의 조언을 따른 것임니다. 여기서 게임팁을 드리자면, 점프 성공 확률을 높이기 위해서는 먹이 뒤로 가까이 다가가서 짧게 점프를 하는 것이 좋습니다.)

많은 분들이 게임 컨텐츠에 비해 2만원이 넘는 가격이 비싸다 생각하실 텐데, 저도 동의합니다. 이 가격은 정식 발매 가격을 기준으로 정한 것이며, 정식 발매를 한다 해서 가격을 더 올리지 않을 것이라고 합니다. 실제로 사우리안 제작자분들 중 한명의 말에 따르면, 게임을 나중에 산다 해서 더 비싼 가격에 사는 게 아니니, 아직 게임이 부족하다 생각한다면 나중에 사도 된다 하셨습니다. 하지만 동시에 얼리 엑세스 수입이 게임개발에 큰 도움이 될 것이라고 하셨습니다. 고로 이 게임을 지금 사시는 분들은 게임에 투자를 하는 셈입니다.

게임 개발자들은 공식 사이트에 2주마다 게임 개발 현황을 올리니, 관심 있으신 분들은 참고하시기 바랍니다. 개발자들은 당분간은 게임 내 버그 해결이나 최적화에 집중하겠다 밝혔습니다. 

어떤 분이 운석충돌을 언급하셨는데, 이 모드는 정식 발매 후에야 나올 예정이니 오랫동안 보지 못할 것 같습니다. 운석 충돌 이후를 생존한다는 생각으로 플레이하는 모드입니다.

마지막으로, 위에서 말했다시피 사우리안은 정말 버그가 많아서, 현재 개발자 분들이 버그 개선을 최우선으로 삼고 있습니다. 많은 버그들이 사라진 후에 게임을 사는 것을 진심으로 추천드립니다.

사람들이 사우리안을 보고 컨텐츠가 없다고 이야기해대지만 제가 아직도 사우리안을 지지하는 이유는 지금 개발되는 공룡 게임들 중에서도 제작자들이 공룡에 대한 애착과 지식이 매우 뛰어난 편에 속하며, 이를 이용해서 게임을 제작할 수 있는 역량을 가장 잘 갖추었다고 생각하기 떄문입니다.

-----
11월 17일자 업데이트에서부터는 심각한 발적화 때문에, 게임을 제대로 플레이할 수 없습니다. 당분간은 구매하지 않으시거나 플레이하지 않으시는걸 추천하는 바입니다.

-----
1월 8일자 업데이트에서 심각한 최적화 문제가 해결되었습니다.

-----
제가 군대에 가서 사우리안의 업데이트 근황들에 대해 설명해주기는 더 이상 힘들 것 같습니다. 

-----
2019년 10월 6일 전역! 2019년 호주 브리즈번에서 열린 세계척추고생물학회에 가서 개발진과 만나서 이야기도 하고 좋은 시간을 보냈습니다.

-----
전역은 한지 오래고 사우리안 개발소식 처음으로 들은지 6년이 지났지만 저는 계속 개돼지입니다. 

-----
사우리안에서 드디어 트리케라톱스를 플레이할 수 있습니다.

-----
개발자 로그를 보시면 아시겠지만 현재 플레이어블 티라노사우루스를 개발중에 있습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198160298419', 'num_games_owned': 104, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1598761522}
review:
Definitely a promising game. Can't wait for full release.

Finally a game that actually cares about what the animals actually looked like and doesnt care how pathetic or ridiculous these creatures looked like with feathers. Already can see that it will probably surpass Ark, The Isle, and Primal carnage, etc. in popularity. Very buggy but that is to be expected from an early access game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198388798622', 'num_games_owned': 25, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2754, 'last_played': 1552951944}
review:
I unfortunately have to not recommend this. I really hope this game gets better, it has more potential than most games, but the Devs are going about developing it all wrong.

[h1]TL;DR Sentence:[/h1]
[b]The Devs seem more focused on a beautiful, perfectly accurate Hell Creek environment than actual content, mechanics, and enjoyment of the game.[/b]

[h1]Detailed Review:[/h1]
The Devs need to focus less on adding more meaningless creatures that do not affect your gameplay at all and also less on making them perfectly scientifically accurate, they are getting nowhere having to constantly remake the animals. I also noticed that it feels like they are making a museum exibit and not an actually enjoyable game to play. You feel more spectator than actually involved in the ecosystem. They've added a lot of small unimportant creatures that don't change gameplay but we don't even have all of Dakotaraptor's base content like nesting, we do not even have dying of old age yet! The only actual mechanics that has been added since release is climbing/gliding, which doesn't change gameplay very much honestly, and gradual growth, which looks really great but stuff like that shouldn't be what the Devs are working on right now! They need to be working more on core gameplay than polisher stuff like that.
The Devs seem more focused on a beautiful, perfectly accurate Hell Creek environment than actual content, mechanics, and enjoyment of the game.

The Devs have a great informative Devlog ever few weeks which is great, they are also friendly, but the updates are very slow to come. They show great animations and models, but when added, the creatures don't change the gameplay! I mean, do we really need both Acheroraptor and Pectinodon at this very early stage when Dakotaraptor breeding isn't even in?

There is also not nearly enough mechanics and content to keep you engaged. You grow up, sure, but then think, "Alright, now what?" since there's nothing new past Adult stage. No breeding, territory claiming, not even dying of age to strive for.

[h1]Rating:[/h1]
I'd recommend you wait a long time, maybe until full release if the Devs can stop being perfectionists and ever make what they consider a full release.

Rating: 3/10\

EDIT: Devs have stopped posting devlogs and are silent now. This game could have been something special, now I am thinking it will never leave very early access. :(

~~~~
Thank you for reading!

author: {'steamid': '76561198141355341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4952, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1629692922}
review:
For an EA game, Saurian is incredibly polished. It is not without it's bugs and kinks, but gameplay is solid, stable and enjoyable. There might not be a lot to DO but there is PLENTY to explore, and the nature of the AI make you feel as though you are actually experiencing what life was like 66 million years ago (when they arent bugging out). While it might not be overflowing with diversity (yet), Saurian still offers a dynamic ecosystem worth countless hours of entertainment for those who like to roam in the footsteps of dinosaurs. This game still has a lot to implement, but the dev team seems committed to making their game the best it can be, and I am excited to watch it grow and expand. 

Saurian already has a big thumbs up in gameplay and visuals, and it's only going to get better.
If you like dinosaurs, I HIGHLY reccommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053293536', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2636, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1628110853}
review:
No turtles implemented yet, 0/10

In all seriousness though, I've been following the progress of the team making this game for years, and they have my full confidence that this game will turn out brilliantly. However, the game is very bare-bones and buggy right now, and while I enjoy it even in its current state, you should probably only get the game right now if you're really into dinosaurs (like me) and/or enjoy watching a game develop and get better over time (also like me). If you're just looking for an immediate full, polished gaming experience, I would recommend you check back in a few months.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061165003', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1501725607}
review:
A pretty fun experience.

While there isn't much content as of yet, the game in its current form is worth a buy for any dinosaur or animal enthusiast. As of writing this review, you're able to take control of a Dakotaraptor from infancy to adulthood in the dangerous, prehistoric Hell Creek. You can explore the terrain, though there isn't much variation, and encounter other animals (including the famous Tyrannosaurus rex) through the eyes of your raptor. The game itself isn't very optimized, but, as it is Early Access, I'm optimistic in that regard. The animal design in the game is famous for having the most paleontological accuracy of any game out there, and it really shows. The attention to detail in each creature provides for a very immersive experience, as the dinosaurs feel right at home in the environment. Definitely purchase this game if you'd like to support the devs, and be sure to keep an eye on it even if you don't want to buy it in its current state. 

8/2/17 (I will update this review at the next major game update.)

author: {'steamid': '76561197989019214', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 339, 'last_played': 1656526688}
review:
Pre-Alpha Review. Will update with the game development.

_______________________________________

(Review as of 31/07/2017)
Saurian is a long time coming for most of us. Probably the first full 3D dinosaur game in history that has a sole and proper focus on realism in it's creatures and environments. It's still a pre-alpha, there isn't an absolutely huge amount to do other than survive but what's there is an exciting indication of the future.

To explain the current gameplay; 
Basically you begin life as a Dakotaraptor hatchling, it's quickly explained that Dakotaraptors are terrible parents (and one will usually eat one of your siblings just...to prove that point) and you're then off to fend for yourself. You'll start life scavenging and hunting small lizards before you progress in a vaguely Isle-esque system in that the longer you survive the more exp you accrue until the point you can develop into the next maturity stage. Other than yourself (only Dakota playable for now) you'll find Triceratops, T.Rex, Pachycephalosaurus and a handful of other ambient creatures such as particularly brutal little crocodiles. 
You wander the world, meet other dinosaurs, run away from other dinosaurs, and try to survive. It feels like a living and breathing ecosystem wherein there's other stuff always going on even if you're not involved. It's definitely a little buggy and janky, the night-time looks absolutely bizarre with weird colours and effects everywhere, and swimming is a crapshoot as to whether you'll make it or begin incessantly vibrating... but it's a pre-alpha, you go into this looking for the beginnings of a game that could be something special, and I think that's what Saurian is.

And to finish off I'm just going to go ahead and plug my own gameplay of it under the guise of showing you guys what the game is like but really just whoring myself out for views.
Much love.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FKCeiIPo-mo

author: {'steamid': '76561198073961258', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 728, 'last_played': 1681546218}
review:
In my opinion, it is worth a buy.

Let me just say this right now. If you are looking for an incredibly hooking experience that will supply you with joy for weeks on end, this is not it. This game does not have a lot of content, and that should be expected given that it's living the life of an animal. An animal's life isn't as varied and as engaging most people think it is, as its the simple style of doing everything an animal does: eating/hunting, drinking, fuckin, you know, the 3 necessities.

Rather, it is a game that one can have a lot of fun with experience in a session or two, and being a worthwhile memorable experience that one would come back to once in a while. If the devs play their cards right I can easily see it becoming another one of those obscure gems that people remember fondly.

For what it is right now, I say it is worth the purchase.
